loans.name: Genesis Estefany

texts.es:
Génesis tiene 18 años de edad, tiene 6 meses de gestación y vive junto a sus padres en la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Maneja junto a su madre un negocio de venta y distribución de productos avícolas y embutidos en el mercado de la ciudad. Su madre empezó en el negocio hace seis años pero enfermó repentinamente y debe ser operada en la ciudad de Lima. Entonces se vió en la necesidad de empezar a administrar el establecimiento desde hace seis meses y durante este tiempo ha trabajado por mantenerlo.

Ella recibe temprano la carne de pollo y la distribuye en pequeñas tiendas de la periferia de su ciudad, luego vuelve a su establecimiento y empieza a ofrecer su mercancía al por menor a sus clientes habituales. Genesis nos cuenta que en esta temporada la demanda de los clientes se ha incrementado por lo que está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles para ampliar su negocio.

Ella desea seguir creciendo como empresaria y además estudiar una carrera técnica para asegurarle a su hijo un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Genesis is 18 years old, is 6 months pregnant and lives together with her parents in the city of Lambayeque, located 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. With her mother she manages a business for selling and distribution of poultry and sausage in the city market. Her mother started the business 6 years ago but fell ill suddenly and so the business must be operated out of the city of Lima. Genesis saw the need to start administering the business for the last 6 months and during this time has worked to keep it going. She receives the chicken meat early and distributes it to small stores in the outskirts of the city. Then she returns to the business office and begins to offer her merchandise at retail to her regular customers. Genesis tells us that this season the demand from her customers has grown and so for the first time she is asking for a loan of 800 PNS from Edpyme Alternativa to grow her business. She wants to continue growing as an entrepreneur and also to study a technical career to ensure a better future for her child.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy chicken meat to grow the business

loans.name: Jonevan

texts.en:
26-year-old Jonevan is a rice farmer. He has a 5-year-old child with his wife Althea. He cultivates his land for rice crops and he is happy to share that his crops are flowering now. He wants to make sure that his crops will not dry out and die.

Right now, he does not have the capacity to fund his farm so he sought the help of Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a microfinance institution in the Philippines and a Kiva partner. He applied for Php 12,000. This loan will be very useful to Jonevan because he can now purchase fertilizers and other inputs for his farm to ensure an abundant harvest.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is a strong woman and, at 54, she is still capable of farming. She is married to Romero and the eldest of her four children is 29 years old.

Natividad helps her husband till their rice farm. It is where they get their income for the needs of the family. She aims to give her family better living conditions so she applied a for loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She is hopeful that this loan will be a big help in achieving her goal in life.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: Shirley is a rice farmer in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She is 50 years old and has 7 children with her husband Francisco. She believes that a combination of adequate finance and proper care should be enough to succeed in farming. She joined CEVI in 2008 and acknowledges the big help it was, not just to her but to other farmers as well. Now she is applying for a loan of PHP 12,000. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other products to keep her farm healthy so that it produces an abundant harvest.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Alao

texts.en: M. sells palm oil in drums and gallons. He has been in this business for ten years. He is married with four children, and he is 36 years old. He lives in Uboba, Oyo State, Nigeria. M. is soliciting a loan in the amount of 180,000 NGN to improve his oil business. He thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en: Rudy is a diligent 56-year-old farmer. He is married. Out of his 5 children, the eldest is 19 years old. He cultivates his land for rice crops. He wants to increase his income from farming so he exerts extra effort to ensure his farm is in a good condition. He also sought the help of CEVI, an MFI in the Philippines and also a KIVA partner. He joined the MFI a year ago and is grateful for the financial assistance he availed of. Now, Rudy is applying for a loan of PHP 12,000. He will use this loan to finance his farm. This loan could also help him improve his living condition.

loans.use: To invest in his farm

loans.name: Digna

texts.en: Digna tills her 1-hectare rice field with patience. She is 46 years old and has been married for 24 years to her husband Cristituto. They have 2 children, the elder of whom is 17 years old. Like other farmers, she thinks that adequate funding is needed to ensure a good harvest. In 2008, she became a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She said that even now, she still experiences the goodness the MFI brought to her life. Digna is now applying for a loan amounting to PHP 8,000. This loan will go to farm products and payment for the laborers who helped at her farm.

loans.use: To buy farming products and pay laborers

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Rice is one of the major crops sowed in Agusan Del Sur. Alicia is one of those who cultivate their land for rice crops. She is a 55-year-old married woman. She has seven kids and her eldest is 29 years old. She admits that right now, she lacks the capacity to fund her farm. Her farm, according to her, really needs to be supplied with farm inputs. She is requesting to borrow 12,000 Philippine pesos from CEVI, a Kiva partner. Alicia sees this opportunity as a big factor in her aim to have an abundant harvest.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Armando

texts.en: Armando, 53, is a rice farmer. He is married and has seven children. He takes good care of his farm. He said that his last harvest was good and he aims for the next harvest to be better. But he is still short of capital to fund his farm. To supply his financial need, he joined CEVI, a Kiva partner, and applied for a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos. He will use this loan for the farm inputs lacking at his farm and also to pay the laborers who help at his farm. Receiving this loan is truly useful for him because he will now achieve the kind of harvest he wants.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Oyebode

texts.en: Oyebode sells building material, and he has been in this business for the past twenty years. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. Oyebode is 55 years old and married with five children. Oyebode is requesting a loan in the amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase more building material in order to increase his sales and to meet customer demand. He thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building material

loans.name: Deysi Janet

texts.es:
Deysi tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado una hora y media al norte de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años es propietaria de un pequeño negocio que brinda servicio de fotocopias, tipeos en computadora, impresiones y venta de artículos escolares. Su establecimiento se encuentra ubicado frente a un colegio estatal del distrito por lo que resulta de mucha ayuda a los estudiantes de la zona. Con el dinero que percibe de este negocio ayuda al sostenimiento de su hogar.

La constante demanda de los estudiantes por su servicio hace que constante mente tenga que renovar el material que necesita para trabajar con los tipeos, copias e impresiones (hojas bond, tinta, toner, etc). Comprar estos productos por unidad le resulta muy caro y poco rentable para su negocio, por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra al por mayor de estos productos y de esa manera tener un stock permanente con el cual pueda seguir trabajando.

Su sueño es estudiar la carrera de psicología en una universidad de la región y brindar este servicio en su distrito. Ella es una joven trabajadora, alegre y responsable.
texts.en:
Deysi is 18 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the Olmos district, located an hour and a half north of Chiclayo.

For two years, she has had a small shop that offers photocopying, typing, and printing services and sells school supplies. Her business is located across from a high school, which means there are many students nearby. The money from her business helps to sustain her household.

The great number of students that frequent her shop means that she constantly needs to replenish the supplies needed for her photocopying, typing, and printing services (bond paper, ink, toner, etc.). Buying these items individually is very expensive and not lucrative for her business, so Deysi is seeking her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa. She will invest the 700 Peruvian nuevos soles requested in the purchase of wholesale items, and in this way she will be able to maintain a permanent stock of products for her business.

Deysi's dream is to study at a local university to become a psychologist and to bring this service to her district. She is a hardworking, happy, and responsible young woman.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for her business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca has been married to her husband Rogelio for 36 years. They are blessed with four children. Having their own rice field, Rebecca is very grateful she does not have to till other people’s land like other farmers do. Her farm still needs additional inputs, but she does not let herself worry anymore because she has been a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. for a year now. She requested to borrow 12,000 Philippine pesos. This loan will be used to fund her farm. In due time, Rebecca will have an abundant harvest.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en: Danilo is a 46-year-old farmer. He tills his land for rice crops. He has been married to Julie for 16 years. Their five children are still young. The eldest is only 15 years old. Danilo dreams that all his children will finish schooling and have a better future. That is why he makes sure to manage his farming business well. He sought the help of CEVI, an MFI in the Philippines, and applied for a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos. He will use this loan to buy the inputs he needs, like fertilizers and seeds. Receiving this loan is truly worthwhile to Danilo because if his harvest is good, he will have a good income as well and can even save for his children’s future.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: El señor Arturo D. es casado con la señora Marlen  quien se dedica al hogar y al cuidado de la familia,tienen un sobrino que los apoya económicamente ya que el trabaja y contribuye con sus ingresos porque vive con ellos y es parte de la familia. El señor Arturo labora para una empresa desde hace 7 años en el área de producción. Como una familia unida están tramitando este crédito para resanar la barda y levantar muros en el frente de su vivienda, para brindarle a su hogar una mejor apariencia y seguridad.
texts.en:
Arturo D. is married to Marlen, who is a homemaker and takes care of the family. They have a nephew that helps support them financially because he lives with them and is part of the family. For the last seven years, Arturo has worked in the production department of a local company.

As a family, they are requesting a loan to repair the plaster on their fence and to build walls in front of their house to improve their home's appearance and to increase its security.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair plaster on their fence and to build walls in front of their home

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 25 years old and married. She has two children; the eldest is three years old. Helen has dreams for her young family. Like any mother, she wants her kids to go to school and finish college and hopefully find a decent job. Helen’s business is rice farming and from her last harvest, she noticed a positive change to her income.

A member of CEVI for a more than a year, she applied to loan 10,000 PHP. She will use this loan to purchase farm supplies that she needs for her farm. Hopefully, she will have profits again and be able to save for her family’s future.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon learned to love farming. She is 52 years old, married, and has four children. She focuses her attention on rice farming because it gives her family income. She plants rice in her field, and right now, she is in need of farm supplies. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other supplies lacking at her farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: El señor Carlos Alberto es casado y vive con su esposa la señora Wendy Adriana Corpus y son padres de familia de 2 niños en edad escolar. El señor Carlos inicio su negocio de enderezado y pintura hace 9 años, el cual esta dando muy buenas ganancias ya que los clientes lo buscan porque realiza muy buen trabajo y además es económico, pero ahora desea invertir en mas pinturas y materiales para realizar enderezados ya que quiere convertirse en proveedor para otros pintores y además seguir con su taller. Es por tal motivo que esta solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Carlos Alberto is married and lives with his wife, Señora Wendy Adriana Corpus, and their two school-aged children. Carlos started his automotive body shop 9 years ago, which generates very good earnings. His customers look for him because he does very good work and is also very economical. Now he would like to invest in more paint and materials, since he would like to become a provider to other body shops as well as to continue with his own shop. For this reason he is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in a body shop

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a rice farmer. It puts a smile on her face when she knows her farm is in good condition. She is 45 years old and married to Salvador. They have four children; the eldest is 20 years old. 

Still in need of fertilizers and other supplies, she applied for a loan of 12,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She became a member in August of 2008, and is grateful for the financial assistance she and her fellow farmers were able to obtain. She said that because of CEVI’s program, she learned how to save and pay back at the exact time. She also thinks of its microinsurance program as a great benefit to her and her family. The loan she applied for will be used to fund her farm.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo is happy to be a farmer, not just because his farm provides food for his family, but also because he can sell to and be of service to others needing rice. He is 30 years old, married, and has three young children. His oldest is only seven years old and is enrolled in a school in their town. 

According to Leo, his farm still lacks funding. He applied to CEVI and asked for a loan of 12,000 PHP. Leo will use this loan to fund his farm and hopefully be able to expand his business and market.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson owns a hectare of cornfield and three hectares of rice fields. His major income comes from his rice crops. At 50, he has been married for 26 years and has six children with his wife, Rolinda. Nelson needs additional capital for his farm. He applied to CEVI and asked for a loan of 12,000 PHP. He will use this loan to purchase supplies like fertilizer to ensure an abundant harvest.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Alona

texts.en: Alona has three children; the eldest is 21 years old. Alona is 43 years old and married to Porforio. She works hard for her family, especially for her children’s education. She ventured into the rice farming business and has asked for a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She needs 12,000  PHP to fund her farm. Receiving this loan will be truly helpful to Alona and her family.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Jou-Ann

texts.en: Jou-ann, 21, is the young mother of a one-year-old. She has been married to her husband, Melchor, for three years. She is a rice farmer and is happy that her rice crops are now flowering. She needs supplies for her farm to ensure her crops will be healthy and will produce a good harvest. She applied to loan 12,000 PHP form CEVI. This loan will help Jou-Ann fund her farm.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en:
Warlito is a farmer. He develops his land for rice crops. He wants to improve his living condition. Despite many challenges in farming, he is still eager to succeed in life. 

In 2008, he joined CEVI and still enjoys being a member. He said that he learns a lot from the Biblical Reflection. He is also grateful, not just for the financial service, but for the savings and microinsurance as well. He is now requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP. He will use this loan to fund his farm and hopefully have better income on his next harvest.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Jeanne Ann

texts.en:
Jeanne Ann, 26, has a three-year-old child with her husband, Randy. They have been happily married for two years. Jeanne Ann is a rice farmer in her town in Agusan Del Sur. She patiently tends her rice field. She said that her rice crops are still young and she makes sure to give enough attention to them. 

Jeanne Ann needs additional farm supplies to keep her crops healthy and growing. She requested from CEVI a loan of 12,000 PHP. She will buy fertilizers and other supplies for her farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other supplies

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos wishes to improve his income. He is 55 years old and a rice farmer. He resides in a town in Agusan Del Sur. Rice is one of the major agricultural crops in his town. 

Carlos shared that his rice crops are still young and need fertilizers and proper caring. He requested a loan of 12,000 PHP from CEVI, a Kiva partner. From this loan, he will buy the farm supplies he needs for his farm. Hopefully, he will have better income on his harvest.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Yitza Margarita

texts.es: Yitza Margarita tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar en Fundación León 2000, por lo que es un buena cliente ya que le gusta pagar en tiempo y forma. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa, hace más de 8 años que trabaja en este negocio, por lo que surgió con la necesidad de cubrir los gastos de la compra de la canasta básica es por ese motivo que siempre le ha gustado este trabajo porque además puede obtener muchas amistades. Para el futuro le gustaría sacar adelante a su familia y establecer su negocio en un buen lugar. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo y así comprar sabanas, ropa interior, calzado, toallas y manteles.
texts.en:
Yitza Margarita has worked with “Fundacion Leon 2000” for a long time because she is a good client and likes to pay properly in due time. Her economic endeavor is the sale of clothes. She has worked in this business as of more than 8 years ago, when the need arose to cover the expense of basic household necessities. For that reason she has always enjoyed this work and in addition because she can make many friends. In the future she would like to improve her family’s condition and establish her business in a good location. The financing she requests is for working capital in order to buy sheets, underwear, footwear, towels and tablecloths.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Mrs. Nenita A. is a married woman living in the town of Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She has two children and the eldest is 18 years old. She is in the rice-farming business. She joined CEVI a year ago for the financial service that she could use as a capital to run her farm. Now she is requesting to borrow 12,000 Philippine pesos. One of the reasons she stayed with CEVI is because of the low interest rate. Nenita will use her loan to purchase farm inputs needed for her rice farm.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en: Emelyn, 44, is a rice farmer for her livelihood. She is a married woman from Agusan Del Sur. She patiently tends her farm to ensure a quality harvest. She likes farming because it provides food for her family and other families who buy from her as well. Her rice field needs funding; that is why she applied to CEVI and is now requesting a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos. She will buy the necessary farm inputs she needs out of this loan. Receiving this loan will be truly worthwhile to Emelyn as she reaches her goals in life.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su madre en el caserío la Huaca, distrito de Olmos, ubicado una hora y media al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Es propietario de una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado muy utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) desde hace cinco meses. El brinda servicio de transporte de pasajeros en Olmos y sus caseríos. Anterioremente se dedicaba al comercio de chatarra, pero no le resultaba rentable, así que con sus ahorros compró el vehículo que actualmente usa para sustentar a su familia.

El contínuo uso de su unidad móvil y lo agreste de las carreteras por donde circula ha ocasionado algunos deperfectos en el motor. Por este motivo está solicitando por primera vez   a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles para hacer las reparaciones necesarias y continuar apoyando a su familia.

Su más grande anhelo es instalar una tienda de abarrotes en Olmos para que sea administrada por su madre. El es un joven responsable y que desde hace mucho tiempo vela por el bienestar de su madre.
texts.en:
Jose is 25 years old and single, and he lives with his mother in the la Huaca hamlet in the Olmos district, which is located an hour and a half to the north of Chiclayo City. He has owned a “mototaxi” (a motorvihicle frequently used for the transport of cargo and passengers) for five months. He offers transportation services to passengers from Olmo and its hamlets. Previously, he sold scrap metal for a living, but it was not profitable, so with his savings he bought this vehicle with which he can now actually provide for his family. The continual use of his vehicle and the rough roads of his circuit have caused some motor damage. For this reason, he is seeking his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 800 new soles in order to make the necessary repairs and continue to provide for his family. His greatest wish is to set up a general store in Olmos for his mother to run. He is a responsible young man and has looked after his mother for a long time.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costs of repairing a motor vehicle (mototaxi)

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is 45 years old. She is married and the mother of eight children. One has completed teacher training school while the others are still schooling.

Ama is a baker who uses flour for her production. She has been in business for fifteen years now despite the challenges she faces. She bakes bread, cake, meat pie, plantain chips, etc. and sells them at retail to her customers. She sells them by herself in the market center, and people also take bulk delivery from her.

Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials, since prices are going up. She requests a loan to remain in business and increase her profit as we approach Christmas. With the loan she believes she can provide for her family and most especially her children's education.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open an Internet café in Cruz Pata

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 37 years old. She is married with two kids and lives with her family.

Grace sells fresh eggs in her neighborhood. She balances her stock of eggs on her head and moves around to sell. She says the price of eggs has almost doubled over the last few months. With this loan, she wants to buy more crates of eggs to avoid the constant price hikes. She hopes to save more income to support her kids in school. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more crates of eggs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and dirt for her fields

loans.name: Maria Jesus' Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario El Almendro esta formado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y que tienen una buena amistad entre ellas. a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

la señora Maria Elba F., es la lider del grupo y es una persona muy responsable, se dedica a la fabricacion y venta de bloques de concreto, esta actividad la realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos y su esposo. Maria desea adquirir mejores herramientas para poder producir mas bloques de cemento.
La señora Maria Jesus H. A. es madre de 2 hijos y se dedica a la venta de comida, golosinas y refrescos en su glorieta del barrio San Jose de la ciudad de Nacaome.
Su proposito es sacar adelante a su familia y hacer crecer su negocio.
La señora Maria Isabel F. es madre de tres hijos todos ellos mayores de edad, Maria se dedica a la venta de refrescos, jugos, agua galletas, confites y frutas de temporada, ella quiere un dia poder comprar su propio puesto de venta en el mercado pricipal de la ciudad de Nacaome.
todas ellas son mujeres luchadoras y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, todas ellas necesitan el credito para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus familias.
texts.en:
The solidarity group El Almendro is composed of three hard-working women, who are close friends. Bellow is a list of their various activities: Mrs. Maria Elba F. is the group leader and is a very responsible person. She makes her living from the production and sale of concrete blocks – an activity which she performs with the help of her husband and children. Maria would like to get better tools in order to make more concrete blocks. Mrs. Maria Jesus H. A. has two children and makes her living from the sale of food, candy, and soda in the main square of her neighborhood, San Jose, which is in Nacaome City. She is motivated by the desire to help her family prosper and develop her business. Mrs. Maria Isabel F. has three grown-up children. Maria makes her living from the sale of soda, juice, water, cookies, candy, and seasonal fruit. One day, she would like to be able to buy her own stall in the main market in Nacaome City. All three of these women are true fighters with strong desires to succeed. All of them need this loan to improve their quality of life and that of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soda, bottled water, beans, rice, sugar, corn, juice, fruit, cement

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds for her fields

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is 35 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Currently all her children are schooling.

Felicia is a petty trader who sells items like cooking oil, spices, pepper, onions, smoked and dried fish, tinned tomatoes, and bags of rice on top of a table in the community market. She says these products move very fast and you can easily recover your money. She takes delivery of goods from the surrounding communities where she lives.

With her fifteen years of experience in selling, she wants to add other items like cereals to increase her product line and retain her customers. She believes that this can be possible with the help of loan assistance. Therefore she wants a loan to buy more bags of raw materials like rice, spices, tinned tomatoes, etc. She is convinced that the loan will help her increase her stock in the event of price hikes. And she also believes this would enable her to save more towards her kids' education.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs like cooking oil, rice, spices, and tinned tomatoes

loans.name: Diana Del Rocío

texts.es:
Diana tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres en el caserío El Imperial, distrito de Olmos, ubicado una hora y cuarenta minutos al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Es propietaria de un pequeño negocio ubicado en el terminal terrestre de Olmos desde hace un año; se dedica a la venta de comidas, golosinas y bebidas que ofrece a los pasajeros y choferes que frecuentan el terminal. Con el dinero percibido en este negocio apoya al sostenimiento de su familia.

La gran acogida que tiene su negocio en la zona ha hecho que piense en ampliarlo con la venta de más productos y preparación de más platos diarios con los cuales pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Por este motivo está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de los insumos que necesita para seguir adelante con su negocio.

Su más grande anhelo es estudiar la carrera técnica de enfermería para poder apoyar a las personas que viven en su caserío. Ella es muy solidaria y siempre está pensando en el bienestar de las personas que la rodean.
texts.en:
Diana is 18. She is single and lives with her parents in the El Imperial village in the Olmos district, which is located one hour and forty minutes north of the city of Chiclayo. For one year she has been the proprietor of a small business, which is located at the Olmos bus station. She sells food, sweets, and drinks to the passengers and drivers who frequent the station. She helps support her family with the money from this business. Her business has been so well received in the area that she intends to expand it by selling more products and preparing more dishes daily. This way she could satisfy her customers’ demands. That is why she is asking Edpyme Alternative, for the first time, for 700 PEN to buy the supplies she needs to get ahead with her business. Her biggest desire is to study a technical career in nursing to be able to help the people in her village. She is very supportive, and she is always thinking of the well being of those around her.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food prepartion and sales

loans.use: To buy livestock to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for her fields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy carrots, tomatoes, onions, pepper, salt, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for his fields

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es madre soltera, tiene 42 años de edad y tiene un hijo de 13 años de edad. Fue abandonada por su esposo cuando nació su hijo y desde ese entonces vive junto a su madre en el caserío Las Pampas, distrito de Olmos, ubicado una hora y cincuenta minutos al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año se dedica al comercio de animales menores (ganado ovino, caprino y aves de corral). Ella recorre los caseríos aledaños para comprar los animales que luego venderá en la ciudad de Chiclayo. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso con la que matiene a su hijo y a su madre, que es de edad avanzada.

Victoria se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de más animales y en los gastos de transporte que tiene que hacer continuamente para movilizarse desde su casa hasta la ciudad de Chiclayo llevando su mercadería.

Su más grande anhelo es ayudar a su hijo a estudiar una carrera profesional con la cual pueda asegurarse un futuro estable. Ella es una madre entregada a su trabajo y que lucha continuamente por darle a su familia el bienestar que necesita.
texts.en:
Victoria is a 42-year-old single mother with a 13-year-old son. She was abandoned by her husband after her son was born, and ever since she has lived with her mother in Las Pampas, Olmos District, located an hour and 50 minutes north of the city of Chiclayo. For the past year, she has had a business selling small animals (sheep, goats and poultry). She visits neighboring farmhouses to buy the animals, then sells them in the city of Chiclayo. This is the only source of income available to Victoria to support herself, her son and her elderly mother. This is the first loan request Victoria has made at Edpyme Alternativa; she is requesting 1000 soles to buy more animals and pay her transportation expenses to travel from her home to the city of Chiclayo, where she sells her animals. Her greatest dream is to help her son study a professional career in order to secure a stable future for himself. She is very dedicated to her work, and she struggles constantly to guarantee her family's well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy animals to resell

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina es madre soltera, tiene 43 años de edad y vive junto a sus tres hijos en casa de un tío de avazada edad en el caserío La Capilla Central de Ñaupe, distrito de Olmos, ubicado dos horas quince minutos al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años es propietaria de una pequeña bodega que funciona en su casa. Allí vende productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite). La continua demanda de sus vecinos por los productos que ofrece ha hecho que se vea en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más productos y ampliar su negocio.

Este negocio es la principal fuente de ingreso familiar por lo que siempre trata se sacarlo adelante, por otro lado es de importancia para la comunidad en donde vive ya que es el único establecimiento de ese tipo en la zona.

Su más grande anhelo es ver a su hijo mayor terminar la carrera técnica de farmacia que con mucho esfuerzo le está brindando. Además desea ver convertirse a sus otros dos hijos en profesionales.
texts.en:
Sabina is a 43-year-old single mother. She lives with her three children in the house of an elderly uncle in the La Capilla Central de Ñaupe neighborhood in Olmos District, located two hours and fifteen minutes north of the city of Chiclayo. For the past three years, she has been the proprietor of a small grocery store in her home, where she sells basic items like rice, sugar and oil. She has steady demand from her neighbors for her products, so for the first time she has decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 soles so that she can buy more products and expand her business. This business is her family's main source of income, so Sabina is always trying to grow it. It is also very important within the community where she lives, since it is the only business of its kind in the area. Her greatest dream is for her oldest son to finish his studies at technical school, where thanks to her efforts he is currently studying Pharmacy. She also wants to see her other children grow up to be working professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic goods to expand her grocery store

location.town: Capilla Central de Ñaupe - Olmos - Lambayeque

loans.use: To grow his transportation business

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Manuel C., está solicitando un crédito para pagar la diferencia que necesita para adquirir su vivienda.
Ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar y no quiere perder esta oportunidad que se le esta ofreciendo de comprar su propia casa, ya que donde vive  es prestada, y le están pidiendo que desocupe la vivienda. 
Es empleado de un puesto de tacos es la persona que se encarga de elaborarlos esté ingreso es el que tiene para su familia y con el cual un parte será para el préstamo.
La persona que aparece en la foto es su esposa la señora Susana Garcia, ya que Don Manuel se encontraba en su trabaja el día que se tomo la foto.
texts.en:
Don Manuel C. is requesting a loan to cover the remaining amount he needs in order to buy his house, since he doesn't have the money on hand and doesn't want to miss the opportunity to own his own home. He currently lives in someone else's house, and they have requested that he vacate the property. Manuel is in charge of making tacos at a local taco stand. This is how he supports his family; he will also use part of his income to pay off this loan. The person in the photo is his wife, Sra. Susana Garcia, since Don Manuel was at work the day the photo was taken.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for part of a house being offered through a government housing credit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food products to sell

loans.name: José Catalino

texts.es:
José tiene 49 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos varones de 18, 15 y 10 años de edad en el caserío Pasabar La Granja, distrito de Olmos, ubicado dos horas al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El trabaja durante todo el día como peón agrícola, pero esta ocupación no es estable, por lo que se vio en la necesidad de instalar hace tres años en su vivienda una pequeña bodega – tienda que es administrada por su mujer. Alli ofrece productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite), abarrotes y bebidas a los vecinos del lugar.

Actualmente su bodega se encuentra desabastecida debido a la constante demanda de sus clientes. Por este motivo está solcitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de más productos y así ampliar su negocio.

El nos comenta que debido a la difícil situación económica por la que atraviesa no ha podido bridarles a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior: los dos hijos mayores trabajan para solventar sus gastos y apoyar a la economía familiar, mientras que el último estudia en un colegio de la zona.

Su más grande anhelo es hacer crecer su bodega y reunir los ingresos suficientes para brindarle a sus hijos la educación que necesitan para asegurarse estabilidad en el futuro.
texts.en:
José is 49 years old and married. He lives with his wife and their three sons, who are 18, 15 and 10 years old, in the Pasabar La Granja neighborhood of Olmos District, two hours north of the city of Chiclayo. During the day, he works as an agricultural laborer, but this is not steady work, so three years ago he decided he needed to open a small grocery store within his home, which his wife now runs. They offer their neighbors basic goods like rice, sugar and oil, as well as other dry goods and drinks. His store is currently depleted of merchandise because of his neighbors' constant high demand. This is why he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa: a loan of 1000 soles which he will use to buy more products and expand his business. He tells us that because of the difficult economic circumstances he faces, he hasn't been able to give his children the opportunity to pursue higher education. His two older children work to help support the family, while his youngest son is studying at a local school. His greatest dream is to expand his business and save up enough to provide his children with the education they need in order to to ensure a stable future.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more basic goods to expand his store

loans.use: To buy supplies for his farm

loans.use: To buy food for livestock and more livestock to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To maintain his taxi

loans.name: Margine Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Margine del Socorro de 34 años de edad, reside en el barrio 380 en la capital de Managua, se caso joven y su hijo mayor tiene 14 años y uno de 10 años de edad, los dos estudian, su esposo trabaja como  transportista, también tiene una camioneta que alquila al Big Café lo cual es  de mucho beneficios ya que han ido logrando desde hace cinco años las mejoras de su casa. Puso una venta de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos el cual lo inicio con fondos que su esposo dio de los pocos ahorros, con  poca cantidad de inventario para poder apoyar a sus hijos y dar una mejor alimentación, sus planes es dar un mejor patrimonio a sus hijos. Con este crédito va  asurtir de mercadería de ropa variada, zapatos y poder vender a sus clientes, esta temporada del año las ventas se elevan y tiene muchos encargos. Se siento contenta por la oportunidad que la institución da, a si como sus intereses bajos y el plazo el cual espera pagar en tiempo y forma para seguir beneficiándose
texts.en:
Margine del Socorro is 34, and she lives in neighborhood 380 in the capital of Managua. She married young. Her oldest child is 14, and the other child is 10. They both go to school. Her husband is a driver. He also has a van, which he rents to the Big Café. This has been very beneficial because over the last five years they were able to make improvements to their house. She set up a place to sell clothes, shoes and cosmetics. She started with funds that her husband gave her from their small savings. With a small inventory, she was able to help her children and feed them better. Her plan is to give a better heritage to her children. She will use this loan to stock her merchandise with various clothes and shoes to sell to her customers. This time of year sales increase, and she has lots of orders. She is happy for the opportunity the institution gives her with low interest and payment plans. She expects to pay on time and in the agreed upon manner in order to continue to benefiting from loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes and shoes to increase her inventory

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Maria Omier de 45 años de edad, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, casada y con tres hijos que procreo de 5,13 y 16 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad y sus ingresos son bajos, es por eso opto por iniciar su propio negocio en donde pudiera tener entradas económicas para el bienestar de su familia, tiene una pequeña pulpería en donde vende, granos básicos, golosinas, venta de huevo, gaseosas y una variedad de producto, con este financiamiento comprara granos básicos, , producto de higiene personal, verduras, carnes ya que también los fines de semana hace sopa, baho para vender y obtener mejores ingresos y poder cubrir las necesidades personales. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad de este primer crédito que espera que sea uno de muchos.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Omier is 45 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood of Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. She is married and has three children who are 5, 13 and 16 years old. Her husband works as a security guard, but since he doesn't earn very much she decided to start her own small grocery store in order to earn enough to provide for her family's well-being. She sells basic grains, sweets, eggs, sodas and a variety of other products. She also prepares soups and baho (a traditional Nicaraguan stew) to sell on the weekends, so that she can earn more and cover her own basic needs. With this loan, she will buy basic grains, personal hygiene products, vegetables, and meat. She is grateful to Afodenic for giving her the opportunity to take out her first loan, which she hopes will be the first of many.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains, meats, vegetables, and personal hygiene products

loans.name: Rosa De Saron #3, 4, 5 Group

texts.en:
Fanis is the group coordinator for Banco de Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Rosa de Saron. Her story is representative of the others in her group and more generally of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian clients. Fanis lives in Puerto Plata with her husband and five children (ages 19, 15, 13, 7 and 4). Fanis' community is located in a rural area near the northern shore of the Dominican Republic. The community does not have access to potable drinking water and has unreliable access to electricity.

Fanis sells food and clothing items to those in her community and the surrounding communities. She plans to use this loan to purchase more merchandise to sell. This will be her fourth loan with Esperanza. She has successfully paid back her previous three loans. Fanis wants to continue to grow her business so that some day she can have her own store. She has been able to improve the quality of life for her family as her business as grown, and she hopes to continue to improve her living conditions. She thanks you for your support and for helping her achieve her goals!

loans.use: To buy food and clothes to sell

loans.name: Mayra Santana

texts.es: La señora Mayra Santana de 46 años de edad, es una mujer de recurso muy humilde, procreo dos hijos de 15 y 19 años de edad, el de 19 años trabaja para ayudar con los gastos lo cual dejo sus estudios debido a la economía de sus padres ya que su papa trabaja como guarda de seguridad y su salario es bajo, doña Mayra trabaja en servicio domestico trabajo cansado por que tiene que lavar y planchar mucha ropa aparte de los otros oficios que tiene que hacer  tiene cuatro años de trabajar sin tener vacaciones, su objetivo es poder terminar de hacer su casa toda de concreto ya que parte es de tabla por fuera y por dentro en las divisiones lo cual espera poder hacer en tiempos futuro toda de concreto. Vive en un barrio marginal en la capital de Managua, lo cual espera con este préstamo comprara una paca para poner su propio negocio de venta de ropa el cual se vende por ser bonita, barata y buena, ya que por su edad se cansa mucho y desea ganar sus propios ingresos junto a su familia. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad de poder salir adelante el cual espera a futuro crecer en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Mayra Santana is 46 years old, of vary limited means. She has two children, 15 and 19 years old. The 19-year old works to help with family expenses and, as a result, has had to abandon his studies because he needs to help contribute to family income since his father, who is employed as a security guard, earns a very small salary. Mayra works as a domestic, which is exhausting work since she has to wash and iron great quantities of clothes besides all the other chores which she must complete. She has had this job for 4 years, never time off for vacation. Her goal is to be able to complete her house with concrete since part of the outside and the interior walls are still made of lumber and she would like everything to be concrete. She lives in a poor neighborhood of Managua and hopes to use this loan to buy bundles of clothing and set up her own business selling it since it will be pretty, inexpensive and good. Because of her age, her present work is very tireing and she would like to earn her own income with her family. She thanks Afodenic for the opportunity to get ahead and she hopes in future to see her sales grow.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bundles of clothing.

loans.name: Lili Elvira

texts.es: Doña Lili de 54 años de edad, vive en un barrio donde la delincuencia es abrumadora pero debido a los pocos recursos no se ha ido. Es madre soltera de tres hijos  los cuales los tres emigraron a otro país para buscar como ganar dinero ya que el desempleo esta mal en Nicaragua, pero gracias a la ayuda de las remesas que envían sus hijos logro primeramente poner una pulpería y hacer mejora a su casa y poderle dejar una vivienda digna a sus hijos,  ahora cambio de negocio, puso una tienda con venta de ropa, zapatos, juguetes y otros lo cual lo hizo con fondos que sus hijos dieron de su trabajo y de financiamiento para poder cubrir su negocio. Son ya muchos años de experiencia en las ventas que en los últimos meses debido a la crisis de desempleo, y de la sequía las siembras han sido bajas. Y con este crédito desea comprar ropa, zapatos, muchos juguetes para la temporada navideña que espera recuperarse ya que las ventas mejoran debido que mucha gente regresa a su casa y cumple con el sueño de sus hijitos. También espera que sus hijos pronto regresen y poder estar con ellos.
texts.en:
Lili is 54 years old and lives in a neighborhood where lawlessness is rampant. However, due to lack of resources, she is unable to move. She is a single mother of three children all of whom emigrated to another country in hopes of earning money since unemployment in Nicaragua is extensive. Thanks to the funds they send home she managed first to open a small grocery store and improve her home to leave a proper home for her children. Now, she changed her type of business and opened a store where she sells clothing, shoes and toys; she used funds that her children sent her as well as financing to cover costs. She has many years experience in sales but profits the last few months have been low due to the unemployment crisis and the draught. With this loan she intends to buy clothing, shoes and lots of toys for the holiday season and hopes to recoup since sales should be better because many folk return home and try to make their children's wishes come true. She also hopes that her own children will return soon so that she can be with them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes and toys.

loans.name: Bendicion Divina Groups 1 And 2

texts.en:
Santa is the group coordinator for Banco de Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Bendicion Divina (Divine Blessing). Her story is representative of the others in her group and more generally of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian clients. Santa lives in Puerto Plata with her husband and four children, ages 19, 17, 14 and 10. Her neighborhood is located in the center of a city. She has unreliable access to electricity and has running water that is not potable.

Santa runs a beauty salon and has over 14 years of experience. This will be her third loan with Esperanza, and she plans to use it to purchase beauty supplies and cosmetics to use in her salon. Her goal is to continue to grow her business by adding new clients. Since becoming an Esperanza client, Santa has been able to improve the living conditions of her family, her dream being to earn enough money to buy her own house. She thanks you for helping her achieve her goals!

loans.use: Beauty products and cosmetics

loans.name: San Carlos Group

texts.es:
ALCOM “SAN CARLOS”

“Siempre quise hacer algo diferente, porque al hacerlo bien se logra un mejor nivel D. vida”, son las palabras D. la señora Violeta que a sus 46 años es madre D. 2 hijos, uno D. los cuales ya es independiente, y el otro aun esta estudiando, Violeta es cliente D. EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD desD. hace poco mas D. un año.  Ella es presidenta del grupo “SAN CARLOS” elegida por las socios por su carisma y entusiasmo.

Violeta o Viole, como le dicen sus amigas, tiene su negocio llamado “Confecciones Viole” donD. se dedica a la confección D. zapatos, un servicio D. aparado exclusivamente para mujeres D. todas las edades, lleva en este negocio 15 años, con ayuda D. su pareja, comparten tareas, mientras que él se dedica a la confección D. los zapatos, ella se encarga D. la promoción y venta, tanto en su casa como también haciendo visitas a sus clientes.

Gracias al esfuerzo que han dado en su trabajo consiguieron comprar y construir su casa hasta un segundo piso, dar estudios superiores a sus hijos, y tener una vida D. provecho.  Ahora con el préstamo que esta obteniendo, planea invertirlo en la compra D. insumos para su negocio, aunque sus mas grandes sueños son los D. terminar D. construir su casa hasta un tercer piso, para ampliar su taller, comprar un auto para ahorrar tiempo y dinero en la compra D. insumos, y terminar D. darle educación a su menor hijo, verlo profesional.
texts.en:
ALCOM “SAN CARLOS” "I always wanted to do something different because, if you do it well, you reach a better quality of life." These are Violeta's words. This 46-year-old, mother of two children, one of whom is now independent and the other still a student, has been a member of EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for a little more than a year. She is the group leader of the “SAN CARLOS” group, elected by the members for her charisma and enthusiasm. Violeta, or Viole, as her friends call her, has a business called “Confecciones Viole” where she manufactures shoes, a service for women of all ages. She has had it for 15 years and, with her partner's help, shares tasks. While he manufactures the shoes, she takes care of marketing and sales, both from her home and with house-to-house visits with her customers. Thanks to their hard work they managed to buy and build their house, even adding a second story, proviD. higher education for their children, and have a profitable life. Now, with the loan they are requesting, she intends to invest in raw materials for their work, although her greatest wish is to finish her house adding even a third floor, enlarge their workshop, and buy a car to save time and money in the purchase of raw materials and, finally, proviD. their youngest son with an education, to see him become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Mujeres Capacidadas Group 4

texts.en:
Adargisa is the group coordinator for Banco de Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Mujeres Capacitadas (Qualified Women).  Her story is representative of the others in her group and more generally of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients.  Adargisa lives in a rural area in the province of Puerto Plata with her husband and two children. Her community has unreliable access to running water (not potable), electricity and trash service.  

Adargisa has four years of experience in running a cafe in her community. This is her fourth loan with Esperanza.  She will use it to buy supplies and food for her cafe. She hopes to continue to grow her business so that she can have a larger cafe.  Adargisa says that her life has changed quite a bit since her first loan with Esperanza.  She has not only been able to provide for her family, but has also grown spiritually.  She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: Food products for cooking and selling

loans.name: Luchando Contra La Pobreza Groups 1 And 2

texts.en:
Severina is the group coordinator for Banco de Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Luchando Contra La Pobreza (Fighting Against Poverty).  Her story is representative of the others in her group and more generally of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients. Severina lives in a rural and mountainous area near Puerto Plata.  Her community has unreliable access to running water (not potable) and electricity.  She is a single mother and lives with her four children. 

Severina sells food, fruit and gasoline to others in her community.  She has four years of experience with her business and this will be her fifth loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to purchase meat (ham and chicken) and fuel to sell in her market. She wants to continue to grow her business more and more each day so that she can provide for her family.  Since becoming an Esperanza client, she has learned how to make good investments with her money and to think about the future.  She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: Meat (ham and chicken) and fuel

loans.name: Mujeres Habiles 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Josefina is the group coordinator for Banco de Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Mujeres Habiles (Skillful Women).  Her story is representative of the others in her group and more generally of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients. Josefina lives in a rural community in the province of Puerto Plata with her husband and two children (ages 7 and 6).  They have unreliable access to running water (not potable) and electricity. 

Josefina sells various clothing items to those in her community and the surrounding communities.  She has over 9 years of experience with this business. She has successfully repaid three loans with Esperanza.  She plans to use this fourth loan to purchase more items to sell including shoes, accessories and clothing. Her goal is to be able to have a wide variety of inventory to meet all of her clients' needs. She has been able to use the loans to invest in her business and help it to grow.  Josefina hopes to continue to improve her family's living conditions by growing her business.  She thanks you for helping her achieve her goals!

loans.use: Shoes, accessories and clothes

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La señora Rosa U. de 51 años de edad, es madre soltera de una hija la cual es ya casada pero trabajan juntas en un pequeño comedor que tiene en donde vende desayuno, almuerzo, últimamente las ventas están bajas y abecés pierde la comida debido a que no la vende, pero cada día es la lucha por mejorar su economía, vive en un barrio llamado Waspan Sur en la capital de Managua, sus planes es poder terminar de hacer las mejoras a su casa ya que poco a poco ha ido construyendo por que es lo mas caro. Lleva tres ciclos en Afodenic el cual con este comprara carnes, pollo, verduras, frutas, granos básicos, gaseosas y otros para mejorar el servicio de la venta de comida y elevar las ventas, ya que mucho capital esta invertido ya que da crédito para la quincena y es por eso se necesita la inversión. Da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios otorgados que gracias a estos ha hecho posible las mejoras en su negocio como en su vida personal en sastifcer las necesidades personales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa U. is 51 years old and is the single mother of one daughter, who is already married. They work together at Rosa's small restaurant, where she sells breakfast and lunch. Her sales have been slow lately, and she sometimes has to waste food when she can't sell it; she struggles each day to improve her economic situation. She lives in a neighborhood called South Waspan in the Nicaraguan capital city of Managua. Her goal is to finish the home improvements she has been making, little by little. She hasn't been able to do all of the construction at once because it would be very expensive. She has been with Afodenic for three loan cycles now, and in this loan cycle she plans to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, fruits, basic grains, sodas, and other items to improve service at her restaurant and boost sales. She has already invested a lot of money in her business, and since she allows her clients to pay on credit, she needs the money up front in order to make this investment. She is grateful to Afodenic for the benefits she has obtained through loans; she has been able to make improvements to her business and in her personal life, and she is now better able to satisfy her own personal needs.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, chicken, vegetables, and basic grains to prepare meals

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es: La señora Yadira S., vive en un barrio marginal de la capital de Managua, casada y con dos hijos de 12 y 13 años de edad, los cuales estudian para tener un futuro mejor, su esposo trabaja como cadete de taxi, cansado por que abecés las carreras están malas debido a la crisis económica que el país esta pasando, pues el pueblo prefiere dar 2.50 córdobas que vale la ruta en la capital y no pagar una carrera de 40 córdobas ya que seria el alimento del día. El  negocio de la señora Yadira es la venta de ropa, zapatos el cual lleva cinco años en las ventas, muchas veces  ventas bajas, los días de pago vende y se recupera en las ventas, inicio con préstamos en banco comunales y así pudo invertir en su negocio, con este préstamo comprara ropa variada para dama, niños y caballeros para sastifacer la demanda de sus cliente ya que para estos meses de Noviembre y la navidad es la mejor época en las ventas. Espera poder obtener buenas ganancias para seguir invirtiendo. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad del financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yadira S. lives in a neighborhood on the outskirts of the Nicaraguan capital city of Managua. She is married and has two children who are 12 and 13 years old and are currently studying in pursuit of a better future. Her husband works as a taxi driver, and finds the work tiring because sometimes his routes don't pay well due to the economic crisis the country is currently facing. People prefer to pay 2.50 córdobas - what a ride costs in the city of Managua - and don't want to pay taxi rides that cost 40 córdobas, since that is the money they need to buy food each day. Yadira has been selling clothing and shoes for the past 5 years, and she often has low sales. She makes most of her sales on payday, and this way she makes up for the rest of the month. She started taking out loans through a village bank, and thus was able to invest in her business. With this loan, she will buy a variety of clothing for men, women and children to satisfy her clients' demand, since November and the Christmas season are her best times for sales. She hopes to earn good profits so that she can continue to invest in her business. She is grateful to Afodenic for giving her this opportunity to take out a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing for men, women and children

loans.name: Santisima Trinidad Group

texts.es:
ALCOM “SANTISIMA TRINIDAD”

Mirla es una señora trabajadora que pertenece al grupo “SANTISIMA TRINIDAD” trabaja con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD con el fin D. obtener prestamos para sus negocios, en la compra D. insumos, como en la D. mercadería.

Todo inicio cuando ella conoció a su pareja, él tenia una imprenta, entonces ella empezó a ayudarlo y poco a poco fue conociendo todo respecto al negocio, luego decidieron abrir una librería-bazar, así obtendrían mas ingresos, y complementarían los trabajos hechos en su imprenta para la venta en una librería con un valor agregado, después abrieron otro negocio, una tienda pequeña pero surtida, y D. la cual obtiene muchas ganancias D. la venta D. cerveza, por lo mismo que utilizara el préstamo obtenido en la compra D. mercadería para su tienda, ahora Mirla esta emocionada en llenar su tienda y espera lograr grandes ventas.
texts.en:
"Holy Trinity" Group: Mirla is a hard-working woman who belongs to the Holy Trinity Group and works with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD by taking out loans for her businesses to buy ingredients or merchandise. It all began when she met her partner. He had a printing shop, so she started helping out, and little by little she learned all about the business. Then they decided to open a school supply store in order to earn more and to have a place to sell their products from the printing shop. Then they opened another business, a small store where they sell a variety of merchandise and earn a lot in profits from selling beer. She will use this loan to purchase merchandise for her store. She's very excited about stocking up her store, and she hopes to have good sales.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La señora Martha Sánchez de 39 años de edad, casada vive en Waspan Norte en la capital de Managua, procreo  dos hijos  de 15 y 18 años de edad,  uno estudia y el otro trabaja para poder ayudar a su mama con los gastos, el esposo de doña Martha es mecánico pero su salario es bajo y cuando  no hay mucho trabajo gana menos, sus planes es poder seguirle haciendo las mejoras a su vivienda, ella trabaja como enfermera  en un centro de salud, donde ayuda  a mucha gente enferma, del dengue que es el mas común por los mosquitos, ya que se da muchos en los barrios por que no hay aguas negra, las calles son de tierra entre otros, con este préstamo hará el baño de su casa para tener una mejor higiene y comodidad para el aseo personal de su familia, es su quinto ciclo en la institución y esta sastifecha por que ha logrado hacer mejoras a su casa
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha Sánchez is 39 years old and lives in the North Waspan neighborhood of the Nicaraguan capital city of Managua. She has two children who are 15 and 18 years old; one is in school and the other works to help his mother pay for household expenses. Martha's husband is a mechanic, but his salary is very low and when there isn't much work he earns even less. Her plans are to continue making improvements to their home. Martha works as a nurse at a health center, where she helps many people who are sick with dengue, the most common illness caused by mosquitoes. Dengue is very common in local neighborhoods, where the streets are unpaved, because of the contaminated water supply. With this loan, Martha will install a bathroom in her home in order to provide her family with improved hygiene and comfort. This is her fifth loan cycle with the institution, and she is pleased that she has been able to make home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a bathroom so that her family will have a more comfortable, hygienic environment

loans.name: Roger Antonio

texts.es: El señor Roger Antonio Pavón tiene la edad de 36 años habita en el barrio santa rosa ubicado en la cuidad de Masaya, junto a su compañera de vida ; la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del pago de luz ,agua y los alimentos que hagan falta, ellos tienen tres hijos , los cuales estudian para un porvenir mejor, brindarle apoyo en sus estudios es lo primordial y verlos como hombres de bien , don Roger desde hace cinco años, trabaja como albañil trabajo que realiza mediante contrato que su jefe le dan, cuando terminan la obra queda sin trabajo, hasta que consiguen otro contrato de vivienda, el ha ido comprando los materiales para terminar de construir su casa ya que de una solo vez no le alcanza por el alto precio que tienen los materiales de construcción agradece a la institución por la buena aprobación de su segundo crédito , ya que con el se beneficiara para lograr tener una casa digna.
texts.en:
Mr. Roger Antonio Pavón is 36 years old and lives with his life partner in the Santa Rosa neighborhood of the city of Masaya. His partner works and helps him buy the food they need and pay the electricity and water bills. The couple has three children, all of whom are currently studying in hopes of a better future, and Roger's main goal is to support his children in their studies and see them grow up to be good men. For the past 5 years, Roger has been working as a builder. He works on contract jobs given to him by his boss, so when he finishes a job he is left without work until they can find another contract to build a house. He has been purchasing the materials to finish building his own house little by little, since he doesn't have enough money to buy them all at once due to the high price of construction materials. He is grateful to the institution for having approved this second loan, since it will help him achieve his goal of having a decent house.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to continue building his home

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.en: Luis Alberto has applied for a loan for his business of making adobe bricks and roofing tiles. The money will be used to purchase the wood and clay that are necessary to form and shape the materials. He learned the trade from his father and established his own workshop seven years ago. Luis Alberto says that he is grateful for this skill, as it allows him to have his own business as well as improve his own home. He cites the economic crisis as the reason for a low demand for construction materials. Luis Alberto hopes that his business will ensure that he can remain self-sufficient, and that he can provide a decent living for his family. Luis Alberto is not married and has no children.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en: Maria Elena has had her pulperia, a small general store, for six years. The store is based out of her home, and she prides herself on the excellent service given to customers. Maria Elena established the store while she was out of work and she wanted to assist her husband by contributing to the family income. This is her second Kiva loan, and she is a long-standing customer of Fundación Leon 2000 with an excellent credit history. She will use this loan to purchase higher quality products to stock her store. She dreams of being able to better serve her clients by offering high quality products at favorable prices.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Melba Isabel

texts.en: Melba Isabel has three children, ages 6, 9, and 12, and all are in school. Melba Isabel is 36 years old. She manages two businesses: the sale of clothing and the butchering of pigs (pictured). She began her clothing business about six years ago, selling clothing on foot when her husband was ill and could not work for an extended period of time. She now uses her home as display space for her merchandise. She will use this loan to purchase more clothing merchandise, adding to her selection of products. Melba Isabel dreams of being able to ensure that her children don’t go without a meal everyday and that she will be able to provide a good education for them.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
A la señora Ángela R. le está haciendo falta un cuarto de material, el que tiene actualmente es de madera y ya esta en muy malas condiciones y tiene miedo que pueda pasar un accidente.
Es por eso que la señora Ángela desea construir una recamara de material mas duradero y seguro para ella y sus hijos, ya que es madre soltera y tiene cuatro hijos bajo su responsabilidad.
Doña Ángela se tiene ya mas de seis años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada y nueva en diferentes partes de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo, el cual es el ingreso que a tenido para su familia y con el cual una parte será para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Ángela R. is in need of a room built of solid material; the one she has currently is made of wood and it is in very bad condition and she is afraid that there could be an accident. For this reason Angela wishes to build a room from material that is more durable and secure for herself and her children, as she is a single mother with four children in her care. For more than four years Angela has sold used and new clothing in different parts of the city of Nuevo Laredo. This activity provides income for her family, and will be used, in part, to make the payments on the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to build a room using durable material

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es: El joven Mario José C. V., tiene la edad de 27 años, habita en el barrio La Borgoña, Ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa, la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene un hijos a su cargo de tres años, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y darle una buena educación, desde hace nueve años se dedica a la agricultura , ya que su papá le heredo , para que la trabaje y pueda trabajar por si solo , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es el agua potable que no llega y tiene que estar comprando agua , agradece a Afodenic por la buena aprobación de su segundo préstamo , ya que con el primero logro sacar una buena producción y pago en tiempo y forma su crédito , además esta muy contento por los intereses bajos ya que le queda capital para poderlo invertir en su vivienda. Con este préstamo comparara fertilizantes y insumos para mejorar la producción  y poder vender a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Mario José C. V. is a 27-year-old young man who lives in the La Borgoña neighborhood in the municipality of Ticuantepe with his wife and 3-year-old son. His wife is employed and contributes to the household expenses. His plan for his family is to improve their living conditions and provide a good education for his son. He has been a farmer for the past 9 years since his father left him the farm to work himself. The greatest obstacle he must overcome is the lack of drinking water which is unavailable and must be purchased. He is grateful to Afodenic for approving his second loan since the first one allowed him to have a good crop yield and he repaid his loan in a timely fashion. He is also very happy that the interest rate is so low because that allows him to have a little money left over which he can invest in his home. This loan will be used to buy fertilizers and raw materials to improve his production so that he can sell at better prices.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Juana De Dios

texts.en: La Senora Juana is 71 years old; she has five adult children. Her business is a pulperia, a small general store, which she has maintained for 52 years. She began by selling items on foot and gradually built up her business to be an established store. Her goal is to further invest in her business in order to increase her profits. She is faced with the challenge of poor health and the cost of medicine. This loan will go towards the purchase of merchandise for her pulperia.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Pachapaccari Group

texts.en:
Our socios are part of a communal bank consisting of 10 members in Cusco. The group is called Pachapaccari.

Some of the members are married, others live with their significant other, some have children, and some are single. One of the members is a rafting guide, a chef, and a printer. They will use the loan for various business activities, such as buying ingredients to make breakfast for clients, materials to knit artisanal goods, and carpets to sell.

This is the group’s first loan from Arariwa. The group appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

(One borrower's spouse and child are pictured as well.)

loans.use: Working capital for their businesses

loans.name: Maria De Fatima

texts.es:
La señora   María B. Gíler es socia del Banco Comunal Mejía  ubicado en Portoviejo provincia de Manabí, ésta es una de las regiones más hermosas del Ecuador por sus playas y gastronomía.

María tiene 53 años, esta casada y es  madre de nueve hijos, desde hace treinta años se radicaron  en la comunidad Mejía, aquí vive con su esposo y dos de sus hijos. Nuestra socia se dedica al trabajo doméstico en casas ajenas desde hace diez años de lunes a viernes, lava, plancha, cocina, limpia, etc. percibiendo un ingreso de 40 dólares por semana, también realiza otras actividades en sus ratos libres y fin de semana como preparar dulces, empanadas de verde y además  ayuda a su  esposo en la agricultura.

Con el préstamo que la fundación ESPOIR le entregue va a  comprar  pollos, alimento y vitaminas para su crecimiento para de esta manera cristalizar su  sueño de  montar un criadero  de pollos en su casa y contar con un ingreso extra para mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
María B. Gíler is a member of the Mejía communal bank which is located in Portoviejo, Manabí province. This is one of the most beautiful areas of Ecuador due to its beaches and gastronomy. María is 53 years old, married, and the mother of 9 children. They have lived in Mejía for the past 30 years. She lives here with her husband and two of her children. For the past 10 years she has worked Monday through Friday as a domestic in homes where she washes, irons, cooks, cleans, etc. for a salary of 40 dollars per week. In her free time and on weekends she also engages in other activities such as preparing sweets, green empanadas (turnovers), and she helps her husband with his farming. With the loan that ESPOIR will grant she intends to buy chickens, and feed and vitamins to raise them in order to see her dream of running a chicken hatchery from her home which will provide her with extra income to improve her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicks, feed and vitamins to set up a hatchery.

loans.name: Brenda Skarlet

texts.es: La Jove Brenda Skarleth R., tiene la edad de 24 años, habita en el barrio Los Madrigales Norte, ubicado en Veracruz, junto a su compañero de vida, actualmente ellos no tienen hijos, los planes hacia su familia es poder ampliar su casa ya que actualmente es muy pequeña, la joven desde hace dos años se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, y los días martes compra cerdo  y destaza para obtener otros ingresos , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que no tiene un vehiculo que pueda ir a entregar sus productos , ella inicio está actividad con el apoyo de su esposo y el interés de mejorar para ahorrar , agradece a  la institución por la confianza y la oportunidad de optar su primer crédito para que en futuro pueda realizar sus sueños . Con el financiamiento lo va a invertir en mercadería en la compra de ropa ya que viene la temporada de Navidad y quiere aprovecharla.
texts.en:
Brenda Skarleth R. is 24 years old and lives with her life partner in the Los Madrigales Norte neighborhood which is in Veracruz. They currently don't have any children. Her plan for her family is to enlarge her home which is very small. For the past two years this young lady has sold clothing, shoes, and cosmetics. On Tuesdays she buys pork which she cuts up for extra income. Her greatest obstacle is that she does not own a vehicle with which to do her deliveries. She started her business with her husband's support and her main goal now is to earn enough profits to begin to set aside some savings. She is grateful to the institution for trusting her and giving her the opportunity to get her first loan so that her future dreams may come true. These funds will be used to buy clothing to resell since the Christmas season is about to start and she would like to take advantage of it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell during this season.

loans.name: Melida Catalina

texts.es:
El banco comunal Corazones Unidos está formado por hombres y mujeres que viven en la ciudad de Cuenca su centro  histórico  se ha caracterizado por ser la zona residencial más antigua y más bella siendo considerada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su arquitectura, paisajes, gastronomía y amabilidad de la gente atrae al turista nacional y extranjero.  

La señora Melida J. es socia del  banco comunal Corazones Unidos, ella vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 36 años de edad se encuentra casada fruto de su matrimonio procreo cinco hijos, su primer hijo es  mayor de edad  y trabaja para aportar un poco con los gastos del  hogar, sus cuatro hijos restantes son menores y aún se encuentran estudiando, entre Méldia su esposo e hijo aportan económicamente con la manutención de la familia.
