Melida se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos para la mujer Oriflame,  sus ventas realiza mediante  catálogos   puerta a puerta, lleva tres años en este negocio y nos comenta que le va muy bien ya que es independiente y con lo que gana ha podido salir adelante con su familia.

Nuestra socia lleva un año trabajando con los  préstamos de la fundación y los ha invertido en su negocio para incrementar su stock; con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR  le entregue va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos, perfumes, cremas, etc., para incrementar su stock de productos para la época navideña.

Su sueño es incrementar su negocio por ende sus ingresos económicos para regalarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Corazones Unidos communal bank is made up of men and women who live in the city of Cuenca. Cuenca's city center has been declared a Cultural Heritage of Humanity for being the oldest and most beautiful residential area for its architecture, scenery, gastronomy and the kindness of its inhabitants. It attracts tourists from all over the world. Melinda J. is a member of the Corazones Unidos communal bank and lives in Cuenca. She is 36 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children. Her eldest is an adult and works contributing some to household expenses. The other four children are still minors and are students. The financial support of the family is met by Melinda, her husband, and her son. Melinda sells Oriflame cosmetics both via catalogue sales and door-to-door. She has been doing this for the past three years and she tells us that she does well because she is independent and she can use what she earns to help her family get ahead. She has been involved with us for the past year and the loans have been invested in increasing her stock. This new loan from FUNDACION ESPOIR will be used to buy cosmetics, perfumes, creams, etc to increase her stock for the Christmas season. Her dream is to increase her sales so that her income can improve thereby providing a better future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, creams, perfumes, etc. for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Abelardo J. le está haciendo falta la barda alrededor de su casa. 
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora ya que en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario, ya que le preocupa que su casa no tenga la seguridad, para su familia, y tiene dos hijos que todavía están pequeños de edad y no quiere que les valla a pasar algo.
Don Alberto es empleado de una compañía de gasolina en el departamento de despachador, con una parte de este ingreso planea pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Abelardo J.'s house lacks a wall around it. He is requesting a loan to buy building materials and pay the person who will build this improvement since he does not have the needed funds at this time. He worries that his house is not secure for his family and he has two children who are still very young and he fears something could happen to them. Alberto is a dispatcher for a gasoline company and will use part of his salary to repay his loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall around his house.

loans.name: Carlos Armando

texts.es:
El banco comunal Corazones Unidos está formado por hombres y mujeres que viven en la ciudad de Cuenca,  su centro  histórico  se ha caracterizado por ser la zona residencial más antigua y más bella siendo considerada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, arquitectura, paisajes, gastronomía y amabilidad de  su gente atrae al turista nacional y extranjero.

El señor Carlos Campaña  tiene 50 años, es socio del banco comunal Corazones Unidos, vive en la urbe de la Ciudad de Cuenca con su esposa y su hija aún soltera, sus otros dos hijos ya son casados y viven independientes, aún no tienen casa propia.

Carlos tiene un  negocio de venta de revistas desde  hace 20 años y nos comenta que hay días buenos y malos pero con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado sacar  adelante a su familia,

Este es  su  segundo ciclo y nos comenta que los crédito  recibidos le han servido para  incrementar un poco su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le  entregue va a invertir en la compra de revistas de economía y negocios, de hogar, infantiles, didácticas,  etc para mantener un stock surtido para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.

Su meta es de seguir creciendo en su negocio y dar un mejor presente y futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
The Corazones Unidos communal bank is made up of men and women who live in the city of Cuenca, whose city center has been characterized as being the oldest and most beautiful residential area, having been declared a World Cultural Heritage for its architecture, scenery, gastronomy and kindness of its inhabitants. It draws tourists both locally and internationally. Carlos Campaña is 50 years old and a member of the Corazones Unidos communal bank. He lives in the large city of Cuenca with his wife and single daughter. His other two children are married and live independently; they don't have their own homes yet. Carlos has been a magazine merchant for the past 20 years and tells us that he has good days and bad days but his efforts at work have allowed him to get his family ahead. This is his second loan with us and he comments that the prior loan allowed him to increase his sales somewhat. The new loan from FUNDACION ESPOIR will be used to diversify his inventory adding economics, business, home, children, and how-to magazines to his stock so that he can offer his customers a better selection. His goal is to continue growing in his business and provide a better present and future for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy business, economics, home, children and how-to magazines to offer his customers more choice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To finish building a room.

loans.name: Judith Marina

texts.es:
El banco comunal Corazones Unidos está formado por hombres y mujeres que viven en la ciudad de Cuenca,  su centro  histórico  se ha caracterizado por ser la zona residencial más antigua y más bella siendo considerada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, arquitectura, paisajes, gastronomía y amabilidad de  su gente atrae al turista nacional y extranjero.

La señora  Judith Marina Guamán  es una socia activa del banco comunal Corazones Unidos, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 49 años de edad, se encuentra casada  y mantiene una muy buena relación conyugal y fruto de su unión marital procreó dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Judith Marina trabaja como empleada privada desde hace varios años y también elabora manualidades para vender en las ferias los fines de semana, lleva trabajando dos años con los créditos que  la fundación le ha otorgado permitiéndole  mantener e incrementar  su negocio de manualidades, con el préstamo que la institución le entregue va a comprar fieltro, pintura, pinceles, lana, fómix, etc. para realizar  sus manualidades con motivos navideños.

Su meta es incrementar su negocio para dictar cursos de manualidades y aportar para el desarrollo de otras mujeres de la comunidad así como para  mejorar su situación económica  junto a su familia.
texts.en:
The Corazones Unidos communal bank is made up of men and women who live in the city of Cuenca. Cuenca's city center has been declared a Cultural Heritage of Humanity for being the oldest and most beautiful residential area for its architecture, scenery, gastronomy and the kindness of its inhabitants. It attracts tourists from all over the world. Judith Marina Guamán is an active member of the Corazones Unidos communal bank and lives in downtown Cuenca. She is 49 years old, happily married, and has two children who are students. They live in a rented house. For several years Judith Marina has worked as a private employee but she also creates arts and crafts to sell during the weekend flea markets. She has been cooperating with us for the past two years and the loans which have been granted have been used to maintain and increase her arts and crafts business. With this new loan she plans to buy materials like felt, paint, brushes, wool, foam rubber, etc. to make holiday season themed arts and crafts. Her goal is to increase her sales so that she can teach crafts classes to help develop women in the community as well as improve her family's economic status.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy arts and crafts materials for the holiday season.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
La señora Jacqueline  S. Cedeño es socia del Banco Comunal Mejía  ubicado en Portoviejo provincia de Manabí, ésta es una de las regiones más hermosas del Ecuador por sus playas y gastronomía.

Jaqueline anteriormente se dedicaba a preparar comida y dulces para fiestas pero como no siempre tenía trabajo incursionó en el comercio informal,  ahora ella se dedica  a la compra y venta de sabanas, pantalones, camisas, ropa en general, su trabajo lo realiza puerta a puerta visitando a sus clientes en sus domicilios y trabajos, toma el pedido y luego entrega la mercadería a crédito. 

El esposo de Jacqueline esta delicado de salud por lo que ella  es la encarga de llevar el sustento para su hogar,  cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos sobre  todo su hijo menor que trabaja en una cerrajería con su tío y con lo que gana aporta para los gastos del hogar y van  superando  los problemas económicos.

El crédito solicitado por Jacqueline es para comprar  ropa para damas, caballeros, niños, sábanas y otros productos para la época  navideña.
texts.en:
Jacqueline S. Cedeño is a member of the Mejía communal bank ,which is located in Portoviejo, Manabí province, which is one of Ecuador's most beautiful regions thanks to its beaches and gastronomy. Jacqueline used to work preparing meals and sweets for parties but, since work was never steady, she decided to enter the informal economy and now works selling clothing and bed linens door-to-door visiting her customers in their homes and work places. She takes their orders and then delivers the merchandise on credit. Jacqueline's husband is not well so household expenses are her sole responsibility. Her children, especially her youngest who works at a locksmith shop with his uncle, help. Together they are able to meet their household expenses and solve their economic problems. The loan Jacqueline is requesting will be used to buy clothing, bed linens and other products for the holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for women, men and children as well as bed linen sets for the holiday season.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es: El señor Rafael Antonio Busto A. , tiene la edad de 37 años , habita en el barrio San Ignacio , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante en el mercado de Masaya en venta de frutas y verduras , para apoyarlo con los gastos del agua, luz y los gastos del colegio , ellos tiene tres hijos , de diecisiete , de diez y uno que apenas va a nacer , el mayor de los tres en tiempos libre le apoya en la limpia de cultivos , don Rafael desde hace 25 años se dedica a la agricultura , gracias al apoyo de sus padres que le brindaron un terreno donde pueda laborar como agricultor y velar por el bienestar de sus tres hijos , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es poder diversificar la platas de pitahayas ya que las plagas afectan demasiado a ese tipo de plantación el cual comprara los fertilizantes necesarios para mejorar la plantación ,agradece a Afodenic por la buena aprobación de su séptimo crédito y por la asistencia técnica que le brinda .Para así tener una buena cosecha y pagar su desembolso en tiempo y forma y vender a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Rafael Antonio Busto A. is 37 years old and lives in the San Ignacio neighborhood with his wife, who works as a fruit and vegetable merchant in the Masaya market, to help him with household expenses like light, water and school expenses. They have three children: a 17-year-old, a 10-year-old and a newborn. The eldest helps with the crop cleaning during his free time. Rafael has been a farmer for the last 25 years thanks to his parents, who gave him a plot of land where he can farm and see to the care of his three children. The greatest problem he faces is being able to diversify his crops of pitahayas (dragon fruit) which are heavily damaged by pests. He will use these funds to buy fertilizers to improve his plantings and is grateful to Afodenic for the approval of his 7th loan and for the technical assistance it provides that allows him to have a better crop yield and thereby sell at better prices and repay his loan in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for better pitahaya (dragon fruit) production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more educational wall adornments and Christmas decorations to sell

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora Rosa Busto, tiene la edad de 32 años,  habita en el barrio San Juan de la Concepción, Junto a su esposo el cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene dos hijos, actualmente estudiante, el mayor en tiempos libres le apoya con los trabajos agrícolas, desde hace diez años se dedica a los trabajos de campo ya que sus abuelos le apoyaron para que cultive pitahayas ya que es rica en fresco y accesible de precio, la mayor dificultad que se el presenta son las plagas que afectan al cultivo, agradece a Afodenic por la buena aprobación de su segundo préstamo ,ya que lo va a invertir en fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para obtener una buena cosecha y poder pagar en tiempo y forma su préstamo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Busto is 32 and lives in the San Juan de la Concepcion neighborhood with her husband who works and helps her with household expenses. They have 2 children in school. The older one helps her in the fields in his free time. For the past 10 years she has worked in the cultivation of dragon fruit with the support of her grandparents. Dragon fruit (from cactus) are good eaten raw and are affordable. The biggest problems are the infestations that affect the crop. Thanks to Afodenic for the approval of her second loan, she is now able to invest in fertilizer and the supplies necessary for a good crop and to be able to repay her loan on schedule..

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the cultivation of dragon fruit

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and supplies for clothing

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Yanacoto Group

texts.es:
SANTA ROSA de YANACOTO

Pamela es una señorita que tiene 21 años de edad, soltera y aún estudiante en la carrera de turismo y hotelería. Empezó a preparar kekes hace dos años atrás con un pequeño capital que le dio su madre, lo cual lo utilizó para comprar kekera, batidora, espátula e ingredientes que se requieren para la elaboración de este producto lo cual les vendió a sus amistades y familia. Poco después llegó a enterarse de los créditos que da EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD a personas como ella microempresaria, es así que decide participar en la alcancía comunal “Santa Rosa de Yanacoto”, grupo que actualmente participan diez personas. El primer capital que recibió de nuestra institución lo invirtió en moldes, cobertura de chocolate, cajitas decorativas dado a que estaba próxima la celebración de la fiesta navideña, esto le resultó rentable pues con estas ganancias le sirvió para pagar su movilidad, adquirir materiales de estudios, pagar los costos por viaje de estudios.
Necesita el préstamo para comprar moldes navideños, envolturas, cobertura de chocolate, cocoa, chantilly, harina y una probadora; de esta manera venderá sus pedidos en la época de navidad y así podrá culminar su carrera.
texts.en:
SANTA ROSA de YANACOTO Pamela is a 21-year-old, young lady who is single and a student majoring in tourism and hospitality. She began baking bundt cakes two years ago with a small amount of capital she got from her mother which she used to buy bundt cake pans, a mixer, spatulas, and the ingredients needed for this product. She sold them to her family and friends. Soon after she learned of the loans which EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD gives to entrepreneurial persons like herself so she decided to participate in the “Santa Rosa de Yanacoto" communal bank, a group which currently consists of 10 members. The initial funds she got from our institution were used to buy bundt cake forms, chocolate icing, decorative boxes since the Christmas holidays were near. This turned out to be very profitable because her profits allowed her to pay for transportation, to get school materials, and to pay her travel expenses for school. She needs this loan to buy Christmas-themed cake forms, wrapping materials, chocolate icing, cocoa, whipped cream, flour, etc. to fill her holiday orders so that she can make enough money to finish her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for a chocolate shop.

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en: Mrs. Felecia S. is from the town of Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is married and blessed with only one child who is now an adult. Felecia has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns from her business a monthly income of PHP 4,500. Currently she's obtaining her 2nd loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 which will be used as additional capital for her sari-sari store. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira S. is from the village of Talairon. She is 50 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Elvira owns and operates a specialized retail store selling health and medicinal products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Elvira joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia A. started her food vending business in October 2008.  She is 46 years old and has four children.  They are living in Lila, Bohol.  She wants to provide for her family and make her business grow.  She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. asking for support in financing her business.  She’s requesting a loan of Php 9,000 to buy more supplies and materials for food vending.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita I. is 63 years old from Lila, Bohol.  She sells dried fish and has a sari-sari (variety) store.  Her business helps her a lot in everyday living. Now she’s renovating her store for improvement.  She needs additional capital to finance her business.  Conchita is requesting a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. for Php 8,000.  This will help sustain her business and improve her status in life.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en: 42-year-old Felipa T. has a food vending business. She has two children. She sells food from her place in Lila, Bohol.  She wishes to be successful in life someday.  Now she is requesting a loan of Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. This will help her a lot in sustaining her family and her business.

loans.use: Financing for her food vending business

loans.name: Jason

texts.en: Jason D. is 28 years old and lives in Lila, Bohol.  He has three children.  He sells food to his community for a living.  He needs additional capital in order to make his business become bigger so he can earn more.  He would like to request a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to help finance his business.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en: Rosenda G. is from the village of Tipan. She is 50 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Rosenda owns and operates a manufacturing business making false teeth in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2001, Rosenda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Rosenda is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Nemesiana

texts.en: Nemesiana L. is a fish vendor, and she also has a small sari-sari (variety) store.  She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. because it helps her finance her business with low interest.  She needs a loan amounting to Php 8,000 for her to buy groceries for her store and to buy more fish to sell.  Like any other entrepreneur, she also wants to be successful.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: 51-year-old Teresita G. manages a sari-sari (variety) store in Lila, Bohol.  She started her business in May of 2008.  She has four children.  She considers her business as small but wants someday to be successful in life. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to request a loan of Php 9,000.  She needs this to buy more groceries for her store and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena H. is 34 years old and lives in Sikatuna, Bohol.  She has been running her hog raising business since September 2008.  She sustains her family through this business. She has two children and wants them to finish their studies.

She needs additional capital for her piggery, so Rowena is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to buy more feed and more pigs.

loans.use: To buy more feed and more pigs

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
52-year-old Beatriz U. manages a hog-raising business in Sikatuna, Bohol.  She wants to expand her business in order to better support her family.  She has four children.  Her income is very helpful in sending her kids to school.

She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. requesting a loan of Php 8,000.  This will help provide the feed for her piggery business.

loans.use: To buy feed

loans.name: Vertilla

texts.en: Since June 2008, Vertilla L. has been running a hog-raising business.  She is 37 years old and lives in Sikatuna, Bohol with her one child.  Her business helps provide the basic needs of her family.  She needs more capital to continue with her piggery business.  She’s requesting a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. for buying feeds and pigs.

loans.use: To buy feed and pigs

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
49-year old Maria R. dreams of someday becoming successful and would like to see her children complete their studies.  She lives in Sikatuna, Boholhas, and has three children.  She has a hog raising business which she uses to support her family.

She has joined the Community Economic Ventures, Inc. for loans to financial support for her business.  Sheis requesting a loan amount of Php 8,000 to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: Financing her hog raising business

loans.name: Restie

texts.en:
Restie C. sells dried fish in Corella, Bohol. He use a multicab to transport and sell his dried fish.

Restie is married to Michelle and they have only one child. He wants to make his business grow and help sustain his family.

Restie would like to ask for a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. He will use it to buy more dried fish and to maintain the vehicle he uses for his business.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish and to maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
35-year old Janette S. has a food-vending business in Corella, Bohol. With this small business she is able to sustain the basic needs of her family. She has three children to support and take good care of.

Janette joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to have financial support for her business. She’s requesting a loan of Php 13,000 which will be very helpful in sustaining her business and also her family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda C. is 38 years old and lives in Corella, Bohol. She has three children.

Rosalinda manages a sari-sari (variety) store as a source of income for her family. She started this kind of business in June 2008. She needs additional capital for her business. She hopes to make her store bigger.

Rosalinda joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and would like to request a loan of Php 12,000. This loan will help her purchase supplies for her sari-sari store.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Belina

texts.en:
Belina A. manages a hog-raising business in Panglao, Bohol. She is 53 years old and the mother of two children. She sustains her family with the business she has. She wants her business to grow in order to help her family’s finances and be able to send her children to school.

Belina joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in 2004. She’s now requesting a loan of Php 6,000 to buy pig feed and to acquire more pigs.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and to acquire more pigs

loans.name: Tirsa

texts.en:
39-year-old Tirsa B. has a fishing business in Panglao, Bohol. She has seven children and the eldest is twenty years old. She wishes to be successful to enable her to support her family.

Tirsa joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to request a loan of Php 8,000. She will use the loan to buy materials needed for fishing.

loans.use: To buy materials needed for fishing

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena O. is 37 years old and is the mother of seven children. She is already a widow and strives hard to survive in the difficulties of life.

Maria Elena supports her family with her manicure and pedicure business but needs financial support in sustaining her business. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in February 2008 because it has a low interest rate. She’s now requesting a loan of Php 8,000 to buy more supplies and materials needed for her business.

loans.use: To buy more supplies and materials needed for her business

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima De Huaripachi Group

texts.es:
Esta alcancía comunal se formó hace tres años en el distrito D. Matucana, participan en elL. diez personas microempresarias, con los préstamos que recibieron durante este tiempo cada uno lo ha invertido en su negocio con objetivos diferentes. Tal es el caso D. Rosa B. que a sus 29 años es madre D. dos niños (10 y 3 años D. edad), hace cuatro años emprenD. el negocio D. comida D. manera ambulatoria, tiene una carreta móvil que compró con el dinero que le daba su esposo. Empezó a trabajar D. esta manera porque atravesaba una difícil situación económica, el dinero que daba su esposo para los gastos del hogar no alcanzaba.

Es así que al principio le fiaban los víveres para L. preparación D. sus comidas, al finalizar el día Rosa tenía que pagar estos productos con las ventas D. cachanga, café y pollo frito. Su esfuerzo, buen trato y deseo D. superarse hizo atraer mayor consumidores, con los préstamos que recibió compró platos, tasas, cubiertos, bancas y un toldo. Este negocio ha ayudado mucho a Rosa porque le ha permitido comprarles a sus pequeños hijos zapatos, ropa, útiles escolares y gastos básicos del hogar.

Necesita el crédito porque quiere renovar el toldo que se ha deteriorado por el uso así mismo una cocina D. mesa.
texts.en:
This communal bank was formed three years ago in the Matucana district and is maD. up of ten micro-entrepreneurs. Each person has invested the loans they have received throughout the years in their businesses, though with different objectives. Rosa B., for example, is the mother of two children who are 10 and 3 years old. Four years ago, she started a food cart business with money her husband gave her. She started this business because of economic hardship; the money her husband earned was not enough for household needs. At the beginning, Rosa would take out on credit the supplies she needed, and at the end of the day, she would pay the store back with what she earned selling "cachangas" (large flat bread), coffee, and fried chicken. Rosa's efforts, her nice manner, and her desire to succeed led to more customers. With the loans she received, she has bought plates, cups, silverware, benches, and a tent. This business has helped Rosa a lot, since it has allowed her to buy shoes, clothes and school supplies for her little ones, and to pay for basic household needs. She needs the new loan because she wants to buy a kitchen table and to repair the tent, which has deteriorated after much use.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing/supplying business

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
49-year-old Carmela A. has a barbecue business in Dauis, Panglao, that she started in May 2006. She has eight children and the eldest is 27 years old. Her business helps in supporting the needs of her family.

Carmela would like to have additional capital to be used to expand her business. She joined in Community Economic Ventures, Inc. requesting a loan of Php 12,000. This loan will help her finance her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: To use as additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Joselinda

texts.en: Mrs. Joselinda D. is from the village of Tugas, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is married and is blessed with five children who are school-aged. Joselinda owns and operates a business selling of RTW's (ready-to-wear clothes) in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for more than ten years, earning PHP 5,000 net income from her business. In 2002, Joselinda joined PMPC to access its programs and services. Currently, she's obtaining her 12th loan in the amount of PHP 50,000 which will be used for house renovation. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora R. strives so hard to support her children and to enable them to finish their studies and become professionals. She’s now 55 years old and has four children, her eldest being 26 years old. As a widow, she spends her time managing a food canteen in their place.

Dioscora needs additional capital to finance her business. She’s now requesting a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. This will help her buy food supplies and ingredients for her small canteen.

loans.use: To buy food supplies and ingredients for her small canteen

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma D. is a fish vendor in Dauis, Panglao. The income she receives from her business supports the studies of her three children, the eldest being 18 years old. She works hard so that her children will have a good future.

Gemma joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to ask for financial support for her business with a low interest rate. She’s requesting a loan of Php 10,000 as additional capital to continue with her business.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Charito

texts.en: Charito L. is from the village of Biasong. She is 42 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Charito owns and operates a manufacturing business, manufacturing and selling clay products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Charito joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Charito is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 10th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Pedaylinda

texts.en:
Pedaylinda C. offers massage services to hotels and homeowners in Tagbilaran and Panglao. She is 46 years old and has three children, her eldest being 17 years old. She wants to work hard in order to send her children to school.

Pedaylinda joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to obtain a loan with a low interest rate. She’s requesting a loan of Php 16,000 to buy uniforms and materials needed for massage services. She also needs a cellphone to easily communicate with her customers to make appointments.

loans.use: To buy uniforms and materials needed for massage services

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
55-year-old Virginia has a food-vending business in Dauis, Panglao, selling a variety of snacks in her community. She has ten children to support so she’s saving a certain amount for the education of her children. 

Virginia needs additional capital to enable her business to grow. She’s now requesting a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. This loan will help finance her growing business.

loans.use: To use as additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Marjoren

texts.en: Marjoren T. is from the village of Biasong. She is 30 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Marjoren owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Marjoren joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marjoren is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna is a vendor of RTW (ready to wear clothes) and blankets in her village. Forty-nine years old and married to Demetrio, a welder, she is the mother of six children: Aira Hazel-16 years old; Michel James-14 years old, high school student; Michelle-13 years old, high school student; Ervin Johnson-11 years old, elementary school student; Prince Assi-8 years old, and the youngest, Princess Dianne-6 years old.

Donna would like to request a loan of PHP4,000 from KIVA lenders for business improvement. She believes that this amount will assist her in making her business more profitable by purchasing more products to sell. Her income will benefit her family and help finance the education of her children.

loans.use: Additional capital to  purchase more products

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Mrs. Felicidad L. is from the village of Siloy, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old, is married, and is blessed with three school-aged children.

Felicidad owns and operates a business selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns 12,000 PHP monthly net income.

In 2007, Felicidad joined PMPC to access its programs and services. Currently, she's obtaining her 3rd loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Mrs. Merlie H., 28 years of age, is married and is a resident of Purok 3, San Apolinario, Tangub City. She has one child, 2 years old. Her husband, Mr. Ronald H., is presently engaged in fishing with an average net income of P600 a day.

With a capitalization of only P3,000, they were able to purchase a fishing net fifteen years ago. With a good income, they were able to sustain their fishing livelihood.

As a new member of PMPC, Mrs. H. was able to obtain a loan of P5,000 under the Medal Pangnegosyo loan program. The proceeds of her loan will be used to purchase additional fishing nets.

Mrs. H. is very interested in the programs and services of Paglaum, specially insurance, and that is why she was very eager to join Paglaum Coop.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing nets

location.town: Purok 3 San Apolinario, Tangub City, Mindanao

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, a direct-seller of cosmetics in her village in Caritan Norte, Tuguegarao,City, has two children: Jennifer -17 years old, a college student studying Chemical Engineering, and Santiago Jr. - 15 years old- a junior high school student.

Maria is requesting a loan of PHP10,000 from the KIVA lenders to purchase additional products to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes that her loan request will be granted. Maria is hoping and praying that she will be able to improve her family's standard of living through the income she generates from her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for her cosmetic products sales

loans.name: Renepura

texts.en: Renepura E. is from the village of So. Poblacion. She is 53 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Renepura owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2000, Renepura joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Renepura is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 11th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida O. is from the village of Dela Paz. She is 51 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Nida owns and operates a nipa hut business (the native house constructed out of bamboo with a thatched roof using leaves of the nipa palm), primarily making and selling native roofs in the local community. Nida has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Nida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Nida is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Erlinda S., 55 years old, is married to Marcial S. and is a resident of Baybay, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. Her husband earns income from their own parcel of rice land. On average he earns only P5,000 every trimester. Because of this, the family was experiencing a financial crisis.

To help her husband in raising their five children, Erlinda decided to engage in business. She opened up a little sari-sari (variety) store in her home. For twenty-three years she has been able to sustain the business and is able to help in supporting her family. Now she is earning an average net income of not less than P3,000, which is so helpful for their family income.

As a new member of Honeybee Center under the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People) program of Paglaum MPC, Erlinda is given the privilege of obtaining P5,000 as her first loan to add to the capital of her existing sari-sari store business.

Erlinda is very much interested in, and thankful for, the savings and education programs of Paglaum Coop.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 44 years old, married and blessed with three children: Joseph, 23, high school graduate; Hanie Lyn, 20 years old, college student, and Winilope, 17 years old, high school graduate. They are living a happy life in the village of Larion Alto, Tuguegarao City.

Aida has owned and operated a sari-sari store business (community-based store) in their village for four years now. She wishes for her business to grow by carrying more stocks of commodities in her store and so is asking KIVA lenders to assist her with a loan of PHP 25,000. Her business has been of great help in meeting the needs of their family.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase more goods for her store

loans.name: Ramira

texts.en:
Ramira J. is from the village of Salimpuno, Sapang Dalaga, Mis. Occ.. She is 48 years old. Ramira is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Ramira owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting cassava for sale. Ramira has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Ramira joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ramira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Ramira is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Ramira from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Motorcycle transport is the primary source of income of Marivic and her husband, Crispin, in the village of Larion Alto, Tuguegarao City. Aside from this, her husband also manages their farm while Marivic sells cosmetics in their village to earn additional income.

For the continuous development of their transport business, Marivic is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders. This will be used for the repair and maintenance of their motorcycle that they use for their transport business so as to ensure the safety of their customers. Marivic hopes that her loan request will be granted for it will also assist her in her retailing business.

The couple are blessed with three children. The eldest is already a college graduate while the youngest is still studying. The couple hopes that their youngest child will also receive a college degree.

loans.use: To repair and maintain their motorcycle

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 45 years old and living in Larion Alto, Tuguegarao, City. She is married and they were gifted with two children.  

Fe is engaged in a meat-retailing business, while her husband is working as a carpenter in their village. Together they are helping one another in providing the needs of their family.  

Fe wants her business to improve, and this is why she is asking for a loan of PHP10,000 from the Kiva lenders. She plans to buy kilos of pork and other commodities that she can offer to her customers. She is hoping that her business will continue to improve through the help of the lenders.

loans.use: To buy kilos of pork and other commodities to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is 38 years old and married. Her husband is working in Australia as a welder. They are blessed with three children: Mathew, 22 years old; Timothy, 20 years old and Christopher, 18 years old.  All of them are college students.  She is a responsible mother and helps her parents in supporting their daily needs through her direct-selling business of AVON products. She is persevering to succeed in this business to give her family a progressive living someday. Her family is residing in the agricultural-based community of Larion Alto, Tuguegarao, City, and farming is their family's main source of income. 

Asuncion is requesting a loan from the Kiva lenders amounting to PHP10,000. She will use the amount to purchase more AVON products, like cosmetics, apparel and other items that she can offer to her customers. She believes that the more capital she can roll into her direct selling, the higher the income she could get.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her personal products business

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris B. is from the village of Biasong. She is 42 years old. Doris is single. To make a living, Doris owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general alterations and tailoring services to local community members. Doris has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Doris joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Doris has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Doris is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Doris from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia E. is from the town of Aloran. She is 74 years old. Dionesia is married and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Dionesia owns and operates a "sari-sari" general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Dionesia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Dionesia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dionesia has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Dionesia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 16th loan taken out by Dionesia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia, de 35 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus 3 hijos; Evelin de 8, Maycol de 5 y Tatiana de 2 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La tienda de abarrotes de Antonia es una de las más concurridas de su barrio, el gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras desde muy temprano, ya que saben que es la primera tienda en abrir.

Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos sobre las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 4 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, ya que tiene que atender de corrido si no quiere que sus ventas bajen. 
Para más adelante, espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en la bodega principal de su barrio.

Este el quinto préstamo de Antonia con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los dos mil quinientos soles solicitados comprará mas provisiones para su tienda de abarrotes y así incrementará su stock de productos.
texts.en:
Antonia is 35 years old. She is a happy and hardworking woman. She lives in a rented house with her 3 children, Evelin who is 8 years old, Maycol, 5, and Tatiana who is 2. Her children are the motivation for all her effort. Antonia's grocery store is one of the most busy in her neighborhood. Her great charisma and kindness have made her the favorite of her neighbors, who do not hesitate in doing their shopping since very early because they know hers is the first store to open. What she likes best about her work is chatting with her neighbors about the things that happen in the neighborhood. She has been working on this for 4 years and thinks that the hardest thing is having to be all day long inside her store, since she has to tend to it continuously if she doesn't want her sales to decrease. In the future, she hopes her business grows and becomes the main grocery store in her neighborhood. This is Antonia's fifth loan with MFP. She knows that if she pays it on time she will have access to another one with more ease and without bringing complications to her communal bank where she is well loved by the rest of her partners. With the two thousand and five hundred soles requested she will buy more provisions for her grocery store and in that way increase her stock of products.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing merchandise

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata, de 43 años, es una mujer muy alegre y sincera, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Héctor de 35 años y sus 3 hijos: Dianeth, de 13, Gari de 10 y Karem de 6 años, a quienes desea dar una buen educación.

El negocio de Fortunata es la venta de hierbas medicinales, esta actividad le ha sido muy rentable y le ha dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Ella compra las hierbas al por mayor, para luego venderlas entre sus clientes, tiene un puesto ubicado en la Explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), pero ella prefiere vender en su propia casa, ya que puede aprovechar para realizar una que otra curación, cuando el cliente se lo pide.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en la feria, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día en su puesto, ya que le resulta muy cansado y estresante. 
Para un futuro cercano, espera poder contar con una tienda donde pueda vender con más tranquilidad y realizar eventuales curaciones.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Fortunata con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es muy querida por sus socias debido a la alegría que pone en el grupo. Con los mil quinientos soles solicitados comprará más hierbas para incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que vende.
texts.en:
Fortunate is 43 years old. She is a very happy and sincere woman. She lives in a rented house together with her husband Hector who is 35 years old and their 3 children: Dianeth, 13; Gari, 10; and Karem, 6 years old, whom she would like to offer a good education. Fortunata's business is selling medicinal herbs. This activity has been very profitable and has given her the income necessary to support her family. She buys herbs in bulk to then sell them to her customers. She has a stand located in the Explanada Laguna Temporal (a place where fairs are held in the city of Juliaca), but she prefers selling in her own home, because that way she can take the opportunity to do a healing here or there, when a customer asks for it. What she likes the best about her work is talking with her neighbors in sales and finding out about the things that happen at the fair. She has been doing this for 20 years and believes that the hardest part is staying all day at her stand because it is tiring and stressful. In the near future she would like to have a store where she can sell at her leisure and do occasional healings. This is Fortunata's third loan with MFP. She has been very punctual in her previous loans and expects to be so this time as well. In her communal bank she is well loved by her partners because of the happiness she gives to the group. With the one thousand five hundred soles requested she will buy more herbs to increase the quantity of merchandise she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increasing merchandise

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela M. is from the village of Calacaan. She is 54 years old. Marcela is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Marcela owns and operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling products to local businesses and community members. Marcela has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Marcela joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Marcela is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Marcela from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly M. is from the village of Conat. She is 42 years old. Jelly is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Jelly owns and operates a "sari-sari" general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jelly has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Jelly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jelly has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Jelly is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Jelly from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio, de 44 años, es un hombre muy noble y sincero, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su único hijo y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.

Todos los días, a las 6 de la mañana, sale junto a su inseparable triciclo en busca de clientes para transportar de un lugar a otro. Los mercados y lugares más concurridos de la ciudad de Juliaca son sus principales zonas, ya que él sabe que es ahí donde más gente puede necesitar sus servicios y más aun si es lunes, ya que ese día se realiza la feria de la ciudad y hay más movimiento.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede pasear por las calles de la ciudad y al mismo tiempo cumplir con su trabajo, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar hasta muy altas horas de la noche, corriendo el peligro de que su triciclo sea robado. 
Para más adelante, espera poder juntar el dinero necesario, para poder pagar los estudios superiores de su hijo.

Es el tercer préstamo de Gregorio con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesto a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es muy responsable, ya que no quiere quedar mal ante el resto de sus compañeras. Es el tercer préstamo de Gregorio con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesto a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es muy responsable, ya que no quiere quedar mal ante el resto de sus compañeras.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 44 years old. He is a noble and sincere gentleman who lives in a rented house with his only son. What he wants most is to have a peaceful retirement.

Every day at 6am, he goes about in his tricycle looking for customers who need a ride from one place to another. The markets and other crowded places in the city of Juliaca are the areas he targets. More people are in need of his services on Mondays, because that is the day when the city fairs take place and bring about more traffic.

Gregorio enjoys the fact that he gets to stroll through the streets of the city as part of his job. He has been doing this for 15 years and the most difficult part for him is working late at night. During this time, he runs a greater risk of having his tricycle stolen. At some point, he hopes to save enough money for his son to attend college.

Gregorio is taking his third loan with MFP and is committed to making his payments on time. He is very responsible and does not want to create problems for the other Communal Bank members. The money he is requesting will be used to pay for repairs to his tricycle.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairs to his tricycle

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 60 years old and a resident of Larion Alto, Tuguegaro, City. She and her husband were blessed with six children: Marites, 39 years old; Gilbert, 36 years old; Michael, 34 years old; Mary Jane, 28 years old; Junel, 26 years old and Mary Ann, 23 years old. All of them are married and live separately from Isabel and her husband. Isabel has been a hog-raiser for more than ten years. She started this kind of business to assist her husband in providing the needs of their family and also for their farming business. Her children are their inspiration to work hard and for them to have a progressive way of living.

Isabel is applying for a loan from the Kiva lenders amounting to PHP20,000. This amount will be used to buy more piglets for her piggery, in order for her to have an increase in income. She is hoping that the lenders will grant her loan request.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Full of hopes and aspirations in life is our featured entrepreneur. She is Ms. Adelina T., 29 years of age, a single mother and a resident of Barangay III, Tangub City. Together with her 3-year-old child, they face life together.

For her source of income, Adelina decided to open a sari-sari (variety) store four years ago and has been able to sustain it even through those crisis years. Now she is earning an average net income of not less than P5,000 a month which is of great help to her and to her family.

As a newly recognized member under the regular loan program of Paglaum MPC, Adelina is given the privilege of applying for an amount of P20,000 as her first loan. She will use it to add to the revolving capital of her existing sari-sari store business.

Adelina is so very thankful for the programs and services offered, especially our savings program.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa es una joven muy trabajadora, tiene 26 años y vive en su casa propia con sus 4 hijos: Raúl de 10, Miriam de 7, Yudith de 5 y Freddy de 1 año, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

La crianza de ganado es una actividad que Josefa aprendió desde muy pequeña de sus padres, quienes siempre trabajaron muy duro para darle una buena vida. Actualmente tiene su propio ganado, el cual cuida y alimenta muy bien, ya que sabe que de la buena crianza de sus animales, dependen los ingresos económicos que tendrá su familia.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es alimentar a sus animales, lleva 6 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar su ganado hasta la feria donde lo vende. 
Para más adelante, espera poder incrementar el número de reses que tiene y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Josefa con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, aunque para ello tenga que ahorrar poco a poco. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa y solidaria, motivo por el cual es muy respetada por sus compañeras. Con los dos mil soles solicitados comprará una ternera para criarla y alimentarla, con el dinero que sobre comprará forraje (pasto) para su ganado.
texts.en:
Josefa is a very hard-working young woman. She is 26 years old and lives in her own home with her four children: Raúl, 10; Miriam, 7; Yudith, 5; and Freddy, 1; who are the motivation for all her efforts. Josefa learned how to raise cattle from a very young age from her parents, who always worked very hard to give her a better life. Currently she has her own cattle, which she raises and feeds very well, since her family's economic income depends on it. What she most enjoys about her job is feeding her animals. She has been doing this for six years and considers transferring the cattle to the market where they are sold is the hardest part. In the future, she hopes to increase the heads of cattle she has and in this way increase her income. This is Josefa's second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she feels the responsibility to pay on time even if it means having to save little by little. She is a very active and supportive member of her community bank, which is why she is very respected by her fellow members. With the 2,000 soles she is requesting, she plans to buy a calf to rear and feed, and with the remainder of the money she will purchase feed for her cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura, de 43 años, es mujer muy alegre y luchadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 4 hijos; Jaime de 22, Paulo de 20, Jesús y Domenica de 14, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Para Laura la venta de licores es un negocio muy rentable, ya que tiene mucha demanda y sus ventas siempre son buenas, ella atiende en su propia casa y es desde este mismo lugar que despacha a sus compradores las cajas de licor que compra directamente de la fábrica, también lleva a pedido a las distintas provincias de la región.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede atender su negocio y dedicarse a las labores de su hogar al mismo tiempo, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es comprar los licores, ya que existe muchas bebidas adulteradas y tiene que saber diferenciarlas. 
Para el futuro, desea tener una tienda grande donde pueda vender de todo y no solo limitarse a los licores.

Es el sexto préstamo al que accede Laura con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus cuotas anteriores y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre les da consejos a las demás socias. Con los dos mil quinientos soles solicitados comprará más cajas de licor para poder ofrecer una mayor cantidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Laura is a 43-year-old woman who is very happy and hard working. She lives in her own home along with her four children: Jaime, 22; Paulo, 20; Jesús and Domenica, 14; who are the motivation for all her efforts. Selling liquor is a very profitable business for Laura since the product is in high demand and her sales are always good. She tends to her home and that's also where she receives cases of liquor to sell direct from the factory. She also takes orders from distinct provinces in the region. What she most likes about her job is being able to tend to her business and also take care of her household duties at the same time. She has been doing this activity for five years and considers buying the liquor to be the most difficult part since there are many adult beverages and she has to know all the differences. For the future, she wants to have a big store where she can sell everything and not limit herself to just liquor. This is the sixth loan Laura has received from Kiva partner MFP, and she has been very punctual with her past payments and hopes to be again. She is a very happy member of her community bank and always gives advice to the other members. With the 2,500 soles loan she is requesting, she plans to buy more cases of liquor to be able to offer a wider selection to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more liquor to sell

loans.name: Be Marie

texts.en: Be Marie M. is from the village of Mitazan. She is 42 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Be Marie owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2002, Be Marie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Be Marie is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 18th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Micaela, de 51 años, ha luchado mucho para sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo (Alipio), de 48 años, y con sus 4 hijos: Guido de 18, David de 16, Hilbert de 24 y Gladys de 26 años, y desea con todas sus fuerzas tener un futuro más prometedor.

Las 5 de la mañana, es la hora en que Micaela despierta para sacar a pastear a sus animales, los cuales cría con mucho cariño y dedicación, ya que sabe que de la buena crianza de sus animales depende la ganancia que obtendrá por venderlos, ella lleva sus reses a vender a la feria de la ciudad de Huancané donde siempre obtiene muy buenas ganancias.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es caminar por los inmensos campos por donde pastea a su ganado, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que los más dificl es trasladar sus animales hasta la feria. 
Para el futuro de su negocio, espera poder incrementar el número de reses que tiene y así poder aumentar sus ingresos.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Micaela con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que siente que tiene una responsabilidad con las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada por el orden que le pone a las reuniones. Con los setecientos soles solicitados comprará más forraje (pasto) para alimentar mejor a sus animales.
texts.en:
Micaela is 51 years old and has fought hard to move up in life. She lives in her own home along with her husband, Alipio, 48, and their four children: Guido, 18; David, 16; Hilbert, 24; and Gladys, 26. She wishes with all her might for a brighter future. At 5 in the morning, Micaela waks up to graze her animals, which she raises with a lot of tenderness and dedication because she knows that the profits she makes when she sells them depends on their care. She takes her heads of cattle to sell at the market in the city of Huancané, where she always earns very good profits. What she likes most about her job is walking through the immense fields where she grazes her cattle. She has 10 years' experience in the business and considers taking the cattle to market to be the most difficult part. In the future, she hopes to be able to increase her heads of cattle and thus increase her income. This is Micaela's second loan through Kiva partner MFP, and she has made all of her payments on time. She feels a responsibility as a member of her community bank, where she is very respected for putting together meetings with the other members. With the 700 soles she is requesting, she plans to purchase more feed to better nourish her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed for her animals

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
Narcisa, de 44 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa, vive en una pequeña casa junto a sus 2 hijos; Wilson de 22 y Gerber de 20 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

En el tiempo que Narcisa viene realizando la crianza de ganado, ha podido forjarse una vida digna, ella realiza esta actividad desde que era muy joven y actualmente se ha convertido en una de las ganaderas más solicitadas, debido a las grandes reses que lleva a vender a la ciudad de Juliaca.
Narcisa es natural de Taraco (distrito de la provincia de Huancané) y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es criar su ganado, ya que sabe que mientras mejor los cuide, mejores pagos le darán por sus reses. Lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar las reses hasta el lugar de la venta, puesto que es una actividad que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo. 
Para más adelante, desea poner una tienda de abarrotes, la cual le pueda generar ingresos adicionales y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Este es el primer préstamo de Narcisa con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, puesto que no quiere meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida debido a la alegría que le pone a las reuniones. Con los mil soles solicitados  comprará una vaca, pero para completar el costo total está dispuesta a poner dinero de sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Narcissa is 44 years old and a loving mother. She lives in a small house with her two sons, Wilson (age 22) and Gerber (age 20), who are the reason behind all her efforts.

Narcissa has been raising cattle in order to forge a decent life for herself. She learned how to take care of animals at a young age and now her cattle are some of the most sought after livestock being sold in the city of Juliaca. Narcissa is a native of Taraco (a district in the province of Huancané). She enjoys caring for her animals because the more attention she given them, the higher the prices she can command. For 30 years, Narcissa has been at her job and says the most difficult part for her is transporting her animals to market because it demands much time and effort. At some point in the future, she would like to open a grocery store so that she can generate additional income and improve her family’s quality of life.

This is her first loan with MFP. Narcissa feels the responsibility of making her payments on time because she does not want to get in trouble with the other members of her Communal Bank. She is adored by everyone else because she brings much joy to all of their meetings. Narcissa will use her loan of 1000 soles to buy a cow, but she needs to save up some additional funds in order to complete the purchase.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer
