loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: Maura

texts.en: Maura I. is from the city of Oroquieta. She is 51 years old, is married, and has three adult-aged children. Maura owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2001, Maura joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Maura is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 21st from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita and her family live in the village of Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Aguilar and they are blessed with four children. They are all studying in tertiary and secondary education. Despite the hardships and difficulties in life, she and her husband are striving hard to earn a living and to provide them with their educational needs.  

The common source of their income is farming.  Her husband cultivates their farm by planting rice and vegetables. Clarita is engaged in a fish-vending business in their village to help her husband in providing the needs of their family. With a small amount of capital at hand, she purchases her products at the Bayombong public market and then sells them in their village.  She can earn a weekly income of $15. 

Since her business is profitable, she wants to acquire more products so that she can have a bigger income.  She is now asking for financial assistance from the Kiva lenders amounting to PHP13,000.  This will be used to buy additional kilos of fish that she can sell in their village.

loans.use: To buy kilos of fish

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 20 años y es una joven con muchos deseos de superación, vive en la casa de sus padres y quiere sobre salir en la vida.

La activad de la familia de Rosa siempre fue la crianza de ganado, es por eso que desde muy pequeña ella aprendió a realizar esta actividad. Ahora tiene su propio ganado y los alimenta muy bien, porque sabe que del buen estado de sus reses dependerán las ganancias que obtendrá por su venta.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es alimentar a sus animales, puesto que siente que les da el cariño que se merecen, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que llevar su ganado hasta las ferias de las ciudades donde lo vende.
Con el tiempo, espera poder incrementar el ganado que tiene actualmente para así tener unos mejores ingresos.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y sabe que tiene que cumplir con los pagos de todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los dos mil soles solicitados comprará una ternera para criarla, alimentarla y luego venderla a un precio mayor.
texts.en:
Rosa is 20 years old and is a young woman with a great desire to excel. She lives in her parents' home and wants to succeed. The activity of Rose's family was always raising cattle. That's why she learned from when she was very small how to do that. She now has her own cattle and feeds them well, because she knows that the good condition of her cattle depends on the profits that she makes from its sale. What she likes best about her job is to feed her animals because she feels that it gives them the love they deserve. She has been doing this for 4 years and believes that the hardest part is having to drive her cattle to the festivals of cities where she sells them. Over time, she hopes to increase the number of cattle that she has in order to have better earnings. This is her second loan with MFP, and she knows that she has to meet all of her payments on time. In her community bank, she is a very cheerful and supportive partner. With the two thousand soles, she will buy a calf, raise it, feed it and then sell it at a higher price.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a calf for raising and sale

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila es una madre de familia muy amorosa, tiene 43 años y vive en su casa propia junto a su único hijo, Elvis de 9 años, y lo que más desea es darle una buena educación.

En la localidad de Jasana Capallino (comunidad del distrito de Huancané), se encuentra el negocio de Teofila, ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres, quienes siempre se preocuparon por darle una actividad con la cual defenderse en el futuro. Su ganado lo lleva a vender a la feria de Huancané, donde son muy solicitados por lo bien cuidados y alimentados que están.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es pastear a sus animales, ya que disfruta mucho del aire libre, lleva 20 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar su ganado hasta las ferias dominicales donde lo vende. 
Para el futuro de su negocio, espera incrementar la cantidad de ganado que tiene actualmente, para así mejor sus ingresos.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Teofila con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una de las socias más cumplidas y puntuales. Con los 2000 soles solicitados comprará una ternerita lechera, la cual le costará aproximadamente 3500 soles, para ello completará el monto con dinero de sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Teofila is the mother of a very loving family. She is 43 years old and lives in her own house with her only son, Elvis, who is 9 years old, and what she wants most is to give him a good education. In the village of Jasana Capallino (a community in the district of Huancané), you can find Teofila's business. She raises cattle, which is a trade that she learned from her parents who always made sure she knew how to support herself. She sells her cattle at the Huancane fair, where they are in high demand because of how well they are cared for and fed. What she likes best about her job is to let the animals graze, as she enjoys the outdoors. With 20 years in this trade, she believes that the most difficult part is to deliver her cattle to the Sunday fairs where they sell. For the future of her business, she hopes to increase the quantity of her stock so that can increase her earnings. This is the second loan for Teofila with MFP, and she is willing to pay all her dues on time. At her community bank, she is one of the most accomplished members and is punctual. With the 2,000 requested soles, she will purchase a dairy calf, which will cost approximately 3,500 soles. She will add the loan amount to her savings in order to accomplish this.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a calf for raising and sale

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en: Feliciana O. is from the village of Tipolo. She is 45 years old and is single. Feliciana owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Feliciana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase pig feed and other supplies. Feliciana is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel, de 40 años, es una madre muy amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 hijos: Roxana de 17, Freddy de 14 y Jhon de 12 años y lo que más desea es darles una buena educación.

El amor y cariño con el que Ysabel cuida a su ganado, ha hecho que sus animales crezcan grandes y fuertes, motivo por el cual, cuando los lleva a vender a las ferias son muy solicitados y rápidamente comprados. Desde muy temprano los lleva a pastear y siempre esta fijándose en que la comida que están ingiriendo sea saludable.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es caminar por los extensos campos en compañía de su ganado, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo que más difícil de su trabajo es llevar sus reses hasta las ferias donde las vende.
Con el tiempo, espera aumentar el número de ganado que tiene actualmente, pero sabe que para eso tiene que trabajar mucho y está dispuesta a hacerlo.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Ysabel con MFP, por lo que se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, puesto que no quiere perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por la alegría que le pone al grupo. Con los 2000 soles solicitados incrementara su capital para comprar un toro, el cual tiene un costo de 4000 soles.
texts.en:
Ysabel, who is 40, is a very loving mother. She lives in her own home with her 3 children: Roxanne, 17, Freddy, 14 and Jhon who is 12 years old. What she wants most is to give them a good education. The love and affection with which Ysabel cares for her livestock has made her animals grow big and strong, which is why when she brings them to the market to sell at the fairs, they are in high demand and quickly purchased. From very early on, she lets them graze and is always making sure the food they eat is healthy. What she likes best about her job is to walk through the vast fields with her livestock. She has spent 20 years in this trade and believes that the most difficult part of her job is to bring their cattle to the fairs where they are sold. Over time, she hopes to increase the number of cattle that she has but knows she has to work hard and is willing to do so. This is the second loan with MFP for Ysabel. She agrees to pay all her dues on time, so as not to harm other members of her community bank, where she is loved since she brings joy to the group. With the 2,000 soles requested, she wishes to increase her capital to buy a bull, which costs 4,000 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her capital in order to buy a bull

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 45 years old and married to Romeo. They are blessed with three children: Nolisa, 25 years old; Christian, 23 years old and Ma. Kristina, 22 years old.  All of them are high school graduates.

Imelda owns and manages a general store business.  She would like to continue improving her store to further sustain the basic needs of their family.  To be able to realize her dreams, she would like to borrow additional capital from the Kiva lenders amounting to PHP5,000. She plans to use the loan to purchase different merchandise for her store and hopefully expand her business.  This will serve as a big help in fulfilling her dreams in life. She is praying that she will be loaned this amount.

loans.use: Additional capital for business expansion

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene I. is from the village of Buena Vista. She is 32 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Irene owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2004, Irene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Irene is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen manages a sari-sari (variety) store for a living. She is 44 years old, married, and has four children. Her eldest is 26 years old. Helen dreams of sending them all to school. Aside from her store, she also sells fish, and hopes to buy a fishing boat so she could sell and earn more. Helen applied to CEVI and requested a loan of Php17,000. This loan will be used to fund her fishing business.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat for her fishing business

loans.name: Renchin

texts.en:
R. is 47 years old and lives with her three children in the Zavkhan province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her two younger children attend the university.

R. operates a meat inspection laboratory in her town. She got permission from the government and began to operate her business in 1998. She examines samples of all the meat products in the local markets for quality and cleanliness. For each sample she takes, she is paid about 50 cents. She is proud that she provides a valuable service to her community by protecting her neighbors from potentially dangerous food.

She says, “I want to continue to pay the tuition fees for my children and I want them to be educated young adults with a great passion and enthusiasm for life.”

She is planning to expand her laboratory and to buy new tools in order to increase the quality of her service. She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan in order to purchase new, high-tech tools for her meat inspection business.

loans.use: To purchase new, high-tech tools for her meat examination business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: 39-year-old Helen F. and her husband, Nilo, have two children. Helen used to buy dried fish and sell them at retail. Now she has her own fishing boat, so she does not have to buy fish from other people. She can dry the fish herself and sell them. Helen requested a loan of Php12,000 from CEVI. She will use this loan to fund her business and hopefully, she will be able to reach her goals.

loans.use: To fund her fish-selling business.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
“If there is patience, there is progress.” This is the guiding principle of Rosemarie from the village of Uddiawan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 54 years old and married to Cornelio. They were gifted with three children: Karren, Oliver and Cornelio Jr. They want them be successful in the future and to have a more comfortable life. 

Farming is their main source of income.  They cultivate their farm by planting rice, vegetables and fruits. In addition, Rosemarie manages a small sari-sari (variety) store in their village. She sells different grocery items and soft drinks which she acquires from the Solano Public Market.  According to her, she can make a net income of $15 a week, which she uses to buy their daily needs and to finance the schooling of their children.

Rosemarie realizes that she can increase her income when she acquires additional items to sell which are commonly needed in their village.  With this knowledge, she decided to request a loan from the Kiva lenders amounting to PHP8,000.00.  She hopes and believes that she can improve her small sari-sari store through this financial assistance.

loans.use: additional capital for the improvement of her sari-sari store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hermelita

texts.en: Hermilita, 26 years old, has been married to her husband, Crisanto, for nearly five years now. They have two children, the older one being six years old. Hermilita buys shells and dried fish, and then goes around her community to sell them. This business helps her sustain her family. She hopes to grow her business more so that she could also save for her children’s future. She is now requesting to borrow Php6,000 from the Kiva field partner, Community Economic Ventures. She will use this loan to fund her business.

loans.use: To fund her shells/fish business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma has a fishing business for her livelihood and does her best to sustain it and make it grow. She is 39 years old, married, and has five children.

Alma said that, by God’s grace, her business is currently doing well. She wants to maintain this condition so she applied for a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner. Receiving the loan will be truly worthwhile for Alma’s fishing business.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her fishing business

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita P. lives in the village of Bucros, La Carlota City Negros Occidental. She is 60 years old, but still strong and able to manage her business. She is a widow with three children aging between 23 to 37 years old, all of whom have already finished their studies through the help of NWTF-Project Dungganon. Two of her children have their own families and her youngest son is the only one left living with her. He helps her with all household and other work. Despite being old, she is still very happy because her dreams have come true that all of her children have finished college, and are still earning their living.

Before she started as an NWTF-Project Dungganon member, she already had her business which helps support her family and pay for her children's education. She is engaged in running her general store, purchase and sales of rice, running a coffee shop, and pig fattening. This business was run by herself with the help of her husband and children. But unfortunately her husband died. But her life and business continues, and is also a source of leisure for her to forget what happened to her husband. When she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon her businesses brought more comfort to the family because it doubled her earnings to sustain her children. Even in her age, she continues her loans and businesses, in fact she was able to earn Php 6,000 per month, a big help to her children, and she is also maintaining good credit performance in NWTF-PD. 

Previously she borrowed Php 15,000 for additional capital for her business. The said amount was paid in full and on time. Now, she is borrowing the same amount, Php 15,000, to be used as additional capital, and any income from it will be used to expand the business.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additonal Capital for the business

loans.name: Evelyntina

texts.en:
Evelyntina O. lives in the village of Brgy. Pandan, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental. She is 66 years old, but still very determined to improve her business even though she now is a widow. She has five children who help her in running the business. Most of her children have their own family, yet still help her. Her dream is to continue her business to become more progressive and continue to borrow from NWTF-Project Dungganon.

In business for over 46 years, Evelyntina proves her skills in business management because she has remained engaged in business for such a long time. She is very thankful for her business because it contributes a lot in fulfilling her dreams in life. While in business, one may encounter problems, but these also were overcome and as a result helped to make Evelyntina strong. In 2001, she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon for the purpose of expanding her business and to have access to capital. She expanded her business by adding a pig fattening business as an additional source of income. In every month she was able to earn Php 8,000. This amount was used to defray household expenses, and build savings. She maintains her good credit performance because of the continuing income of her business.

Previously she borrowed Php 19,500 for her general store and pig fattening. The said loan was fully paid on time. Now she is borrowing the same amount of Php 19,500 as additional capital for her 18th loan cycle. The income from this loan will be used for the expansion of her business and support the daily family expenses.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Brayan

texts.en: Brayan B. is from the village of Lawis Panalsalan. He is 23 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Brayan owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Brayan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Brayan is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a fishing boat. This loan will be his 2nd from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. loans.name: Tserendorj

texts.en: Tserendorj B. is 27 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Uvs province in western Mongolia. He lives together with his family in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His two young daughters, ages 2 and 5, are in kindergarten. B. manages a traditional Mongolian shoe making business in his town. He makes a variety of Mongolian and Buridian shoes that Mongolians wore in ancient times. B. started his business in 2002. He can produce about 40 pairs of shoes per month; he sells these shoes at the local market. His shoes are known for their good quality and comfort; this makes them very popular among his customers. In the future, B. hopes to expand his production capacity so he can keep up with growing demand for his shoes. He is requesting a 650,000 tugrug (~450 USD) loan, with which he will purchase fabric and other materials used in making his traditional shoes.

loans.use: purchasing fabric and other materials used in making his traditional shoes

loans.name: Vandan

texts.en: Vandan B. is 55 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. Her husband currently lives and works in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son and daughter, ages 18 and 21, are both university students. B. lives in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. B. operates a meat trading business in her town, and provides a various types of meat for her customers. She started her meat trading business in 2000 with 100,000 tugrugs (~70 USD), and has gained much business experience over the years. Today she has a very loyal customer base, and her working capital exceeds 800,000 tugrugs (~560 USD). In the future, B. is planning to expand her business, and hopes to one day have her own workspace. She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan to purchase meat to sell.

loans.use: purchasing meat to sell

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Ganbaatar B. is 31 years old and lives with his wife and his 12-year-old son and 4-year-old daughter in Uvurhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live together in a small house. His wife is currently employed as a salesperson for a private company.

B. operates a goods-trading business in his town. He has many local customers that buy his goods such as food, coal, and firewood. He purchases his products in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and uses his truck to transport goods to his province to sell. His truck can transport a load of up to 5 tons, which allows him to only have to make 2-3 trips per month to the capital to purchase the goods.

B. started his transportation service in 2001 and has had much success. His earnings have allowed him to purchase a car for himself. For the future, he hopes to continue making progress with his business and says, "All I want is to be able to provide for my children's education and help them to become good people." He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug  loan to purchase more coal and firewood to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more coal and firewood to sell

loans.name: Batnasan

texts.en:
Batnasan B. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and three sons in Dornogobi province in eastern Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her three sons all attend a local secondary school.

B. operates a small grocery shop in her town, providing a variety of food products to her customers. She opened her grocery shop in early 2009 after previously selling her goods from a rented stall at the local market. The move has quickly proven to have been a good decision and she is already making plans to expand her shop. Her business progress and earnings have enabled her to greatly improve her family's quality of life.

B. is requesting a 500,000 tugrug loan to purchase more products to expand her product line.

loans.use: To purchase more products to expand her product line

She is now requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy ingredients for her food-vending business and also dried fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food-vending business, and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Benigna

texts.en: Benigna is 55 years old and married to Sofronio with whom she has seven children. She manages a sari-sari (variety) store, which she is very grateful for because it provides for her family’s needs and, most importantly, her children’s education. Benigna has been a member of Kiva partner CEVI for quite a while now. She particularly likes the low interest rate charged on CEVI loans. She says that because of it, she is able to set aside money to save. Now she is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP to add inventory to her store.

loans.use: To add inventory to her store

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 47-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. Her 22-year-old child is in the fourth year of a nursing course. Aside from tilling her farmland, Gemma also sells kerosene and gasoline to provide for the needs of her family, especially her child’s college education.

For financial support, Gemma applied to Kiva partner CEVI. She is now requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase farm inputs. Part of the loan will also be used to buy kerosene and gasoline. Gemma is hopeful her child will finish college and be a registered nurse soon.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, and also buy kerosene and gasoline

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 63 years old and married with 11 children. Her eldest child is now 44 years old and married. Erlinda sells dried fish for a living. She works hard to provide for the increasing needs in her family. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI. This loan will be used to fund her business.

loans.use: To fund her business

loans.name: Adriano

texts.en:
Adriano is 45 years old. He is married to Rose and they live in the village of Larion Alto, Tuguegaro City, where he has served as a village councilor for three years. They have three children: Aldrin, 18, a college student; Jerom, 16, a high school student; Jamaica, 13, a sophomore high school student.

Adriano has been cultivating a vegetable garden in his backyard for almost ten years. This business has been his partner in sustaining the needs of his family. His wife also assists him by selling the harvested vegetables in their village. Adriano is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP from Kiva lenders, which will be used to purchase fertilizer and vegetable seeds. The loan will help Adriano's family achieve a better way of life.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail is a 31-year-old married woman. She has two children, the oldest being 6 years old. Abigail owns a general store. She dreams of growing her business because that is where she gets her income. She works hard to give her children proper education.

A new member of CEVI, Abigail can now take advantage of its financial services. She is requesting a loan of Php8,000. With this loan, she will be able to purchase additional goods for her store.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for her store

loans.name: Tarangire Group

texts.en:
Majaliwa M. is 32 years old, married and has one child. His daughter Ashura is five years old. Majaliwa owns a video and music store in the Tabata region of Dar es Salaam where he sells DVD's, CD's, and TV's. Majaliwa started this business two years ago, and it is open daily from 10 am to 10:30 pm. Majaliwa is able to earn a monthly profit of about $40. 

This will be Majaliwa's 6th loan from Tujijenge. All of his previous loans were repaid successfully. With those loans, he increased the stock of his store. The extra profits that Majaliwa earned as a result of his previous loans enabled him to buy land. He hopes to use this loan to again increase the stock in his store. Until now, he has sold mostly used DVD's and CD's. He would like to purchase new DVD's and CD's that he can sell at a higher price.

Majaliwa will share this loan with the 7 other members of his sub-group, which is part of a larger loan group called Tarangire. In the photo, Majaliwa is standing second from the right, in the back row.

loans.use: To buy new DVD's and CD's to expand the stock of his business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 42-year-old married woman. Of her five children, the oldest is 22 years old. Lorna has a fishing business that she wants to improve. Most of her income goes to her children’s education. She dreams that all of them will finish school and have a bright future.

To help her fund her business, she is borrowing Php8,000 from CEVI. This loan will be used to buy nets and other fishing materials she needs to sustain her business.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: Ana Margarita M. D. T. D. 49 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad con su esposo y su hijo. Ana se dedica a la venta D. ropa, negocio que inicio hace muchos años, tras la necesidad y dificultades económicas que se encontraba la familia, ya que el esposo D. Ana se encuentra jubilado por su avanzada edad, para Ana es vital seguir con sus ventas ya que son su única fuente D. ingresos, ella venD. D. manera ambulante, ofreciendo su ropa D. casa en casa D. diferentes colonias y departamentos. El crédito que solicita es para surtir su inventario, para estar lista en los siguientes semanas que sus ventas aumentaran por la época naviD.ña.
texts.en:
Ana Margarita M. D. T. is 49 years old and lives in the department of La Liberad with her husband and son. She has been selling clothing for many years and started her business out of necessity due to hardships her family has experienced. Ana’s husband is now retired because of his advanced age, so it is vital for her to continue making sales in order to generate an income. She works as a street vendor, traveling to different neighborhoods and districts offering her products house-to-house. Her loan will be used to purchase more inventory since she expects her sales to increase during the holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Sadig

texts.en: Sadig lives in the Fuzuli region. He was born in 1986. This young, single man has been in the tailoring business for five years. Now Sadig needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy the necessary things for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy things to improve his business

loans.name: Karume Group

texts.en:
Amina G., age 35, is married and has one son. Her husband owns a hardware store, and together their care for their son Johni, age 2. Amina started her business this year. She buys chicks for about 75 cents each, raises them for four weeks, and then sells them when they are bigger for approximately $3 each. She buys between 100 and 400 chicks at one time. She operates her business from her home in the Tegeta region of Dar es Salaam. She is open from 6 am until 12 pm every day. Her monthly profit is between $375 and $400.

This will be Amina's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With her first loan, Amina bought 100 chicks. She repaid her loan successfully, and now that her business is up and running, she will use this loan to buy chicken feed. She hopes to continue to expand her business.

Amina will share this loan with the members of her group, Karume, which is named after the first president of Zanzibar Island. There are sixteen members in the group, several of whom raise chickens like Amina. The other members are food vendors, salon operators, clothes sellers, and grocery owners. They will hold one other accountable for paying back the loan. In the picture of the group, Amina is 2nd from the right in the 2nd row, wearing a white shirt.

loans.use: To buy supplies of chicken feed

loans.name: Velera

texts.en:
Veleria is 55 years old.  She is a widow and was left with three children.  They live in the village of Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. Being single did not stop her from improving their way of living.  However, due to financial difficulties, she was not able to support the educational needs of her children, so they ended up as only high school graduates, and two of them are already married.

Veleria is selling different snacks and vegetables in their village. She usually purchases her products in the public market of Bayombong and sells them in their village at retail prices.  From her business, she can earn a monthly net income of $74 which she needs to budget for their daily needs and to save something for future emergencies.  

She wanted to have more products to sell, so she is asking to borrow PHP13,000 from the Kiva lenders to be used in acquiring additional items to sell.  She hopes that with her patience and sacrifices, she can improve her small business and support her grandchildren's schooling.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma B. is from the village of Highway Lawis, Panalsalan. She is 37 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Emma owns and operates a clothing business, providing new clothing services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2001, Emma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Emma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 13th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Suhee

texts.en:
E. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a house in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His two children both attend a local secondary school and E. operates a grocery business out of a stall at a local market.

He began his business in 2006 after selling his iron business, which was in operation for four years. With his grocery business profit, E. was able to build his family a home in order to make them more comfortable. He would like to one day own his own grocery store where he can sell a larger variety of goods that will attract many more customers.

E. is requesting a 500,000 tugrug loan so that he can purchase a larger variety of products to sell at his grocery stall.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell at his grocery stall

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a resident of Aurora Isabela.  She is 32 years old and blessed with six children.  Flordeliza is a retailer of vegetables in the public market of Aurora, Isabela. She usually buys vegetables from the different villages and then sells them in the market. Her goal in life is to improve her business and provide for the educational needs of her children. 

Flordeliza is asking to borrow PHP15,000 from the Kiva lenders.  This amount will help her to purchase more vegetables to sell in the market, and will eventually result in an income increase.  She is hoping that the loan request will be granted.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell

location.town: San Pedro, San Pablo, aurora, Isabela

loans.name: Lhagvadorj

texts.en:
E. is a 37-year-old widow who lives with her three children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest children, 17 and 15 years old, both attend a local secondary school, and her youngest child, 5 years old, attends kindergarten.

E. operates a retail vegetable business out of a rented shipping container at a local market in her town. She began her business in 2003 after growing and selling her own vegetables the previous year. She would like to begin importing fruits and vegetables from China, because they are cheaper to import than other types of produce. She works hard to provide for her three children and wants to be able to continue to pay their education fees, so that they can all get a good education and not have to struggle like she has.

E. is requesting a 620,000 tugrug loan to import produce from China and to purchase other kinds of vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To import produce from China and purchase other kinds of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Tumur

texts.en:
G. is 27 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Dornogobi province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her two older children attend a local secondary school and her youngest child is in kindergarten.

Her husband owns livestock and works as a herder in the countryside outside of their town. G. operates an imported clothing and household goods business out of a stall in a local market. She began her business in 2008 and has been able to increase her family’s earnings greatly in that short amount of time. Her business has stabilized over the past year and she has begun to integrate herself into the business community. She would like to eventually increase her profits enough so that she can afford to build her family a house to live in where they can be more comfortable.

G. is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan in order to import a large number of hats, coats, jeans and pants from China, as well as some household items for their ger.

loans.use: To import a large number of hats, coats, jeans and pants from China, as well as some household items for their ger

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina has been married to Rodolfo for 36 years.  Their marriage was blessed with eight children, and four of them are already married. They are residing in the city proper of Cauayan City. Merlina wants to expand her business in order to support the daily needs of her family and also their educational needs.  

Merlina is 60 years old and still very determined in managing her retailing business of NFA (National Food Authority) rice. Her weekly net income is about $10.  She wants to improve her business, so she is asking for a loan from the Kiva lenders amounting to PHP25,000. She will use her loan to purchase additional sacks of NFA rice to sell in her town. She hopes that the lenders will grant her loan request.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Almaz

texts.en: Almaz is the mother of three children. She was born in 1960. They live in the Fuzuli region. Three years ago she started her cafe business. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to improve her business.

loans.use: to improve her cafe business

loans.name: Reyes

texts.es: Reyes C. D. C. vive en el departamento de San Salvador con su familia, que la compone su esposa, quien trabaja como costurera y sus dos hijas. A sus 60 años de edad, Reyes sigue siendo el mismo hombre luchador y visionario en sus negocios, el es propietario de un bus y microbús, los cuales circulan en las calles de El Salvador, con rutas de destino ya estipuladas, para Reyes ha sido un gran logro tener sus propias unidades de transporte colectivo, que ahora le generan los ingresos con lo que sostiene a su familia, el solita de un crédito para la compra de llantas de su bus, las cuales ya son necesarias por el degaste que presentan.
texts.en:
Reyes C. D. C. lives in the department of San Salvador with his wife, who works as a seamstress, and their two daughters. He is 60 years old and still fights and has aspirations for his business. He owns both a bus and a minibus that circulate through the streets of El Salvador. Reyes establishes the destinations and routes for his vehicles and has managed both of them successfully in order to earn income for his family. He is requesting a loan to purchase tires for his bus since they have degraded over time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new tires for his bus

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 53 years old and she manages a food vending business.  Aside from this, she is also selling vegetables in their village and her weekly net income is PHP 300.00.  She is now asking to borrow a loan of PHP 7,000 from the Kiva lenders.  The loan will be used to purchase additional commodities for her stall. She wants to increase her income to support the needs of her family.  

Her husband is a vegetable vendor in their village.  They have three children: Sherylyn, 30 years old, a college graduate; Jackielyn, 26 years old, a cashier in a department store in Manila; and their youngest is Eduardo Jr., 25 years old, a farmer. They are living in Del Corpuz, Cabatuan, Isablela.  She works with patience and industriousness to reach her goal of gaining success.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap P. (pictured with her daughter), is a widow and has four children. One of them was married and now lives outside the family home. Two other children are garment factory workers and another one is in school. She lives along national road number one, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sopheap has been selling vegetables for 20 years. She buys them from farmers in her village for resale in the local market. By the way, the supporting pillars of her house are old and broken. Sopheap is asking for her first loan of $500 to build new pillars of her house and replace the older ones.

loans.use: To replace the supporting pillars of her house.

loans.name: José Benigno

texts.es: José Benigno G. de 65 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador junto a su esposo doña Fatima de 77 años de edad. José y su esposa son una pareja muy unida, todos sus hijos son independientes y viven fuera del hogar, José se dedica a su negocio, hace 18 años instalo un molino, donde presta servicios trituración para varios negocios que necesitan procesar su materia prima de esta manera. Ahora José y su esposa están comenzado un nuevo negocio, una tienda de productos de consumo la  cual tiene pocos meses de existir, y es por ello que solicitan este crédito, para surtir su tienda de variedad productos.
texts.en:
José Benigno G. is 65 years old and lives in the department of San Salvador with his wife Doña Fatima, who is 77 years old. José and his wife are a very close couple. All of their children are independent and live away from home. For 18 years, José has been operating a grain mill and providing milling services to various businesses that needed raw materials processed. Now José and his wife are starting a new business. They opened a new store that has been in existence for only a few months. For this reason, José is requesting a loan so that he can stock his store with a variety of consumer products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory for his store

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en: Zaur lives in Fuzuli region. He was born in 1974. This man has been farming for 5 years.  He is married and has 2 children. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy pesticides to improve his farming business.

loans.use: To buy pesticides

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 52 years old and happily married to Julio. They have three children.  Two of them are already married and their youngest is Ma. Joy Bernadette is 18 years old and a 2nd year college student.  They are residing in the village of Calao West, Santiago City. She hopes that her daughter can finish her schooling.

Luz would like to expand her store by borrowing a loan from the Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 12,000.  This will be very helpful in purchasing additional merchandise for her store. With her income, she can continue to support the education of her daughter and also assist her husband with their daily needs.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase more merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Mrs. Tha O., 55, and her husband, Mr. Ros Sophal, 56, were married in 1973. They have three sons and four daughters. Four of them are married and live in separate homes, while three daughters are silk weavers. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

For 39 years, Tha has been a silk weaver, selling her finished products to a middleman who then retails them in a Phnom Penh market. Her husband is both a builder of wooden houses and a rice-grower. Tha is requesting her second loan of $800 to purchase a water pump for her husband’s farming business and silk materials for her and her daughters’ weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump for her husband’s farming business and silk materials for her and her daughters’ weaving business.

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en: Mrs. Sarom L., a resident of Kampong Chrey village in Takeo province, is both a Khmer noodle seller and a pig breeder. Since her breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing eight more piglets and pig food and build a piggery. She hopes to increase income and improve her family's living standard with this loan. Mrs. Sarom L. is 42 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom help their mother’s business while the third is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy eight more piglets and pig food and build a piggery for her pig-breeding.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal was born in 1956. He lives in the Fuzuli region. He is married and has 3 children.

Seven years ago, Kamal started a cattle breeding business. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 4 calves to improve his cattle breeding business.

loans.use: To buy 4 calves

loans.name: Leb

texts.en:
Mr. Leb S. is 50 years old and lives in Trapaing Loeuk village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice.

His wife, Mrs. Sub Ai, is a fishnet seller. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mr. Leb S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets to resell to earn more income. He has two children, one of whom helps the mother’s business while the other is attending the local school. His wife is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more fishnets to resell

loans.name: Sophak

texts.en:
Mr. Sophak C., age 27, and his wife, Mrs. Thida Maung, age 24, live along National Road Number six about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2006 and have a two-year-old son. They are both shown in the photograph.

Sophak has been driving a motor taxi from his village to the local market for over 2 years, while his wife has been a garment factory worker for over 2 months. Unhappily, Sophak’s motorbike is old and doesn’t work well, so he is applying for a loan of $400 to purchase a motorcycle to replace the old one.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to replace his old one

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 51 years old. She is married and has three children.

Fishing is her livelihood. She also manages to engage in seaweed farming to cope with her family’s increasing needs. She applied to CEVI and is now requesting a loan of Php10,000. She will use this loan to purchase nets and other fishing necessities. Hopefully, Esterlita will succeed in her business.

loans.use: To purchase nets and other fishing necessities

loans.name: Sokhary

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhary A. lives in Kampong Chrey Village in Takeo province. She is a fish seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Sam Sophat, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. He is also a track driver.

Although this couple works hard, they still earn less income than they need to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Sokhary A. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She is 39 years old and the mother of four children who are enrolled in the local school. She and her husband are both presented in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
27-year-old Caren B. has three children with her husband Antonio. Her eldest child is only 10 years old.

Caren invested in seaweed farming. She also hopes to have her own pump boat someday. Caren is a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc., an MFI in the Philippines and a Kiva partner. She has requested a loan of Php20,000, which she will use to fund her business.

loans.use: Seaweed farming

loans.name: Maria Jepkorir

texts.en:
Maria is 44 years old, married and blessed with six children. Her kiosk is located at Burar in Eldoret.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend. With the loan she is taking from KADET, she intends to add more stock to her business, including cooking oil, sugar, and rice. Her dreams are to grow her business and also be able to buy a cow to open a dairy supply business.

About KADET

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website www.kadet.co.ke.

loans.use: To add stock to her kiosk, including cooking oil, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny S. lives in Chorn Lat Dai village in Takeo province. She is a 41-year-old widow with three children: one is weaver, another is a laborer, and the third is attending the local school.

Mrs. Ny S. is a farmer who owns a 0.8-hectar field of land to cultivate rice. Now she is asking for a loan to add to her saving to buy a motorbike for her family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her family

loans.name: Peter Mburu

texts.en:
Peter K. is 37 years old and married with two children.  He buys second-hand shoes to resell in the Kangemi market. He has been in the business for about nine years and makes a profit of about 30000 Kenya shillings a month. 

He was introduced to KADET by a friend and has never borrowed from another MFI before. He wants to buy a stock of second-hand shoes in order to meet the demand of his customers.  He hopes to increase and expand his business to have several stalls in the estate.

About KADET

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website www.kadet.co.ke.

loans.use: To buy more second hand shoes to sell

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en: Ligaya enjoys running her sari-sari (variety) store. She is 38 years old, married and has three children. Her eldest child who goes to school is only 15 years old. She dreams for all her children to finish school so she works hard and also farms seaweed as her other source of income. She plans to buy her own pump boat to expand her seaweed farming. She borrowed 10,000 Philippine pesos from CEVI. She will use this to fund her store and seaweed farming.

loans.use: To fund her store and seaweed farming

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is 25 years old. She is married to Jason, a tricycle driver. They have two children: Joshua, an 8-year-old in grade 2, and Chandlery, 1. They are living a simple life in the village of Cabaruan, Cauayan City, a semi-rural area. Their house is located 500 meters away from the national highway.

She has managed a typical retail store for almost 11 years. Her mother also sells cooked food inside her stall. Her weekly net income is 1,000 Philippine pesos. For the continuous improvement of her store, she is asking for financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP7,000. She will use it to purchase grocery items for her store.  She hopes lenders will grant her request to maintain her business. According to her, industriousness is her key to success.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase more goods

loans.name: Ory

texts.en:
Mrs. Ory L. lives in O Kralang Duol Village in Takeo province. She is 52 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a construction worker while the other is attending the local school. She is a medicine seller.

Her husband, Mr. Verk Sout, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. He also charges batteries to earn income. In this business, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough raw materials to improve it. Thus, Mrs. Ory L. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose, and she will use the rest of money to buy more medicine to support her business. She hopes to increase income and improve her family's standard of living with this loan. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more medicine to support her business

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita, 41, is a seaweed farmer. By God’s grace, she was able to save from her income from seaweed farming and bought her own pump boat. She uses the boat to transport passengers from her place to the town of Talibon. She was also able to open a small store at her house. This makes her happy because she can provide for her family’s needs. 

She is married and has four children. Her oldest is 12 and goes to school. Anecita still hopes to succeed in her business life so she could send all her children to school and give them a proper education. She asked to borrow 25,000 Philippine pesos from CEVI, which will be used to fund her business.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 44 years old, married and blessed with two children. She makes a living selling clothing from a shop that is located at Kuruta in Eldoret. She was introduced to KADET by a friend, and has decided to apply for a loan to buy more clothing to sell to her customers. Her dream is to expand her business and become a wholesaler. She would also like to buy a pickup truck in the future.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Gonzala

texts.en: Gonzala is 51 years old and married to Semplicio. They have 13 children, the oldest of whom is 34 and married. She makes a living selling fish, and hopes to expand her business so that she can do a better job of caring for her large family.  That is why she has joined CEVI and applied for a loan for PHP 10,000. She will use this loan to expand her small business.

loans.use: to expand a small fish-selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer to support the field and make the crop more productive

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 53 years old, married, has seven children and makes a living catching and selling fish. She works hard because her income pays her family's expenses and her children's school fees. Rebecca owns a small boat and has applied for a loan to pay for the cost of getting it repaired. Once this work is complete, she can go back to fishing and earning a living for herself and her family.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to a small boat

loans.name: Chamreurn

texts.en: Mrs. Chamreurn B. lives in Trapaing Chrey village in Takeo province. She is a Khmer noodle seller. Aside from this business, she is a pig breeder. Since her pig-breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing ten more piglets and pig food for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family living conditions with this loan. Mrs. Chamreurn B. is a 60-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a supermarket in Phnom Penh, while the other helps with the mother’s business.

loans.use: To buy ten more piglets and pig food for breeding

loans.name: Leah Nechesa

texts.en:
Leah is 37 years old, married and blessed with three children. She runs a poultry business located at Junction in Eldoret, and makes her money selling eggs. Leah was introduced to KADET by a friend who was already a member, and has applied for a loan to expand her business by buying feed for her flock. She dreams of  improving her standard of living and making her business larger and more successful.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy feed for her chickens

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Flordeliza is 39 years old, married and makes a living selling dried fish to people in her community. For a long time, this was the only source of income she had to support herself and her four children, all of whom go to school, but it was barely enough.  That's why she started to save what she could to open a small store. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more fish to sell and expand this store. Her goal is to pay her children's school fees now, and also be able to send them to college.  To make this possible, she has applied for a loan for PHP21,000, all of which will go into one of her two small businesses.

loans.use: To help expand two small businesses

loans.name: Aopheasang Village Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sam Oeurn M. is the leader of a group with four members who all live in Aopheasang village in Takeo province. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more assorted vegetables to resell to earn more income. Mrs. Sam Oeurn M. is 48 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom use the motorbike with a cart to transport goods and passengers, while the other is a seller who helps with the mother’s business.

loans.use: To buy more assorted vegetables to resell to earn more income

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
With concern for the future of their five children, Elizabeth and her husband help each other earn a living. They live in the village of Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. They are a poor family but are determined to give their children a better future, by giving them the best education.

Elizabeth's husband cultivates their farm and plants a variety of vegetables and rice. Elizabeth sells fish in their village. She buys fish in the Solano Public Market and sell them through house to house delivery.  According to her, she can able to earn a net income of PHP700 a week.  She uses her income to cover daily needs, to pay school tuition fees and to provide an allowances for their children. 

Since her income is not sufficient to meet the needs of their family, Elizabeth is asking for a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP16,000. She plans to purchase more products to improve her small business and to give their children a better future.

loans.use: Buy more products.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita has her own boat for fishing. She is 52 years old, married and has eight children. She wants to improve her family's living conditions.

She joined CEV and requests a loan of Php10,000 to repair her boat. She needs a working boat to provide more financial support for her family.

loans.use: Fix boat.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Mr. Sen S., 52, and his wife, Mrs. Amnas S., 42, live along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, and have five daughters. One of them sells beef in the market, another one sells fried banana and sweet potato, and the other three are in school.

Sen is a cow and ox seller. He buys them from his village, and he sometimes travels to buy cows at other districts far away from his house, for resale in the nearby province. And sometimes, there are middlemen who come to buy cows at his house as well.

Sen has applied for a loan from Kiva one time already. He hopes to continue expanding his business, so he is requesting his second loan of $1,000 to purchase more cows and oxen for resale.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Naing Ars Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank loan consists of fourteen people who all live in Sokram village in TaK. province. Mrs. Naing A. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. With this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field contains infertile soil, which negatively affects her crops. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer for the rice field to make the crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Nub Saluot, is a laborer, and he is also a firewood seller. Mrs. Naing A. is 35 yeA. old and the mother of four children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the rice field to make the crop more productive

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en: Bonifacio S. is a fisherman. He is 58 years old and has nine children with his wife Fidelita. He plans to buy an engine for his boat so he can expand his fishing business. He applied to CEVI and asked for a loan of Php 8,000 so he can grow his business.

loans.use: Buy boat engine.

loans.name: Botr

texts.en: Mrs. Botr T. is a villager in the village of Trapaing Chrey, in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. She is also a grocer who sells various goods. Mrs. Botr T. is a 56 years old widow with a child who is a teacher in the local school. Her child is also a pig breeder. Since the business of breeding pigs is doing well, Mrs. Botr T. wants to expand it by purchasing ten more piglets and pig feed for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family living's standard with this loan.

loans.use: Requesting a loan to buy ten more piglets and pig feed for breeding.

loans.name: Jeralden

texts.en: Jeralden sells dried fish for a living. She is a single mother with four children. Her oldest child is age 12.  She was able to start her fish selling business with her first loan from CEV.  Now she hopes to expand. She seeks a Php18,000 loan from CEVI to fund her business.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Mrs. Kim Lornn Nuon  Group

texts.en: Mrs. Kim Lornn N. is the group leader of four members who all live in Daeum Rues village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. She is also a seller in the local school, selling cakes and sugar juice. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing a variety of cakes and sugar canes to resell and earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Eh Chiv An, is employed in a garment factory. Mrs. Kim Lornn N. is 25 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to either work or study.

loans.use: To buy various cakes and sugar canes to resell and earn more income.

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhon P. is a villager in Tapaing Chrey village, located in Takeo province. She breeds pigs and chickens. Since her pig breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it. She decided to request for a loan to buy fifteen more piglets and pig feed to support her pig breeding business. Her husband, Mr. Nub Nhen, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. He is also a laborer who earns a small salary with which they try to support the family. Mrs. Sokhon P. is 48 years old and the mother of one child who attends the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fifteen more piglets and pig feed to support her pig breeding business.

loans.name: Helida

texts.en:
Helida Adhiambo O. is a 36 year old mother of 3 children and the sole owner of a retail business specializing in plastic products sales. Before this business venture, Helida was in the business of selling second hand clothes. Her main reason of joining the Rongo K-MET community health workers was to work together with other women for the empowerment of orphans and widows.

Helida's future dream is to expand her business into a wholesale store.

loans.use: Restocking of plastic products for resale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
“Life is what we make it,” says Liza M. of Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Antonio and they are blessed with three children.  All study in secondary and elementary schools. They have a great dream that all of their children will become successful. 

They strive to earn enough income to support the financial needs of their children. Her husband is a construction worker and Liza is a dress maker. Through her efforts and sacrifices, she earned a net income of PHP 5,000 used for their daily needs.  Sending their children to school is very costly.

Liza is requesting a loan of PHP 16,000 from KIVA lenders to purchase materials she needed to make more dresses. She hopes to improve her business with the help of KIVA lenders.

loans.use: Buy dress making supplies.

loans.name: Samai

texts.en:
Mrs. Samai K., 54, and her husband, Mr. Sam-oeun K., 59, live on an Island in the MeK. River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1970 and have six childre;: five sons and one daughter. Two of the children were married and live outside the family home and the other three live at home. 
 
Samai has been selling vegetables, fish and port for six years. Her husband has been selling mangoes for ten years. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to provide capital for her husband to purchase mangoes on contract for resale and buy pesticide to prevent destruction of the mangoes by insects.

loans.use: To provide capital her husband to purchase mangoes on contract for resale and to buy pesticide to prevent destruction of the mangoes by insects.

loans.name: Mansur

texts.en: Mansur has been in the cattle breeding business for five years. Born in 1972, he is married and has two children. The S. family lives in the Fuzuli region. He requests a loan of 2000 AZN to buy five calves to improve his cattle breeding business.

loans.use: Buy five calves.

loans.name: Mrs. Sat Miech Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sat M. is the group leader of four members who all live in Trapeang Prei village in Takeo province. She is 51 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school.

Mrs. Sat M. sells rice soup. Her husband, Mr. Haem Chan Sopha, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because the field is infertile soil, which hurts his crops. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Sat M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make the crop more productive.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for the rice field

loans.name: Asenath

texts.en:
Asenath O. is a married woman and the mother of 2 girls and 2 boys. She is the sole owner of a construction supply business, which is commonly called a "hardware" in Kenya. During the post-election skirmishes, Asenath lost her building to a fire started by demonstrators. Since then she has applied for one loan from Kiva, and that loan, she says, has helped her back to her feet.

Asenath is a strong-willed woman, and she has used part of the initial loan to restart building and renovations. Her construction supply business is doing well she says, but she would like to get it back to the heights where it was two years ago. Asenath would like a loan of Kshs. 90,000.

loans.use: To restock contruction supplies at her hardware business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mrs. Khorn Roth Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khorn R. is the group leader of four members who all live in Niel village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Since her pig-breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets and pig food for breeding.

Mrs. Khorn R. is 56 years old and the mother of four children. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory, another is a car repairer, and the remaining one is attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Siem Nim, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig food for breeding

loans.name: Azer

texts.en: Azer is married and has two children. He lives in the Fuzuli region. This man has been in the sheep breeding business for 10 years.  He needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 15 sheep to improve his sheep breeding business.  Azer was born in 1975.

loans.use: Buy 15 sheep.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthou H. is a villager in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. She has five children, four of whom are attending the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only five years old.

Her husband, Mr. Saing Srin, is a fisherman, and he also breeds fish. In this business, he now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy fish food to feed his fish. Therefore, his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy more fish food for her husband's business. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more fish food for breeding fish

loans.name: Beldine

texts.en: Beldine O. is a full-time tailor at her clothing business. She started this business in 1994 and has not looked back since then. She intends to use this loan to restock sewing materials for the business and acquire more equipment. Beldine would like a loan of KShs. 30,000.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials and equipment

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a married 34 years old woman from the village of Larion Alto in Tuguegarao City. The couple was blessed with two children who are students. Her husband, Ricardo, also age 34, works as a delivery man.

Rosita has been a direct-seller of cosmetics products for eight years.  This helps her meet the daily needs of her family and will hopefully help her send her children to college.  Rosita and her husband work hard for their future. Rosita is also engaged is in the hog raising business and her children assist her on weekends. 

She wants to improvement her sales. Rosita is asking for business capital from KIVA lenders totaling PHP15,000.  This will help her buy more products to sell to meet the demands of customers.  Rosita is hoping and praying that she will be able to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: Additonal capital for her business.

loans.name: Srey Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Mao K. is a villager in Kampong Prai village in Takeo province. She is a grocer in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery supplies for her business. Her husband, Mr. Chao Meng, is a veterinarian. Mrs. Srey Mao K. is 36 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is four years old and too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Mrs. Sophea Yos Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sophea Y. is the group leader of five people who live in Sramaoch village in Takeo province. Al the members will use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Sophea Y. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice for a living. On this farmland, she has a problem because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizers to support the field She has therefore decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer for her land and she would use the rest of the loan to buy more piglets for her husband business. Mrs. Sophea Y. has three children who all attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the field.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence O. started her used clothing business in the year 2003. Before this business she ran her grocery shop but was not earning enough revenue for her investment. She intends to use this loan to expand her inventory to meet a larger number of customers. Besides business, Florence is a wife and mother to 7 girls and one boy. She would like to make a loan of KShs. 30, 000.

loans.use: Buy more inventory for the business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Parviz

texts.ru: Ризвонов Парвиз проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 36 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Парвиз имеет среднее образование. Жена, домохозяйка. Парвиз более 5 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Помимо этого он еще работает на стройке. Кредит просит для покупки скота.
texts.en:
Parviz R. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 36 years old, married and has 6 children. Parviz has secondary education. His wife is a homemaker. Parviz has been involved in animal husbandry for over 5 years. He raises and sells livestock. Besides this business, he also works at a construction site. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Mrs. Vorn C. lives in Trapaing Prich village in Takeo province and she is a farmer who owns a small field to cultivate rice. Since she has a problem with the soil condition of her land, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer to strengthen the field and make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Pheom Nop, helps her with the business. Mrs. Vorn C. has eight children. One is employed in a garment factory while another helps the parents with the business and all the other children attend the local school. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers to strengthen the soil to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Koem Heang

texts.en: Mrs. Koem Heang H. lives in Tanon village in Takeo province. She is a widow with five children, two of whom are silk weavers, while another one is a teacher. Her other children are attending the local school. Since the silk weaving business is going well, Mrs. Koem Heang H. would like to expand it. She decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk supplies for her childs business and she would use the rest of the loan to buy a bcycle for the children who are attending school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more silk for weaving

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rakhib

texts.en:
Rakhib lives in the Fuzuli region and has been in the dairy business for two years.  He is single and was born in 1988.

This young man enjoys his business. He does not buy milk from the market. Instead, with his small dairy business, he supports his family with milk, cheese, yoghurt, butter. He thinks that these products are very useful for health and is thankful for his dairy business. 

Rakhib also sells the milk, cheese, yoghurt, and butter to other families. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy two cows for increasing his dairy business.
