If he buys two additional cows, he estimates that he will have more products for sale and materially increase his client base and provide income for his immediate and extended family.

loans.use: Buy two cows.

loans.name: Caren

texts.en: Caren O. is a bursar by profession.She started her retail shop in the year 2006 as a source of income to her family. She says the business is flourishing and has a huge clientele base. This she says comes from extra commitment by her to the business. Her dream is to venture into dairy farming. This has been her dream since her childhood days. She says her inspiration came from her mother. Though she had to attend college and specialise in accounts, her wish as always been to venture into farming.  Since it is expensive in this part of the country (most people prefer fishing as a means of livelihood in this part of the country), her retail business is but a step to living her dream in terms of amounting resources for the initiation of this this dairy farming business in the near future. Caren would like a loan of KShs. 50,000. This she says is for strictly expanding her retail business by increasing her stock.

loans.use: To add more stock to her retail shop

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en: Salvacion I. is 36 years old and the loving mother of five children ranging in age from from four to 11.  She is a member of ASHI, a KIVA field partner. She requests a loan to overcome the financial shortage that hinders the growth of her business.   Salvacion dreams of improving her family's lifestyle and sending her children to college. Salvacion’s husband is a fisherman but his income is low and sporadic.  A loan will help her reach her goals.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for fishing business and buy piglets and materials for a pig pen.

loans.name: Zubeda Atieno

texts.en: Zubeda Atieno, 32, is the widowed mother of four children aged 12, 8, 6 and 4. She has been operating a beauty salon for the past two years and, since her husband passed on, she has been able to support her children with the income from this business. She learned about KADET through a friend who sympathized with her after the death of her husband. This is her second loan from KADET and she intends to use it to restock her chemicals and beauty products for use in her salon. From this, she anticipates an increase in demand for beauty services, especially as the festive season approaches. Zubeda aspires to expand her salon business, start a boutique, and ensure her children’s access to basic education. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase more chemicals and beauty products for her salon

loans.name: Saimudin

texts.ru: Рахимов Саймудин проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 42 года. Женат, имеет 8 детей. Саймудин более 19 лет проработал по специальности "педагогом". Теперь он более 6 лет занимается торговлей. Он имеет собственный магазин, в котором торгует продуктами питания и хозяйственными товарами. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Saimudin R. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 42 years old, married and has 8 children. Saimudin spent over 19 years working as a teacher. Currently, he has been involved in retail sales for over 6 years. He owns a store where he sells food products and household goods. He is requesting a loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita M. married at the early age of 19. Now she is 27 years old and has four children whose ages range from one to six. Her 32-year-old husband is a driver and a sweet lover. Her disappointments about life being poor are oftentimes overtaken by excitement to face more challenge because of the inspiration brought about by her husband and children.

In 2008, Angelita joined ASHI and requested a loan which she used to start up a buy and sell business. Now, she is requesting a much larger loan, wanting to grow her business, and profits as well, to be able to improve her family’s lifestyle.

Angelita’s husband supports her decision in this because he saw from her previous loan that she is happy having her business and spending her profits on the needs of their children, especially for their education. He knows that she has been dreaming of nothing else but for their children to enjoy life and graduate from college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and piglets for her livestock-raising business and also to finance her junk buy and sell business

loans.name: Nidjat

texts.en:
Nidjat sells fruits and vegetables and has been in this business for two years. He was born in 1983, lives in Fuzuli region, and is married with one child.

Now, Nidjat needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy fruits and vegetables to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Diamond Group

texts.en:
Vitheta Nice S., age 24, is married with one child who is one year and eight months old. She has had a business of selling clothes and cosmetics for 4 years now. She works daily from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $227.

This will be Vitheta’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She hopes to get a loan to increase her business capital. 
	
Vitheta will share this loan with her loan group, Diamond, which totals 16 members. The members of the group hold each other responsible in paying back the loan. In the picture, Vithane Nice is in front in a green dress.

loans.use: Increased capital for her clothing and cosmetics business

loans.name: Beth Njeri

texts.en:
Beth is 46 years old and married to Simon and they have two adult daughters. Beth moved to Gatundu, her current home town, due to post-election clashes which occurred in Kenya in 2007/2008. Her family lost everything they had invested but decided to move on with life. Her family members gave her a small amount of capital to start a business. Beth had been a teacher for fourteen years before deciding to venture into business making teaching-aid graphics for kindergarten.

Beth has been operating an art-class business for the past twelve years. She plans to expand her business and buy more materials with the loan she receives: i.e. plywood, paints and sealing papers.

Beth was introduced to Kiva partner KADET through an existing KADET client. She is applying for her first loan with KADET. With the extra profits, Beth intends to buy a piece of land and build a residential house.

Beth’s hopes and dreams are to open her own teaching-aid-graphics manufacturing company and to create job opportunities for the people in her community. She describes herself as an industrious lady, very innovative, and hardworking.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website:  www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy plywood, paints and sealing papers for the art class that she teaches

loans.name: Machon

texts.ru: Одинаев Мачон проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 25 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Мачон более 2 лет работает по специальности "педагогом". Помимо этого он более 5 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. У него имееются постоянные клиенты. Кредит просит для покупки крупно рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Machon O. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 25 years old, married and has 2 children. Machon has been working as a teacher for over 2 years. Besides this, he has been been involved in animal husbandry for over 5 years. He raises and sells livestock. He has regular clients. Machon is requesting a loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: David Onyango

texts.en:
David Onyango is 27 years old. He operates a general retail shop in Manyatta, a low-cost settlement area in the outskirts of Kisumu city. He has been in this business for the last three years. 

This is David's third loan from KADET Ltd., a Kiva partner. He will use these funds to purchase more stock for his shop and to diversify into a number of items that he has not stocked before, like dairy products.

He aspires to purchase a plot of land and develop it, with an ultimate aim to move the business there.

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase stock for his general retail shop, including dairy products

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia A. is a 65-year-old single woman who provides food and other basic needs for her elder sister who is also single like her.

The proceeds she obtains form her buy and sell business, financed by loans she requests through ASHI, are used to support her and her sister’s needs every day. Without her business and its profits, it would be impossible for Virginia and her sister to live normally as they live now. In the years to come, and as they grow old, Virginia knows that she has to be financially secure.

Virginia and her sister might expect to be having problems with their health brought about by old age but, instead of feeling threatened by the reality she is faced with, Virginia became courageous enough to enhance her business. Therefore she is requesting a much larger loan.

Virginia believes that once her business, financed by her loan, has grown, she will be earning more profits and will be able to generate savings from her profits.

loans.use: To buy materials needed to repair her fishing boat and to buy inventory for her general store

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred A. runs a small-scale retail general store. She is married and the mother of 1 son and 2 daughters. She started her retail business in the year 2000. Before this, she says she was a practicing housewife. Her future dream is to buy a parcel of land and build a few rental houses. This, she says, would also go along way in proving that a woman can live her dream even in a male-dominated society.

Currently, her immediate dream is to expand her retail shop into wholesale, and that is why she needs this loan. Mildred says she requires a loan of Kshs. 40,000 to achieve this.

loans.use: Expand her retail shop

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mrs. Pov Kann Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov K. is the village bank president. The group consists of eight people who live in Tuol Svay village in Takeo province. All the members will use the loan, which is guaranteed by the group, for different purposes.

Mrs. Pov K. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Reth Ra, is a fishnet maker. Although they work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support their family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Pov K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and she hopes to improve her family's standard of living after she sells her cow.

Mrs. Pov K. has four children; two are fishermen and the others are attending the local school. Mrs. Koy Ton is presented in the picture with the other group members.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Florenia

texts.en:
Florenia Cabañero is an old woman who wants to exercise her skill in running a business for her family to be able to have a regular meal every day. Through the loan she is requesting now, she hoped to start up a retail business to change their standard of living. Proceeds from her business will be supplementing her husband’s and children’s sporadic and small incomes through farming and fishing.  

As a mother, Florenia wants for her and her husband to be independent from her two children, who are 26 and 30 years old, so that they will have a chance to have their own families. She wants her two children to be happy; thus, she will try her best with the help of her husband to make their business successful.

loans.use: Will be used to purhase fish, fruits and vegetables for selling

loans.name: Murod

texts.ru: Факеров Мурод проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 51 год. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Мурод имеет высшее образование. Он болле 16 лет занимается производством муки. Мурод имеет собственную мельницу на котором производит муки, как себе так и на продажу. Кредит просит для того чтобы отремонтировать свою мельницу.
texts.en:
Murod F. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 51 years old, married and has 5 children. Murod has higher education. He has been involved in manufacturing flour for over 16 years. Murod owns a flour mill that he uses to produce flour both for himself and for sale. He is requesting a loan in order to repair his flour mill.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of flour mill

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. started her business in the year 1995 when she was 23 years old. She says though the post-election skirmishes and recent economic waivering in the country shook her business, she struggled and tried to maintain a lead on it. Her current plan is to expand her business to cater to an already big clientele. She calls it her next door breakthrough, and the only way to achieve it is to add more clothing stock.

Elizabeth is the mother of a boy and 3 girls. She is married and considers herself a family woman with a business. She would like a loan of Kshs. 40,000.

loans.use: Add a stock of clothes as an expansion strategy

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda A. is a 43 year-old fish vendor. She has five children: three in college, one in high school, and one in preschool. Every day, she walks through their village to selling fish directly to the villagers to supplement her husband’s sporadic income as a farm laborer. Despite feeling exhausted most days, Linda does not want to stop aspiring for a better life.

One of the opportunities she treasures a lot is her membership in ASHI. Through ASHI she can request a loan, giving her a chance finance a business. Proceeds from her business are her means of improving her family's standard of living. Therefore, without any hesitation, for the second time Linda is requesting a larger loan. She proved good repayment performance on the first loan she received, thus she is confident that this time she will be granted the amount she is asking for.

Someday she wishes to cease selling her fish from house-to-house, and instead open up her own market stall.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Norjinlham

texts.en:
Norjinlham A. is 29 years-old and lives with his wife and one-year-old daughter in Gobi-Altai province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His wife is a teacher at a local elementary school and his daughter is in kindergarten.

A. operates a cellphone selling and repair service in his town. He started his business in 2008 after completing a cellphone parts and repair training course. He has made a lot of progress with his business over the last year and has built a strong customer base.

A. has gained plenty of experience operating his business and continues to improve his phone repairing skills. The success of his business has raised his working capital from 500,000 tugrugs (~350 USD) when he started, to a level exceeding 1,200,000 tugrugs (~840 USD) today. A. hopes to expand his business in the future and dreams of one day owning his own repair shop. He is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~1050 USD) loan to purchase cellphones and cellphone parts in order to increase his business sales.

loans.use: To purchase cellphones and cellphone parts in order to increase his business sales

loans.name: Bumtsend

texts.en:
G. is 50 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Gobi-Altai province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest daughter attends university and the youngest one attends a local secondary school.

G. and his wife operate a clothing retail business in their town. He began his business in 2001 with working capital of 300,000 tugrug (~210 USD). At that time he operated his business in a rented stall at the local market. He has since expanded his business locations to two shipping containers, which he owns, and one rented stall inside the market. Currently his working capital is approximately 5,000,000 tugrug (~3500 USD) and he plans on opening his own store one day. He says, “My only wish is to be able to afford my children’s education and to help them lead good lives.”

G. is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan in order to import more goods and attract new customers.

loans.use: To import more goods and attract new customers

loans.name: Guluzar

texts.en: Guluzar was born in 1956 and is the mother of six children. She lives in Fuzuli region. 20 years ago she started a dairy business. She now needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy two cows to improve her dairy business.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 36 years old and married with three children. She sells medicines and has been operating this business for the past five years. She is applying for a loan amount of N150000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She hopes that this loan will help her build a business that will be profitable and provide benefits for her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Lalazar

texts.en: Lalazar, born in 1969, is the mother of two children. She has been in dairy business for five years. She lives in Fuzuli region. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy two cows to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Durzee

texts.en:
Durzee B. is 43 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Uvs province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His four children, three daughters and one son, range in ages from 12 to 20 years old.

B. and his wife operate a clothing-trade business and transportation service in their town. They provide a variety of clothing items to satisfy their customers' needs and transport and sell coal during the wintertime. Coal is widely used by Mongolians in the winter to heat their homes, and local customers are very much appreciative of B.'s and his wife's service. 

The couple started their transportation service in 1987 with a truck that they own. After several years of positive growth with their business, they used their earnings to start their clothing-trade business in 2002. Today they enjoy a stable operation with both businesses and are focused on expanding their clothing business in the near future. B. is requesting a 3,500,000 tugrug loan to import products from China to sell.

loans.use: To import products from China to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth raises birds. She has operated her chicken business for the past eight years. She gets her stock from Ondo and sells to her customers from the local market in Benin. Through her business, Ruth has been able to develop her farm by adding goats. She is 51 years old and married with six children.

Ruth hopes for the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more birds to raise and sell. She hopes that the loan will help her meet the demands of her customers during this festivity period (Christmas). She thanks you for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more birds to raise and sell

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. Christina is 46 years old and married with seven children. She derives joy in the selling of drinks, foodstuffs and provisions. She is from Edo State, Nigeria.

Christina hopes for the loan amount N40,000 to purchase more drinks, foodstuffs and provisions in order to meet the demands of her customers for this Xmas period. She thanks you for the help.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, foodstuffs and provisions

loans.name: Roselie

texts.en:
Rosalie C., 44 years old, is a rice farmer. She has two children. Her elder child is only 9 years old. She loves her family a lot and wants to provide them a better living. The farm that she owns has been helping her family a lot in buying all the family needs. She desires to grow her livelihood, that is why, she has applied for a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy all the farming necessities to grow her harvest.

Rosalie said, she appreciates the program that CEVI initiated because it really is helping a lot of people start their own business. She also likes the 2% interest rate because this is a lot cheaper than other lending corporations and is very affordable to repay.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth P. is a rice farmer from Bunawan Agusan del Sur. She has 10 children. Though she is 60 years old, she still strong and able to manage a business. The harvest that she gets from her farm has benefited her family a lot. The farm provides them adequate food, clothing, and other needs.

She is requesting a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying all the farming necessities.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en:
Charlie L., 27 years old, is a rice grower in Bunawan Agusan del Sur. He has this idea that people always buy rice, that is why even though many times he was down in his business, he never stops his pursuit in managing his farm to be able to support his family and buy all the basic things they need.

He is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. He will use the loan to fund his farm. The loan will be put forward in paying the laborers who help prepare the soil ready for planting.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe R., 52 years old, owns and manages a rice field. She has five children, all grown up and no longer living with them anymore. She likes growing rice because aside from the fact that she earns an income from selling her harvest, she enjoys working all day under the heat of the sun.

She is requesting a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to pay for farming necessities to grow her harvest. The loan is truly helpful in her pursuit of having an abundant harvest.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M., 46 years old and a CEVI client, grows rice for a living. She works from morning to sunset to guard her farm and plant other crops in addition to her rice farm. She has four children. Her eldest child is 26 years old. She has been doing the best she can to be able to make her farm prosper to augment their income.

She needs additional capital to run her business. She would like to apply for a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to grow her harvest by purchasing all the farming necessities.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Domeciano

texts.en:
Domiciano S., is a rice farmer from Bunawan Agusan Del Sur, Mindanao. He is 53 years old and has been married for nearly 27 years now. He likes being a farmer because aside from enjoying working all day under the sun, he earns enough income to support the daily needs of his family.

He is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. He will use the loan for farm financing to be able to achieve maximum yield in his farm. In that way he can better support his entire family's needs.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy J., 43 years old, is a rice farmer. She works very hard to be able to support the needs of her family. She likes growing crops, which is the reason why she enjoys working all day under the heat of the sun. She guards her rice field every day. She wants to plant other crops to supplement their daily income.

She is asking for a loan of Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy all the farming necessities to be able to increase the usual size of her harvest.

She said that she likes the program of CEVI. It’s not difficult for the borrowers since the loan has only 2% interest rate a month.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza F., 54 years old, owns and manages a small rice field. Her only child is already married. “ With God’s grace, my farm is earning,” she said. “The income I make growing rice has benefited my entire family, as it is used to buy food, clothing and other basic needs”, she added. She would like to ask for a loan of Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm. By buying all the farming necessities including the payments for the laborers, she hopes that she will be able to double her usual size of harvest.

She chose CEVI because aside from the fact that it offers affordable loans, it also provides insurance coverage to all its borrowers.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Cayetano

texts.en:
Cayetano Gerapuso, 38 years old, is a farmer. His main crop is rice because people are buying it all the time. He is hoping that someday, he will be able to grow his business and increase his income to pay the daily expenses in their home. He said that his rice farm business is doing great. He expects to have something greater by buying the things needed to grow his harvest.

He needs another loan of Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. Your support on this loan will be very helpful to pay the laborers as well as the equipment he rented during land preparation. He likes the services of CEVI because aside from loans, it provides insurance and low interest rates as well.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli G., 55 years old, is managing a small rice field. Her family is totally reliant on the income she makes from her farm. She also grows corn because corn is a much desired commodity in their place. She has been a CEVI client for quite a long time now. She maintains her good performance by conscientiously repaying her loans on time.

She is asking for another loan of Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy all the farming necessities to obtain maximum yield from her farm. In that way, she believes she will be able to increase her income to support the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia O. is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 43 years old and still single. She is a dealer of Avon products like perfume, lotion, beauty products and other cosmetics supplies. She sells to her neighbors and friends. She has been engaged in this business for twelve years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Delia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC.

Delia is now requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be use to purchase more Avon products to sell. This will be her 6th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more Avon products to sell

loans.name: Josphine's Group

texts.en:
Josphine K. is a single woman who owns a food stall at Madaraka Market in Thika.  She sells rice, beans, maize and peas to restaurants and families.  Her main business challenge comes at the end of the month when her customers are low on cash. She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy more rice, beans, maize and peas.  

Ultimately, she would like to expand her business into wholesaling in order to supply local vendors so that each vendor doesn't have to go individually to Nairobi for supplies.  Josephine describes herself as hard-working, honest, a Christian, and intelligent.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, peas and maize

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana P., a CEVI client, shares with us about her achievements in farming. Currently, she harvests 80 sacks out of a small hectare farm that she tills and owns. She is thankful to God for all the blessings that came in to her family. The farm has benefited her entire family because it is very helpful in providing an adequate supply of food, clothing, and other basic needs.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to purchase all the farming necessities to double her harvest. The loan will also go far in paying the laborers who helped till and prepare the soil for planting.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie T. is from the village of Basirang, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Tessie is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Tessie owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Tessie is just starting this business.

In 2009, Tessie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Tessie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo Gaganto, 44 years old, is a farmer. He owns and manages a small rice field, which he hopes can provide his family food, clothing and other basic needs. He is thankful to God for pouring a lot of blessings on his family. He said that his farm is earning a lot. His family totally depends on their harvest to help pay the daily expenses in their home.

He would like to ask for a loan of Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. His requested loan is to grow the size of his harvest by buying all the farming necessities. In this way, he believes he will be able to grow his income as well and support his family better.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites P., a farmer, never stops dreaming of achieving better living conditions for her family. She longs to have a comfortable house and enough rooms so that her children will have a good place to live and she will have a stable business so that her family can buy everything they need.

She would like to access the micro-financing services of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. When she gets a loan, it will be very easy for her to grow her crops and achieve an abundant harvest in her farm. The loan will immensely help her business grow.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Just like other farmers in their town, Primitiva V. also dreams of having a successful farm. She is 55 years old and has been married for nearly 31 years now. Her harvest is what she relies on for food, clothing, and other basic necessities. She wants to grow her farm and make it more productive.

She wants to apply for a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to pay the laborers who help till their farm. The loan will immensely help her sustain her livelihood and increase the size of her harvest.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Rosalia  Ndunge

texts.en:
Rosalia Ndunge M.'s store is called Baraka Furniture, and it is located in Kitengela near Nairobi. She has two employees and manufactures and sells furniture to families.  Her business challenges include sporadic shortages of hardwoods and correct materials. She is using her loan of KES 80,000 to buy the raw materials for making more furniture. 

Rosalia want to expand her business into a showroom and open another branch at Isinya town in Nairobi.  She is married with two children and describes herself as hard-working and honest.

loans.use: To buy lumber and materials for making furniture

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita P. owns a small parcel of farmland in their village. She is 48 years old and has been married for nearly 30 years now. All the produce coming from her farm has immensely benefited her family. Because of her farm, she has been able to adequately provide her family with food and other needs.

She desires to apply for a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She would like to borrow a bigger amount of money, Php 24,000, to support her business. This loan will help buy all the farming necessities that will help contribute to achieving an abundant harvest.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a mother, Lucia A. cannot hide the pain every time she fails to provide her family with their needs. She is 44 years old and has been married for quite a long time now. She has a farm. She earns daily income from growing rice.

She would like to access a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use her loan to support her farm and for buying all the farming needs. In that way, she believes she will be able to triple her harvest and support her family better.

loans.use: farm financing

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
At the age of 57, Lolita Ilaya is still managing a rice field in Talibon Bohol. She is never tired of taking care of her crops because she really enjoys doing all the farming chores every day. She has two children who also help manage their farm. She wants to continue the growth of her business to better support her family.

She would like to access a loan of Php 18,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy all the farming necessities to triple and improve her harvest.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna G. is from the village of Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Myrna is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Myrna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Myrna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa C. is managing a small basic store. Following the footsteps of successful merchandisers in their village, she got interested in selling goods in her hometown. She is 50 years old and never stops dreaming that someday she will have a bigger store and fulfill the dreams she has for her family.

She has requested a CEVI loan. She needs additional capital to run her business. The loan will immensely help her to buy additional merchandise that hopefully will attract buyers and increase her income. She likes CEVI services because everything in its micro-credit program policy is good and is helping a lot of hopefuls like her.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to resell

loans.name: Mansueta

texts.en:
Mansueta C.' wish is to be a successful retailer. She is 55 years old and blessed with two children (already grown up). She likes selling a variety of goods. She enjoys trading her valuable items and she earns enough income to buy her family most of the basic necessities at home. 

She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures Inc. By doing so, she believes that she would be able to grow her business even more. The loan will truly help her sustain her livelihood while its still unstable.

loans.use: Additional ingredients and buy kitchen equipment

loans.name: Neonita

texts.en:
Neonita L. has aggressively pursued her livelihood. She is a retailer and her business is what her family relies on for food, clothing and other basic needs. She is a fish vendor. She works early in the morning until late afternoon selling fish.

Now, she needs additional capital to keep going in her business. By buying more fish from fishermen, she will be able to earn a better income. The loan will have a big role in expanding her business and becoming a successful fish trader.

loans.use: To buy fish to resell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Someone convinced her to pursue a business. That is why, after she got enough capital for start up, Erlinda T. chose to establish a small sari-sari store and sell a variety of goods needed by the people in her village. She has a strong determination to succeed in this endeavor. That is why she would like to apply for a bigger loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. 

Receiving this loan will help her buy additional merchandise to resell, attract more buyers and increase the size of her income.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to resell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 41-year-old single mother with two adult sons, ages 19 and 21. She has been selling second-hand clothes for seven years. She says that the market in which she sells is the busiest and biggest in Kenya. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 40,000 to purchase three bales of trousers.

In the future, she would like to expand the business so that her sons can join her, with a branch for herself and one for each of them.


 
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To purchase three bales of trousers

loans.name: Syuki

texts.en:
Syuki is married to Wanjiku and they have five children: Miriam, Elizabeth, Lela, Mwangi and Kimathi. They are 18, 14, 12, 9 and 2 years old, respectively.

Syuki was introduced to KADET through existing clients and he is servicing his second loan. He has no bad credit history. His main source of income is rental houses although he also has a retail and green grocery shop. 

Syuki intends to use this loan to renovate his rental houses. He wants to change out the iron sheet walls and plaster the floor. All his businesses are situated in a slum within the industrial area, and the slum dwellers are his customers and tenants.

With the extra profits, he plans to educate his children. His hopes are to build other rental houses. He believes he is hardworking.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

Carren Achieng is an industrious and enterprising lady. She is 42 years old. She is married to Francis, a retiree. Carren has been in the tailoring and dressmaking business for the last three years. She feels that her business would have grown much faster had she started taking out loans earlier.

She learned about KADET Ltd through a member of her local church. This is her second loan from KADET Ltd. With the loan, Carren intends to purchase materials to complete two orders for bride and bridesmaid dresses. 

She aspires to open a big boutique in the future.

texts.en:
Salome is married to David, and they have one child, Alvin, who is three years old.

Salome was introduced to KADET through existing clients, and she is servicing her second loan. Salome has no bad credit history. Salome has been in the tailoring business for five years, and she intends to use the loan to buy materials to make outfits to sell to her customers.

Her business is located in a highly populated slum. Her customers are those who live in the slum as well as others from outside the slum that come to her shop. 

With the extra profits Salome earns as a result of this loan, she will buy an embroidery machine. One day she hopes to own a tailoring school. She describes herself as hardworking and honest.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz P. is from the village of Duanguican, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Beatriz is married and has 9 school-aged children. To make a living, Beatriz owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Beatriz has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

Beatriz joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beatriz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Beatriz is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Beatriz from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

She has been in the curios business for four years and with this loan she intends to increase her stock of wild animal carvings. These are in high demand during the festive season.

loans.name: Ruth Ann

texts.en:
Ruth Ann is a food vendor. She is 53 years-old and looking for another source of income. Her husband Ricardo is 54 years-old and works as a farmer. They have four children, two of whom are studying at college level. One of their children is working in Manila and the other one is in Dubai. Ruth Ann also sells vegetables that come from their farm, and accessories that she personally made.

Ruth Ann wants to have another source of income so she has engaged in direct selling business of AVON products. She wants to borrow the amount of PHP6,000 for additional capital to purchase more AVON products, and also to maintain her other businesses.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly R. is from the village of Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child.

Merly owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Merly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.

Merly is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Seferina

texts.es: La Sra. Seferina trabaja con la Institución desD. mayo del año 2008, ella tiene el negocio D. venta D. comida en la zona D. Cotacota, juntamente con el esposo atienden la venta D. comida y desayuno, desD. hrs. 6 D. la mañana hasta las 4 D. la tarD., ambos esposos conviven, se colaboran y comparten sus actividades, el esposo Don Felipe maneja un transporte, ellos ya no tienen obligaciones con los hijos, puesto que ya los sacaron profesionales, dedicandose ahora a cuidar alguna vez a los nietos y la mantenución D. la casa D. su casa propia, precisamente parte del destino del crédito es para arreglo D. la movilidad que tienen, es una pareja D. esposos muy responsables en sus cuotas, durante estas cuatro secuencias en las que trabaja con nosotros.
texts.en:
Seferina has worked with this Institution since May 2008. She has a business selling meals in the Cotacota zone. Working with her husband, they sell meals, including breakfast, from 6:00 am until 4:00 pm. Both husband and wife live together, collaborate, and share in activities. The husband Felipe also drives a transport.

They no longer have obligations to their children, who have already become professionals. Seferina and Felipe now dedicate themselves to caring for their grandchildren and for their own house. Precisely, the loan they are requesting is for improving their business. They are a couple who have been very responsible in their payments during the four loan cycles they have been with us.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY GROCERIES, OIL, AND OTHER PRODUCTS FOR HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
“If there is PATIENCE, there is PROGRESS”. These are words of encouragement from Emily, a resident of Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 49 years-old, married, and blessed with four children who are all studying. Emily and her husband wanted their children to finish their studies, and this has been their motivation to work hard in order to provide for their children's educational needs.

Her husband manages their farm where most of their crops are rice and vegetables. To support her husband financially, Emily set up her own business which is a sari-sari store (community based store) in their village. She is glad that she can earn a monthly income of PHP4,000.00 which she budgets to meet their daily needs and tuition fees and allowances of their children.

She is now asking to borrow PHP17,000 from the KIVA lenders. She will use the loan to buy more grocery items and other commodities which are commonly needed in their village. She believes that with this financial assistance she can improve her small sari-sari store and support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: Additional capital to improve her sari-sari store

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 53 year-old father of three who operates a maize mill in Mukuru slums Nairobi. He was initially employed in a plastic manufacturing company until nine years ago when he started his current business. He is requesting a loan of Kes. 60,000 to purchase maize for milling into flour. He hopes to mentor all his children into business and help them start up as he expands his business into other towns of Kenya.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock of maize for milling

loans.name: Roxana Estefa

texts.es: La señora Roxana trabajo con la institucion desde el año 2002 con el grupo solidario Delicia en 10 secuencias, despues de 3 años retorna a la Empresa solicitando credito individual. Ella se dedica a la venta de helados hace mas de 10 años, el esposo Nicolas tambien se dedica al mimo rubro en la zona de Miraflores; Tiene hijos que ya son independientes, pero aun les quedan dos hijos que estan en edad escolar. Ambos lograron comprarse un terreno en la zona Santa Rosa por Villa Fatima en el cual estan construyendo su vivienda, son clientes que pagan puntualmente
texts.en:
Roxana worked with the institution since 2002 in the solidarity group “Delicia”, after three years she is back to request an individual loan. She has been in the business of selling ice cream for more than 10 years, her husband Nicolas also works in the same line of business in the Miraflores area; she has children that are independent, but still has two children of school age. Both were able to buy a piece of land in the Santa Rosa area around Villa Fatima, in which they are building a home, they are clients that pay on time.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise and house repair

loans.name: Angeles

texts.es: La señora Angeles juntamente con su esposo Pablo, tienen un taller de cerrajeria donde trabaja todo el dia el señor Pablo y ella colabora en los gastos trabajando como empleada del hogar en la zona e Bajo Seguencoma, esta pareja joven tiene 2 hijos pequeños que estudian en la escuela de Chasquipampa. El esposo se dedica a este oficio ya 8 años y con el esfuerzo de ambos lograron comprarse el terreno donde tienen su vivienda  y por referencias de los vecinos sabemos que son personas de bien y responsables
texts.en:
Angeles and her husband Pablo, have a locksmith’s shop where Pablo works at all day and she helps with the expenses by working as a house maid in the Bajo Seguencoma area, this young couple has two small children that study in the Chasquipampa school. Her husband has worked in the shop for eight years and with mutual effort they were able to purchase the land where their house is located and through reference checks with their neighbors we know they are good and responsible people.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital and shop repair

loans.name: Mirna Elizabeth

texts.es: Mirna Elizabeth R. C. originaria del departamento de Santa Ana vive con esposo y sus cuatro hijos todos menores de edad. Mirna tiene 37 años de edad,  ha montado un pequeño negocio de venta de cosméticos, ropa y zapatos en su hogar, el cual lleva seis años al servicio de sus clientes, Mirna y su esposo son equipo, juntos se ayudan con los gastos del hogar y otros que representan  los estudios de sus hijos. Mirna solicita de un crédito para surtir su negocio, con variedad de productos de los que comercializa, ella ya obtenido  otros créditos los cuales se encuentran saldados y con una experiencia de puntualidad en sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Mirna Elizabeth R. C. is originally from the department of Santa Ana. She is 37 years old and lives with her husband and 4 dependent children. Six years ago, Mirna started a small business selling cosmetics, clothing, and shoes out of her home. She and her husband work as a team. They help each other with the household expenses and are involved in their children’s education.

Mirna is requesting a loan to restock her business with a variety of products that she can sell. She has had received previous loans that were repaid on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock her business

loans.name: Isoken

texts.en: Isoken is 43 years old and married with two children. She sells provisions and drinks and has been in the business for the past four years. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. Her husband is a civil servant. She hopes for the loan of N50000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She thanks you for the support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is married to Resty, the village captain in Santiago, Reina Mercedes, Isabela. They have a daughter named Trisha Mae.

Leonida used to work in abroad for many years. After she had enough savings, she decided to go home and follow her dream of having her own business, which is a sari-sari store (community based store). She sells different goods and she also offers fresh meat in their village.

Leonida wanted to improve her business for the future of her family. She wants to have bigger income in order to meet the growing needs of their family and continue to support the education of their daughter who is now at elementary school level. She is now asking to borrow PHP7,000 that she needs to purchase different commodities that are in demand in her store.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase more stocks

loans.name: The Rain Group

texts.es:
El grupo lluvia esta conformado por tres mujeres seccionales que han trabajado arduamente por su familias. Una de ellas es la señora Lorena del Socorro C. de 37 años que  desde el año 2000 vende tortillas con las cuales se ayuda para educar a sus 5 hijos todos en edad escolar. C. ocupara el préstamo  para comprar leña y maíz.

Flor de María U. de 40 años vende choco bananos, helados, hielo y lo que más desea es seguir adelante. Martha Lorena M. de treinta años desde hace tres años que tiene un cafetín y ocupara el préstamo para invertirlo en productos como café, gaseosa, chiverías y comidas rápidas.
texts.en:
The Rain Group consists of three local women who work hard for their families. One of them is Sra. Lorena del Socorro C., who is 37 years old and has been selling tortillas since 2000. Her income helps pay the education expenses of her 5 children. Lorena will use her loan to buy firewood and corn.

Flor de María U. is 40 years old and sells chocolate-covered bananas, ice cream, and ice. Her greatest hope is to succeed in her business. Martha Lorena M. is 30 years old and has been operating a cafeteria for three years. She will use her loan to buy products such as coffee, sodas, yogurt, and convenience foods.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies for their respective businesses

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is 48 years old and married with six children. She is a member of LAPO Micro-finance. She sells foodstuffs and provisions and has been in this business all her life. She is asking for a loan amount of N60000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. With this loan she hopes to increase her stock in order to meet the demands of the customers. She wants to be able to provide better for her children's education. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions

loans.name: Elsa Dinora

texts.es: Elsa Dinora N. A. de 20 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Santa Tecla del departamento de La Libertad, Elsa se dedica a su negocio donde fabrica grandes cantidades  de quesadillas, ella recibe ayuda de Carlos su esposo, quien cada mañana está al pendiente del horno en el cual se están cocinando las quesadillas, las que luego Carlos y su esposa empiezan a empacar y colocar en una canasta térmica para guardar el calor, luego Carlos sale del negocio con su canasta montada en una bicicleta, para comenzar su largo recorrido donde vende todas sus quesadillas. El crédito que solicita Elsa es para comprar mayor cantidad de insumos para su producción de quesadillas.
texts.en:
Elsa Dinora N. A. is 20 years old and lives in the city of Santa Tecla in the department of La Libertad. Her business involves producing large quantities of quesadillas*. She has the support and assistance of her husband Carlos. Every morning, Elsa is stationed at her oven baking quesadillas. The cakes are packaged and stored in a basket to keep them warm. Carlos mounts the basket onto his bicycle and travels around until all the quesadillas are sold.

The loan Elsa is requesting will be used to purchase ingredients in bulk so that she can increase her production of quesadillas.

(*Unlike the Mexican snack of the same name, the Salvadoran quesadilla is a rich, sweet dessert cake often found in local bakeries. The “queso” in quesadilla is traditionally unsalted Salvadoran queso fresco, a fresh farmers-type cheese.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Apprentices Group

texts.es: Grupo muy responsable y solidario en sus pagos, se conocen bien, no cuentan con muchas necesidades por ejemplo D. alcantarillados, agua potable, etc. Su grupo se llama "PRINCIPIANTES", donD., el Banco D. Emprendimiento esta en su 3º Ciclo, se dividio del BE "San Andres" la  mesa directiva esta conformada la siguiente manera,  como presidenta esta  la señora Maria Laura, ella es muy responsable y lider D. su grupo, tiene 3 hijos es casada su esposo y ella trabajan con panaderia. Como tesorera esta el socio Ivan  quien es muy responsable y conocedor del manejo del efectivo no tiene hijos es estudiante y trabaja con taxi trufi (taxi D. ruta fija), el credito lo utiliza para ayudar a su familia. Como secretario esta el socio Luis Carlos es soltero no tiene hijos trabaja D. taxi trufi, el credito lo utiliza para mantenimiento D. su movilidad.
texts.en:
The Apprentices Group is a Communal Bank that is starting its third loan cycle. The group was previously part of the San Andres Communal Bank, but split off to form its own entity. The members are very responsible and supportive of one another with their payments. They do not have many needs other than the basic necessities such as sewage services, clean drinking water, etc.

The group leaders are as follows:

Sra. Maria Laura is the group president and a very responsible leader. She is married, has 3 children, and works in a bakery.

Sr. Ivan is the group treasurer and is very responsible and knowledgeable with his handling of cash. He does not have any children and works as a driver of a “trufi” taxi (a taxi that operates on a fixed route). His loan will enable him to support his family.

Sr. Luis Carlos is the group secretary. He is single, has no children, and also works as a “trufi” taxi driver. He will use his loan to pay for maintenance to his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: The Fruit Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Fruto está integrado por Rosibel H. de 46 años, María del Carmen V. de 49 años y Jojana Vanesa Alemán de 29. La señora H.  desde 1994 empezó con un modesto puesto de fruta en la acera de su casa actualmente tiene una pulpería surtida con lo necesario y con la que sueña que se convierta en una misceláneas. 

Al mismo tiempo la señora V. inicio con su molino al que con el tiempo introdujo una pequeña venta de granos básicos y productos para el hogar. Mientras Jojana tiene 5 años de vender  ropa usada.
texts.en:
The Fruit Group consists of Rosibel H. (age 46), María del Carmen V. (age 49), and Jojana Vanesa Alemán (age 29). Sra. Rosibel opened a modest fruit stand in 1994 near her home. She now has a small grocery store that is stocked with basic necessities. She dreams of converting it into a convenience store.

At the same time, Sra. María started providing milling services and also sells grain and household products. Jojana has been selling used clothing for 5 years.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies for their respective businesses

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: SRA. HILDA SE DEDICA A LA ATENCION DE SU LIBRERÍA QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA CHASQUIPAMPA ACTIVIDAD CON LA QUE AYUDA A SU HOGAR PARA MEJORAR SUS CONDICIONES DE VIDA Y PAGA LOS ESTUDIOS DE SUS DOS HIJITOS, EL ESPOSO LA COLABORA CON LOS GASTOS YA QUE SE DEDICA AL FLETE DE SU AMPLIFICACION, TAMBIEN SE PUEDE INDICAR QUE LA PAREJA ESTA SURGIENDO POCO A POCO DESDE QE ENPESARON A TRABAJAR CON NUESTRA INSTITUCION. EL CREDITO INVERTIRA EL EL PAGO DE MANO DE OBRA EN LA CONSTRUCCION DE SU VIVIENDA.
texts.en:
Sra. Hilda manages a bookstore in the district of Chasquipampa. This business helps to improve her living conditions and pay for the education expenses of her two young children. Her husband contributes toward their expenses through his job as a delivery driver. The couple has started working with our Institution and is gradually emerging on the path to success. Hilda is requesting a loan so that she can pay for the construction labor of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home construction

loans.name: Dora Sandra

texts.es: Dora Sandra C. reside en el departamento de Santa Ana, con sus dos hijos Jose de 17 años de edad y Bryan de 11 años de edad, ambos estudiantes. Dora es madre soltera, ella trabaja en su negocio hace dieciséis años, donde de manera ambulante vende variedad de ropa para niños, damas y caballeros , ella viaje a diferentes departamentos de todo El salvador para lograr abarcar un mercado amplio, el deseo de Dora es poder surtir su inventario de otra variedad de productos, como ropa interior, es para ello que utilizara este crédito, con el fin de aumentar sus ventas, las cuales son de gran importancia, por ser ella el único pilar económico de la familia.
texts.en:
Dora Sandra C. lives in the department of Santa Ana with her two children, Jose (age 17) and Bryan (age 11). Both of her sons are students. Dora is a single mother and has been working 16 years as a street merchant selling clothes for children, women, and men. She travels to different neighborhoods throughout El Salvador to sell her products so that she can acquire as many customers as she can. Dora hopes to increase her inventory by adding other varieties of merchandise, such as undergarments. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can increase her sales. Generating an income is of great importance since this is her only means of financial support for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new clothing to sell

loans.name: Potenciano

texts.en:
Potenciano is a hard working father who lives in a small village in Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 50 years old and married to Ellen.  They are blessed with three children, one male and two females. They aim to give their children a better future by providing them with the best education possible. 

Due to hardships and difficulties, his wife chose to work abroad in Singapore, while Potenciano manages their small sari-sari store (community based store) in their village.  He also farms and repairs appliances. Through his patience and sacrifices, he is able to earn a net income of PHP3,000.00 which is used for the family's basic daily needs. He is glad that their children graduated from college.  

For them to have a more stable source of income, Potenciano would like have KIVA lenders fund a loan amounting to PHP10,000.  He will use the loan to improve his store by purchasing more stock of grocery items.

loans.use: Additional capital in improving his sari-sari store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: The Violets Group

texts.es:
El grupo las violetas las integran cuatro féminas trabajadoras y  luchadoras ellas son Reyna Estela O., María José C.,  Flora Delgadillo y Lidia G.. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora O. que hace como diez años inicio vendiendo ropa. Ella aprendió de este negocio por su mamá que también vendía ropa en un comienzo le trabajaba a ella y luego se independizo.

Las otras integrantes son C. de 28 años que desde hace un año y medio empezó vendiendo frijoles cocidos y tortilla actualmente puso un pequeño comedor; Gadillo de 55 años tiene 4 años de realizar  trabajo a domicilio de belleza y Ligia Mercado que vende cosméticos de la Avon, Bogue, Zermat, Romacel y productos baratos.
texts.en:
The Violets Group consists of four hardworking and strong-willed women: Reyna Estela O., María José C., Flora Delgadillo, and Lidia G.. Sra. Reyna is the group coordinator and has been selling clothes for ten years. She learned the business from her mother, who also sold clothes as a means of becoming independent.

The other members include Sra. María José, who is 28 years old and has been selling cooked beans and tortillas from her small diner for 1½ years. Sra. Flora is 55 years old and provides housekeeping services. Sra. Lidia sells cosmetics from the Avon, Bogue, Zermat, and Romacel lines as well as other inexpensive products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies for their respective businesses

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria Isabel V. de 47 años desde el 2004 empezó vendiendo pan  y luego se introdujo en la venta de cosméticos por catalogo. Esta señora tuvo 5 hijos que son ahora su apoyo ellos le ayudan en su negocio y cuidan de ella como su mayor tesoro.

El sueño de V. en lo personal como toda madre es que sus hijos puedan formar familias estables, que trabajen y que sean hombre y mujeres de bien y en el negocio es seguir trabajando y prosperar.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel V. is 47 years old. In 2004 she began selling bread and later involved herself in the sale of cosmetics by catalog. This lady has 5 children who are now her support as they help with her business and care for her as their greatest treasure.

V., like any mother, has the personal dream that her children may form stable families, and that they work and become upstanding men and women. Her business dream is to continue working and prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for buying cosmetics

loans.name: Esperanza Veronica

texts.es: La Joven Esperanza verónica Pérez, tiene la edad, 23 años, habita en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla,  junto a sus padres y hermanos, ella desde hace once años se dedica a la confecciones de uniformes,  manteles, camisetas, entre otos ya que este es un negocio familiar que su mamá le dejo, hace unos cuatro años la señora sufrió un derrame, lo cual la joven Esperanza se hizo cargo del negocio, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que no han logrado construir un taller donde puedan trabajar cómodamente ; actualmente utilizan la sala de su hogar para confeccionar lo cual se priva de poder compartir con su familia el televisor juntos. Agradece a la institución por la buena aprobación de su segundo crédito , ya que esto le permite abastecer a todos sus clientes y entregar en tiempo y forma las costura.
texts.en:
Esperanza Verónica Pérez is 23 years old and lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla subdivision of Managua with her parents and siblings. She has been producing uniforms, tablecloths, t-shirts, and other items for eleven years. Esperanza took over this business approximately four years ago from her mother, who suffered a stroke. Her greatest challenge is that her mother failed to build a proper workshop that has adequate space for her to work comfortably. She currently works out of a room in her home that the rest of the family uses to watch television. Esperanza thanks the Institution for approving her second loan, which will enable her to continue servicing her customers and fulfilling their orders on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric for making uniforms

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Esfuerzo está integrada por tres mujeres decididas, trabajadoras y que con mucho esfuerzo han construido sus negocios. María Eugenia Cuaresma Gutiérrez es la coordinadora del grupo y tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos por encargo con los cuales se ayuda para salir adelante.

Teresa de Jesús R. de 42 años desde 1999  vende cosméticos y prendas de oro, plata y fantasía con sus ganancias ha conseguido brindarles bienestar y una buena educación a sus dos hijos que son su mayor fuerza de trabajo. 

Kenia del Socorro B. Silvia desde los 16 años vende cosméticos por catalogo con los cuales ayudado para continuar sus estudios y poder subsistir.
texts.en:
The group "El Esfuerzo" is comprised of three determined, hardworking women who, with much effort, have built their businesses. María Eugenia Cuaresma Gutiérrez is the coordinator of the group, and has a small business selling clothes and cosmetics on order, which has helped her to get ahead. Teresa de Jesús R. is 42 years old, and since 1999 has sold cosmetics and gold, silver and costume jewelry. With her earnings she has been able to provide her two children, who are her main workforce, with a comfortable life and a good education. Kenia del Socorro B. Silvia has sold cosmetics through catalogs for 16 years, this has helped her to continue her studies and enabled her to provide for her needs.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise: clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a member of LAPO Micro-finance. She sells garri and has been in this business all her life. She buys cassava, grinds and fries it. The end product is called garri. She hopes for the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more cassava for production of garri to sell. With this loan she hopes to increase her stock so as to meet the demands of her customers. Esther wants to be able to provide better for her children's education. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava for production of garri

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor Francisco Javier O. G. tiene la edad de 50 años, habita en el barrio Pablo Calero junto a su esposa, la cual trabaja como comerciante, para apoyarle con  los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen cinco hijos, ya todos casados , tiene a uno de sus nietos a su cargo el cual le apoya con los trabajos agrícolas , desde hace treinta años don Francisco se dedica a la agricultura , ya que con sus propios esfuerzos logro comprar un terreno el cual lo explota con cultivos , agradece a Afodenic por décimo crédito el cual comparara abono para una mejor cosecha lo que ha lograra mejorar sus condiciones de vida así como este financiamiento a bajos interés y facilidad de pagos . A la vez esta contento por la asistencia técnica ya que le sirve de mucha ayuda para los cultivos.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco Javier O. G. is 50 years old and lives in the Pablo Calero neighborhood with his wife, who works as a merchant. They support one another with the household expenses. Don Francisco has 5 children who are all married. One of his grandsons helps him with the farmwork.

For the past 30 years, Don Francisco has been engaged in agriculture. Through his hard work, he was able to buy his own land for the purpose of growing crops. He thanks AFODENIC for providing him with his tenth loan, which he will use to purchase fertilizers so that he can produce a better crop. The income he generates at harvest time has enabled him to improve his living conditions. The low interest rates and easy payments have also been a great benefit. Don Francisco is happy to receive the technical assistance that proved to be very helpful in growing his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers to apply to his crops

loans.name: Ayo

texts.en: Ayo is excited about her Kiva loan. She will use this loan to invest in a business selling foodstuffs which she will buy in bulk to get a better price. She hopes that this loan will help her build a business that will be profitable and provide benefits for her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Cette dame exerce comma activité de revenu depuis 1999 la vente de pagnes de qualité ; elle est mariée à un électricien bâtiment et le couple a 02 enfants à sa charge. Elle vend également des plats en plastique. Grâce à ces deux activités, elle arrive à apporter sa contribution financière dans la gestion du foyer. En plus de ces activités, cette femme a aussi appris la couture et a même ouvert son atelier de couture dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Toutefois, elle exerce son commerce dans le marché d’Agoè. En ce moment elle voudrait renouveler son stock ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 25 pagnes Wax Hollandais, 15 pagnes Hitarget et 10 pagnes Soso ; le prêt lui permettra également d’acheter certains plats en plastique.
texts.en:
This lady has run a profitable business selling quality printed cloth since 1999. She is married to a building electrician and the couple have 2 children to look after. She also sells plastic dishes. Thanks to these two businesses she is able to pay her share of the housekeeping costs. In addition to these businesses, this lady has also learnt dressmaking and has opened a dressmaking workshop in the Agoè quarter in Lomé. She runs her business in the Agoè market. Now she would like to renew her stock, which is why she is asking for a loan from WAGES, to buy 25 lengths of Dutch Wax printed cloth, 15 lengths of Hitarget and 10 of Soso. The loan will also allow her to buy some plastic dishes.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy quality printed fabric and plastic dishes

loans.name: Efrain Ernesto

texts.es: El señor Efraín Ernesto M., tiene la edad de 55 años, habita en la comunidad Medardo Andino , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa , la cual trabaja como comerciante para apoyarlo con los gastos del agua, luz y los alimentos que hagan falta , ellos tienen tres hijos , ya todos casado e independientes , actualmente tienen a su cargo una nieta de 20 años , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones del hogar ya que en casa que habita la mitad es de madera y la otra parte de bloques y ya la madera esta vieja y teme que los delincuente hurten sus pocas cosa que con mucho esfuerzo a comprado, don Efraín desde cuarenta años se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas ya que su mamá , le heredo para que trabaje por si solo y lograra mejorar  agradece a Afodenic por su octavo crédito ya que invertirá en comprar fertilizantes para mejorar la producción lo cual espera obtener una buena cosecha y poder vender a buen precio en el M. lo cual surtirá sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Efraín Ernesto M. is 55 years old and lives in the community of Merdardo Andino, located in the town of Ticuantepe, along with his wife who works as a trader to help him with the water, light and food bills. They have three children who are all married and independent. Currently, they have a 20 year old granddaughter in their care. Their plans for their family are to improve their living conditions since, in the house that they live, half is wood and the other part is blocks and the wood is old. They fear that burglars will rob the few things that they have worked hard to buy. For fourty years, Efraín has been dedicated to agricultural work which he inherited from his mother and has worked on his own and managed to improve thanks to Afodenic. He will invest his eighth loan in the purchase of fertilizers to improve production. He hopes to obtain a good harvet and be able to sell at a good price in the market which stocks his necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for a good harvest.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée à un conducteur de taxi moto et le couple a 05 enfants à sa charge. C’est pour aider financièrement son mari dans l’éducation de leurs enfants que cette dame s’est lancée en 1999 dans la vente de maïs et de charbons de bois. Ce commerce lui permet désormais de se prendre en charge et de penser à agrandir ses ventes. Elle exerce cette activité dans le quartier de Baguida à Lomé. Elle dispose d’un petit entrepôt dans lequel elle vend ses sacs de maïs ; elle vend aussi bien en gros qu’en détail. Elle sollicite en ce moment un crédit de WAGES pour pouvoir disposer de nouveaux stocks ; le prêt lui permettra d’acheter 10 sacs de maïs et 15 sacs de charbons de bois. Le reste du montant couvrira ses frais de transport vers ses lieux d’approvisionnement.
texts.en:
This lady is married to a moto-taxi driver and the couple have 5 children to look after. In order to help her husband pay for their children’s education she began selling corn and wood charcoal in 1999. This business has since allowed her to take charge and think about increasing her sales. She runs this business in the Baguida quarter of Lomé. She has a small shop from where she sells her bags of corn – both wholesale and small scale. Now she is asking for a loan from WAGES in order to obtain new stock. The loan will allow her to buy 10 bags of corn and 15 bags of charcoal. The remaining money will cover her transport costs to the suppliers.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn and charcoal

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
El señor Armando es casado con la joven señora de nombre Mayela Yoseth Campos, ellos son padres de 3 niños todos pequeñitos, por el momento viven en la casa de sus suegros ya que en la parte posterior de la vivienda es donde Armando esta realizando la construcción de su hogar y por el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su familia política. 
El labora para una empresa reconocida a nivel estado desde hace 8 años, en el departamento de oficial de producción obteniendo muy buenos ingresos.
