Ellos aunque son una familia joven son personas muy responsables y en busca de un buen futuro, están tramitando este crédito para la colocación de la losa de concreto de su vivienda en construcción.
texts.en:
Señor Armando is married to a young woman named Mayela Yoseth Campos. They are parents of 3 children who are all very small. At the moment, they live in a house with his in-laws. In the back of that house Armando is building his house with the support of his in-laws. He has worked for 8 years as a production department official for a firm that is well-known at the state level, and he makes a very good income. They are a young family, but they are very responsible people who are looking for a good future. They are transacting this loan in order to place a concrete slab roof on their home under construction.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to put a concrete slab roof on their home under construction

loans.name: Nerys Noedita

texts.es:
La señora Nerys  Noedita M. es socia del Banco Comunal Mejía  ubicado en Portoviejo provincia de Manabí, ésta es una de las regiones más hermosas del Ecuador por sus playas y gastronomía.

Nerys   tiene 41 años de edad,  está casada su esposo  trabaja como  guardia de seguridad de una estación mientras que ella es comerciante,  desde hace cinco años se dedica a la compra y venta  a credito de  electrodomésticos y artículos  para el hogar, sus clientes los consigue visitándolos puerta a puerta es un trabajo muy duro acota; en su trabajo las actividades son compartidas Nerys se encarga de entregar los pedidos y sus hijos de realizar los cobros.

Con el  crédito solicitado a la Fundación Espoir va a comprar al distribuidor los pedidos pendientes de sus clientes como: planchas, licuadoras, extractor de jugo, waflera, etc y darles un poco más de crédito para no perder las ventas. 

Su sueño es llegar a tener su propio negocio  para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y no tener que depender  de los distribuidores.
texts.en:
Sra. Nerys Noedita M. is a member of the Mejía Communal Bank, which is located in Portoviejo in the province of Manabí. This community lies in one of the most beautiful regions of Ecuador known for its beaches and its food.

Nerys is 41 years old and married. Her husband is a station security guard, while she works as a merchant. For five years, she has been buying appliances and housewares and selling them on credit. Visiting her customers door to door is the hardest part of her job that she has learned to accept. However, she has been able to delegate some of the work. She is responsible for delivering orders while her children are charged with collecting payments.

Using her loan from Fundación ESPOIR, Nerys will purchase items from her distributor that she needs to fulfill customer orders such as irons, blenders, juicers, waffle irons, etc. This will enable her to issue more credit without losing sales. She dreams of opening her own store so that she can provide better service to her customers without having to depend on distributors.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase irons, blenders, juicers, waffle irons, etc.

loans.name: Julia Estela

texts.es: La señora Julia Estela Pérez A., tiene la edad de 45 años, habita en el barrio las conchitas ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe; ella es madre soltera, el apoyo que recibe es una de sus tres hija que es casada ya que tiene un negocio en el mercado oriental , la mayor dificultad que se le presento en estos últimos meses fue que le robaron casi todo la mercadería cuando fue de compras para surtir su pulpería el  cual dejo a cargo a su pequeña de 13 años en el negocio , lo cual fue una gran perdida y ha venido poco a poco incrementando. Agradece a Afodenic por la aprobación de su tercer crédito el cual lo va a invertir en la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, gaseosas, pan, lácteos para sastifaacer la demanda de sus clientes y poder dar un mejor servicio
texts.en:
Julia Estela Pérez A., 45, lives in the Las Conchitas neighborhood which is in the Ticuantepe township. She is a single mother. One of her daughers, who is married, helps her since she runs a small business in the Mercado Oriental (municipal market). The greatest misfortune she has had to face in the past few months is that almost all of her merchandise was stolen when she went to buy supplies for her small grocery store which she had left in the care of her 13-year-old daughter. This was a great loss and little by little she has been recovering. She is grateful to Afodenic for approving her third loan which will be used to buy basic grains, snacks, bread and dairy products to meet her customers' demands and provide better service.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains, dairy product, snacks and bread.

loans.name: Benedita Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora   Benedita Consuelo R. S. es socia del Banco Comunal Mejía  ubicado en Portoviejo provincia de Manabí, ésta es una de las regiones más hermosas del Ecuador por sus playas y gastronomía.

Benedita Consuelo está casada desde hace 37 años tiene 3 hijos, ella se dedicada  a los quehaceres del  hogar y le ayuda al esposo en el negocio que tienen de frutas y verduras sobre todo de la costa como sandias, melones, pepinos, tomates.

El esposo de  Benedita  se abastece de  los productos en  Manabí y los lunes y martes  viaja en su camioneta a  vender   su mercadería en el cantón turístico salinas que esta a una  distancia de 4 horas de su terruño,  a su regreso trae sal en grano para vender  en otros cantones como Chone,  Olmedo, Santa Ana, hasta llegar a su localidad.

Con el préstamo solicitado van a comprar más frutas y verduras para abastecer a otras localidades de su cantón y de las comunidades aledañas.
texts.en:
Benedita Consuelo R. S. is a member of the Mejía communal bank which is located in Portoviejo, Manabí province. This is one of Ecuador's most beautiful regions due to its beaches and gastronomy. Benedita Consuelo has been married for 37 years and has 3 children. She is a housewife but helps her husband to sell his fruits and vegetables (watermelon, melon, cucumber, tomatoes), especially along the coast. Benedita's husband stocks up on product in Manabí and on Mondays and Tuesdays travels in his van to sell his merchandise in the tourist town of Salinas which is 4 hours away from their home. On the return trip he brings back coarse grain salt to sell in other towns along the way back home like Chone, Olmedo, and Santa Ana . With the requested funds they will buy more fruit and vegetables to supply other towns in their area as well as surrounding townships.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables like melon, watermelon, cucumber, tomato, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion 1 Y 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria lives in Santo Domingo, the congested capital of the Dominican Republic, which has an economy that is largely based on services and tourism. She lives in a northern neighborhood where running water and electricity are less dependable than having intense traffic jams and heat. She is also the group coordinator of her Bank of Hope, and is currently starting her first loan with Esperanza International.

Maria owns a business where she sells clothes to neighbors, friends, family, and anyone else who happens to come by. With this loan she will buy a dozen each of men's polo shirts, women's blouses, belts, and pants. She would like to make enough money to keep reinvesting in her business, and with the rest she wants to buy a radio for her children.

In the future Maria dreams of having two other employees and owning a small bus which would allow her to be able to go out and sell her clothing in more rural areas. She strongly believes that with Esperanza International she will progress and rise up above her poverty. Maria thanks you all for being part of this dream!

loans.use: Men´s and women´s shirts, belts, pants

loans.name: Petronila De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Petronila R. tiene la edad de 60 años habita en el barrio los Ríos ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, ella es madre soltera , el apoyo que recibe son de sus dos hijas , las cuales están casadas , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones del cultivo para poder tener un mejor ingreso y lograr comprar un terreno para que heredar a sus hijas , doña Petronila desde hace 25 años , se dedica a la agricultura gracias al apoyo de sus padres que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierras ya que era la fuente de trabajo de su familia , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es el humo del volcán que en ocasiones ha quemado el gran parte de la plantación  y no ha logrado sacar ni lo que invierte, se siente contenta por el apoyo que Afodenic ha dado el cual ha logrado superar la crisis comprando los  fertilizantes necesarios para tener una buena cosecha y así poder vender a buen precio los productos. Lo cual espera en este año reponerse para sastifacer sus necesidades personales como pagar en tiempo y forma el préstamo. Comprar abonos y venenos para la obtención de un mejor fruto.
texts.en:
Petronila R., 60, lives in the Ríos neighborhood in the town of Ticuantepe. She is a single mother. Two of her married daughters help her out economically. Her plans for her family is to improve her planting conditions so that she can increase her earnings to buy a plot of land to leave to her daughters. Petronila has been a farmer for the past 25 years. She learned her farming skills from her parents who, as life-long farmers, taught her to work the land. The greatest difficulty she has faced lately is the smoke from the volcano which has burned much of her crop causing her yields to be so poor that she hasn't even recouped her investment. She is happy for Afodenic's help in purchasing fertilizers which will insure a better crop yield and products that she can sell for a better price. She hopes to recover enough this year to meet her personal expenses and repay her loan in a timely fashion. She will buy fertilizers and insecticides in order to get a better crop yield.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Leifa Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora   Leifa del Carmen V. M. es socia del Banco Comunal Mejía  ubicado en Portoviejo provincia de Manabí, ésta es una de las regiones más hermosas del Ecuador por sus playas y gastronomía.

Leifa  está casada desde hace muchos años, sus hijos son adultos estudian y trabajan en Quito, sólo le  acompaña su hijo menor de 23 años y un nieto de 4 años que ella  acogió cuando sus padres se separaron,  ella y  su esposo se dedican a la agricultura alquilan un terreno para sembrar, maíz, frijoles, entre otros llevan muchos años ejerciendo esta actividad.

Con el préstamo solicitado a la Fundación va a comprar pollos de cría, alimento y vitaminas para su crecimiento para montar un criadero y tener  un ingreso extra de dinero para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

El sueño de Leifa es montar  un negocio de ropa en el centro de la ciudad donde viven, solo que por falta de dinero y por el poco tiempo que le queda porque debe cuidar a su nieto  aun no ha podido cristalizarlo.
texts.en:
Leifa del Carmen V. M. is a member of the Mejía communal bank which is located in Portoviejo, Manabí province. This is one of Ecuador's most beautiful regions due to its beaches and gastronomy. Leifa has been married for many years; her children are adults and study and work in Quito. Only her youngest son, 23, and a 4-year-old grandson, who she has cared for since his parents separated, live with her. She and her husband grow, among others, corn and beans on leased land. They have done this for many years. With the loan which the foundation will grant they plan to buy chickens, feed and vitamins to set up a hatchery which will produce additional income which will help her husband meet family expenses. Leifa's dream is to set up a clothing sales store in the city center where they live but the lack of funds and time (she has to care for her grandson) have prevented this from happening yet.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens, feed and vitamins to set up a hatchery.

loans.name: Siempre Amigas(Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Siempre Amigas está ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca en la parroquia El Valle al sureste de la cuidad, esta parroquia es famosa por su importante producción de maíz y por sus atractivos turísticos como las lagunas de Cochapamba, la Colina de Tasqui, el rio Mulay, entre otros, lo que atrae al turista nacional y extranjero.

Este Banco está formado por  mujeres  y hombres que se unieron para buscar el bienestar propio y de su familia,  son muy buenos amigos  solidarios con todos los miembros de su banca comunal siempre pensando en el bienestar de todos los socios del banco comunal. 

La señora  Luz María U. vive en la comunidad Gualacay en la parroquia El Valle, tiene 47 años de edad, se encuentra felizmente casada y fruto de su amor  concibió seis hijos de: 23, 21, 18, 15, 12, 10 años de edad, su hija mayor  es casada y vive independientemente con su familia, el  segundo estudia en la Universidad de Cuenca, su tercer y cuarto hijos estudian  en el  Colegio Guillermo Mensi, su quinta hija estudia en el colegio Manuela Garaicoa de Calderón, y su último hijo en la escuela de la comunidad.

María se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y también a la cría de animales como  vacas, borregos, cuyes, pollos;  lleva  seis ciclos  trabajando con la fundación y nos comenta que los créditos obtenidos le han permitido  ir comprando sus  animales poco a poco, con el nuevo  préstamo que ESPOIR le entregue  va a invertir en la  compra de alimento para sus animales ya que por la sequia no tienen el pasto suficiente para alimentarse.

Su meta es incrementar su corral otros animales  como cerdos. 

Rosa Florencia C. C. es otra socia activa del banco Comunal Siempre Amigas, vive por las minas de Maluay en la parroquia el Valle en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 32 años de edad de estado civil casada y madre de dos niños de 13, 11 años , su hija mayor estudia en el colegio de las Madres Oblatas y su hijo menor en la escuela de la parroquia, su esposo trabaja en la construcción actividad  que le permite aportar económicamente con los requerimientos de su hogar e ir construyendo poco a poco su casa que aún falta mucho, por ahora viven en casa de su madre.

 Rosa tiene un bazar lleva cuatro años en este negocio y nos comenta que le va bien, su horario de trabajo es de 8  a 12 a.m.  Y de 3 a 7 p.m., también se dedica a la cría de un toro y cuyes para su consumo personal.

Lleva dos años  trabajando con la fundación y los créditos recibidos ha invertido en su negocio, con el préstamo  que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue va a comprar  artículos para el hogar, útiles escolares, juguetes, cosméticos, etc. para mantener un stock surtido para la  época navideña y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Su sueño es tener un  local propio y  grande  para incrementar otras líneas de productos en su bazar.

María Patricia A. vive en la comunidad de Gualancay en la parroquia El Valle en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 18, 16, 13 años, todos sus hijos estudian en el colegio Guillermo Mensi, su esposo trabaja en la construcción con los ingresos que obtienen mantiene a su familia y le ha permitido construir su casa.

María Patricia se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y también a la cría de animales como cuyes, chanchos, borregos, vacas, la leche que obtiene  de sus vacas entrega a sus vecinos de la comunidad.

María Patricia lleva tres ciclos trabajando con la fundación y está muy feliz porque los préstamos recibidos ha invertido en la compra de animales para su corral y con el nuevo crédito que la institución le entregue va a comprar más crías de animales y comida para su crianza.
texts.en:
The Amigas communal bank is located in the city of Cuenca, in the El Valle parrish, in the southest part of the city. This parrish is famous for its corn production and for its attractive tourist sites like the Cochapamba Lagoons, the Tasqui Hill, the Mulay River, among others, which attract tourists from all over the world. This bank is made up of women and men who have come together to seek their own and their families' wellbeing. They are good, supportive friends to each other always thinking of ways to help each other get ahead. Luz Maria U., 47, lives in the community of Gualacay in the El Valle parrish. She is happily married and the mother of 6 children whose ages are: 23, 21, 18, 15, 12, and 10. Her eldest daughter is married and lives independently with her own family. Her next eldest is a student at the University of Cuenca, her third and fourth children are students at the Guillermo Mensi High School, her fifth daughter studies at the Manuela Garaicoa de Calderon school, and her last son is a student at the local elementary school. Maria is a housewife but also raises farm animals like cows, lambs, guinea pigs, chickens. She has been involved with the foundation for six cycles and comments that the loans obtained have allowed her to buy her animals little by little. With this new loan from ESPOIR she will buy feed for her animals since the draught has caused insufficient grass to be available for feeding. Her goal is to increase her stock of animals by the addition of pigs. Rosa Florencia C. C., 32, is another active member of the Siempre Amigas communal bank. She lives in Minas de Maluay, El Valle parrish, Cuenca. She is married and has two children, 13 and 11. Her eldest daughter studies at the Madres Oblatas school and her younger son attends the municipal elementary school. Her husband works in construction which produces income to meet household needs and to build their house which is still unfinished; they live in her mother's house. Rosa has had a store for the past 4 years and does well. Her working schedule is from 8-12 and 3-7. She also raises a bull and guinea pigs for their own consumption. She has been working with the foundation for two years and the loans she has received she has invested in her business. With this new loan she will buy articles for the home, school supplies, toys, cosmetics, etc. to have a varied stock available for the Christmas season and better meet her customers' needs. Her dream is to own her own, large store so that she can sell a wider variety of products. Maria Patricia A., 42, lives in the Gualancay community, El Valle parrish, Cuenca. She is married and the mother of 3 children, 18, 16, and 13 years old. All of her children are students at the Guillermo Mensi school. Her husband works in construction and his earnings support the family and allow them to build their house. Maria Patricia is a housewife but also raises small farm animals like guinea pigs, pigs, lambs, cows. She shares the milk she gets from her cows with her neighbors. Maria Patricia has been involved with the foundation for three cycles and is very happy with her loans which she has invested in purchasing animals for her yard. This new loan will be used to buy still more animals and feed for them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small farm animals to raise as well as articles for the home, office supplies, paper goods, toys.

loans.name: Martha Aryera

texts.es: La joven Martha Aryera U.  tiene la edad de 28 años, habita en el barrio los Venegas ubicado en carretera hacia Masaya, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja en Bayer , para apoyarla con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen dos hijos , una niña de cinco y un  bebé de once meses , los planes hacia su familia es poder darles una buenas educación y comodidad , doña Martha desde hace cinco años , se dedica al comercio de venta de ropa para bebé, y para adultos , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que en momentos tiene encargo y por falta de capital no logra abarcar a todos sus clientes, es por eso  solicita su crédito para poder cumplir con la demanda de pedido de ropa  de los clientes. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo económico ya que podrá cumplir la meta de las ventas.
texts.en:
Martha Aryera U. is 28 years old and lives with her husband in the neighborhood of Los Venegas, which is located on the road to Masaya. Her husband works for Bayer and helps her with the household expenses. They have two children, a five-year-old girl and an eleven-month-old infant. Her goal is to be able to provide her children with comfort and a good education. For five years Martha has made a living selling clothing for infants and adults. The biggest problem she faces is that she currently has outstanding orders and because of a lack of capital she cannot cover the orders for all of her customers. That is why she is requesting a loan so that she can meet the demand of her customers’ clothing orders. She thanks the lending institution for its financial assistance, since it will allow her to accomplish her sales goals.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing clothing for infants and adults

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor R. B. tiene la edad de 39 años y vive en union libre. El es un agricultor y tiene  pasto libre que no esta usando para vaccas. Ahora el esta trabajando en fincas grandes acerca de Santa Elena pero le gustaría comenzar criando ganado en su finca propia. Por esto, él tiene que construir un corral por ganado. Hace muchos años que se dedica al campo y quiere crecer su finca propia.
Es su primer prestamo con FUDECOSUR y no ha tenido credito con otros bancos en el pasado porque los tuvieron demasiado requisitos. En un año cuando el corral es completado, le gustaría un otro prestamo con FUDECOSUR para comprar ganado. Algun dia, él quisiera hijos y desea brindar a su esposa un futuro mejor y estable.
texts.en:
Victor R. B. is 39 years old and in a common law marriage. He is a farmer and has grassland that is not being utilized for cattle. At the moment, he is working on several large farms in Santa Elena but he hopes to enjoy breeding cattle on his own farm. For this reason, he needs to build a livestock corral. Victor has several years of experience in agriculture and wants to expand his own farm.

This is Victor’s first loan with FUDECOSUR. He decided not to take out loans with other banks in the past because the requirements were too demanding. Victor hopes to have his corral completed within a year. At that time, he will apply for another loan from FUDECOSUR to buy livestock. Someday he wants to provide his wife and children with a better and more stable future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a corral for his future cattle business

loans.name: Jeovany Daniel

texts.es: El joven  Jeovany Jarquín tiene 27 años de edad, casado, tiene dos hijos sus esposa trabaja le ayuda con los gastos del pago de agua, luz y lo que haga falta, reside en el barrio Healeah en la capital de Managua sus metas es construir su vivienda, Hombre trabajador, buen padre que lo importante y primordial es la seguridad y protección de su familia, trabaja en la aria de mensajería en una empresa de diseño, desde hace seis meses, anteriormente trabajaba como guardia de seguridad, con un salario muy bajo que solo le permitía comprar la alimentación de su familia como dificultades ha encontrado la inestabilidad laboral. Con el préstamo en Afodenic comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloques para la construcción de su casa ya que es muy humilde hecha de zinc y tabla pero los materiales están viejos ya y necesita comenzar hacer el arranque de concreto para firmeza de las paredes ya que desea darle a su familia una casa digna en donde se pueda dormir un poco mejor con seguridad. Da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible su sueño de todo padre de dar un techo a sus hijos y que  por falta económica abecés no se logra lo esperado.
texts.en:
Jeovany Jarquín is 27 years old, married, and has two children. His wife works and does whatever she can to help pay for water and electricity. They live in the Hialeah neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. Jeovany’s goals include building a house. He is a hardworking man and a good father who wants to provide security and protection for his family. Currently he works as a messenger for a design firm and has been at this job for six month. He previously worked as a security guard, but his salary alone was not enough to feed his family. Jeovany has had difficulties in the past finding stable employment.

With this loan from AFODENIC, he will buy construction materials such as cement, iron, and concrete blocks so that he can build his house. The modest structure his family currently lives in is made of zinc and wooden planks. The existing materials are old, so he needs to tear them down so that he can build reinforced walls that will give his family a decent home where they can sleep a bit more securely. Jeovany thanks the Institution for making possible the dream of any father to provide his children with a roof over their heads and basic necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to begin construction of his house

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Jose G. N. C. tiene 21 años, vive en union libre, y tiene 1 hija que es su primer prioridad. Su hija tiene 6 meses. El es un agricultor de frijoles en una finca acerca. El tiene campo libre y le gustaría comezar cultivando frijoles. El tuvo un prestamo con FUDECOSUR hace un año para cultivando chili pero no tuvo exito. El piense que frijoles serían un producto mejor con su tipo de tierra. Es su segundo prestamo con FUDECOSUR y prefiere los prestamos FUDECOSURes por que hay menos requistos que los bancos formales. él desea brindar a su hija un futuro mejor y estable y tambien que ella sería una profesional.
texts.en:
Jose G. N. C. is 21 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a 6 month old daughter who is his highest priority. He grows beans on a local farm. Jose has free use of the land and enjoys growing his crops. He took out a loan with FUDECOSUR a year ago in order to grow chili peppers, but the crop was not successful. He believes beans are better suited for this land.

This is Jose’s second loan with FUDECOSUR and he prefers these loans because they have fewer requirements that those of formal banks. He hopes to provide his daughter with a better and more stable future so that she can grow up to become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for his crop of beans

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: El señor Wilfredo se dedica a la cerrajeria, elaborando puertas coloniales, barandas, cortinas, todo lo referente a fierro forjado, el señor crecio con credito pequeño el cual "EMPRENDER", le finacio para poder comprar mas material para fabricar mas puertas de fierro. El señor vive en casa de sus suegros con su esposa y sus hijos, que tambien le ayudan, tambien el señor arregla cocinas y los arma para poder venderlos. El destino del credito es para poder comprar material y una amoladora.
texts.en:
Sr. Wilfredo is a blacksmith who makes colonial doors, banisters, curtain rods, and anything made out of wrought iron. He was able to grow his business with a small loan from Emprender, which he used to buy materials for making iron doors. Wilfredo lives in the home of his in-laws with his wife and children, who also help with the business. He also repairs stoves and refurbishes them so that they can be resold.

Wilfred is requesting a loan to buy more materials and a grinder for sharpening metal.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & a metal grinder

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora María Elena se dedica a la venta D. cocinas y hornos en general. Empezo con un capital pequeño el cual "EMPRENDER", le dio credito para que asi cresca mas su negocio, la señora vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijas, que tambien le ayudan en la venta D. cocinas y hornos; el destino del credito es para poder comprar mas cocinas y hornos para las fiestas D. todos santos, y navidad el cual la señora indica que hay en esa fiestas mas ventas.
texts.en:
María Elena sells stoves and ovens in general. She began with a small amount of capital from Emprender, who gave her credit so that she could grow her business. María lives in her own house with her husband and daughters who help her sell the stoves and ovens. The purpose of this credit is to allow her to buy more stoves and ovens for the celebration of All Saints and Christmas. She points out that she has more sales at the time of these celebrations.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for her business

loans.name: Aracelly

texts.en:
Aracelly M. M. is a 51-year-old married woman with thirteen grown children who are her first priority. Their ages range from 17 to 34. She lives with her husband and youngest daughter; her other children have moved to villages nearby. Her husband has a small farm where he grows coffee and raises pigs.

Aracelly runs a general store with her youngest daughter and needs a loan to buy more stock, specifically household basics. The store is located in a room in her house facing the street and she has had the business for two years. This is her second loan with FUDECOSUR and she hopes it will help her grow her business to support her youngest daughter's education.

Aracelly dreams that her children will be healthy and her youngest daughter will continue studying and learn English.

loans.use: To buy more stock, specifically household basics

loans.name: Enrique Avenamar

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor E. Avenamar E. le está haciendo falta la reparación del techo el cual está en muy malas condiciones y terminar la construcción de un cuarto, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar la mejora. 
Es por eso que está solicitando el préstamo para poder comprar el material y así reparar el techo antes de que pase un accidenté y terminar la recamara que es para su hijo.
Don E. Avenamar tiene ya mas de veinte años dedicándose a su negocio de  fabricación y venta de barritas congelados de varios sabores, este es el ingreso que el tiene y con el cual una parte será para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
At the home of Sr. Enrique Avenamar E., the roof is in very poor condition and in dire need of repairs. He also needs to finish construction of a room, but does not have the money at the moment to make these improvements. For this reason, Don Enrique is requesting a loan in order to buy materials needed to repair the roof before an accident happens. He will also finish his son’s bedroom.

For more than 20 years, Don Enrique has been producing and selling frozen treats of various flavors. Part of his income will be used to repay this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the roof and finish construction of a bedroom

loans.name: Maclovio

texts.es:
El señor Maclovio H. y su esposa la señora Matilde Cruz, es un matrimonio joven y  tiene poco tiempo que adquirió su vivienda por medio de Infonavit, pero le está haciendo falta algunos detalles para que este en mejor condición. 
Es por eso que solicita el préstamo para poder pintar el interior y arreglar algunos detalles que se necesitan y así podrían habitar lo más pronto posible para dejar de pagar renta. 
Planea pagar el préstamo con los ingresos que el genera de su empleo como guardia de seguridad de una compañía, ya que con los ganancias que obtiene su esposa de las ventas de productos de belleza por catálogos serán para los gastos de la familia. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Matilde Cruz esposa del señor Maclovio ya que el se encontraba en su trabaja el día de la visita.
texts.en:
Maclovio H. and his wife Matilde Cruz are a young married couple. They recently acquired their home through Infonavit, but still need to make some minor repairs. For this reason they are requesting a loan that will allow them to paint the inside of the house and fix some details, thus enabling them to move in as soon as possible and stop paying rent. He plans to repay the loan with the income he earns from his job as a security guard at a private company. The income his wife earns from selling catalog beauty products will cover household expenses. Only Matilde Cruz appears in the photo, because Maclovio was working on the day of the visit.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To paint the house interior and make repairs.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter Q. P., tiene 26 años, es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres. Su madre se dedica a la lecheria y el tuvo que dejar el colegio debido a que necesitaba ayudar a la madre con su trabajo. Primeramente el trabajaba solamente como chofer para otra persona y despues ahorro lo necesario para comprar un vehiculo

El ahora esta trabajando con su vehiculo como taxista por toda la ciudad de Cochabamba.
Necesita el dinero para comprar un equipo de gas natural para que lo instalen en su vehiculo y asi pueda disminuir los costos de combustible ya que es su principal costo de su actividad. Asi ahorraria el cincuenta por ciento de costos por combustible lo que le ayudaria mucho ya que tendria mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Walter Q. P. is 26 years old, single and lives in his parents' home. His mother makes a living at a dairy, and he had to give up school so he could help her with her work. He started out working as a taxi driver for another person and later he saved enough to purchase his own vehicle. He now drives his own car as a taxi throughout the entire city of Cochabamba. He is requesting the loan to purchase natural gas equipment to install in his car so he can lower his fuel costs, which are the main expenses of his work. He could save 50 percent off his gas costs and that would help him a lot in earning better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase natural gas equipment for his car

loans.name: Blas Group

texts.es:
El grupo blas lo conforman Elizabeth Eugenia M. G. de 21 años, Rosalinda G. de 54 años y Lucia Emilia G. de 54 años. La joven M. desde hace tres años empezó a vender cosméticos por catalogo con lo cual se ha ayudado con los gastos de sus estudios universitarios. Ella está en cuarto año de administración de empresa y desea tener una tienda de ropas y cosméticos.


La señora G.  desde el 2004 empezó haciendo pan y cosa de horno en pequeñas cantidades y actualmente distribuye en las ventas y   Lucia Emilia G. hace doce años que hace destace de cerdo.
texts.en:
The Blas Group consists of Elizabeth Eugenia M. G. (age 21), Rosalinda G. (age 54), and Lucia Emilia G. (age 54). Young Elizabeth began selling cosmetics by catalog three years ago in order to pay for her college expenses. She is her fourth year studying business administration and hopes to open her own clothing and cosmetics store.

Sra. Rosalinda, since 2004, has been producing and selling bread and other baked goods in small batches. Sra. Lucia has been selling pork for 12 years.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies for their respective businesses

loans.name: Fuerza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Fuerza está integrado por María Isabel A., Julieta Magdalena H. y Viki de los Ángeles  S. L.. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora A. de 44 años. Ella desde la edad de 19 años ha trabajado en la costura y actualmente su taller se ha especializado en trajes de danza para lo cual requiere del préstamo para comprar materiales como lentejuelas, cintas, telas, hilos, bordados, piedras….etc.

Mientras la señora H. de 47 de los cuales ha de dicado quince años a la costura y S. de 40 años tiene una pequeña venta.
texts.en:
María Isabel A., Julieta Magdalena H. and Viki de los Ángeles S. L. comprise the Fuerza Group. Mrs. A., 44, is the coordinator of the group. She has worked as a seamstress since she was 19. Her shop currently specializes in dance attire. She needs the loan to buy materials like sequins, ribbons, fabric, needles, embroidery, and jewels, etc. Señora H., 47, has worked as a seamstress for 15 years. Señora S., 40, has a small sales business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, needles, and ribbons, etc.

loans.name: Manantial En El Desierto Group

texts.es:
María Auxiliadora R., Lucia del Carmen C. y Esperanza D. F. conforman al grupo Manantial en el Desierto. La señora R. es la coordinadora del grupo ella comenzó haciendo tortilla y después las vendía con queso e introdujo gaseosa, frescos y granos básicos hasta que estableció una venta. DesD. hace un año ella trabaja con Adim y con sus ganancias empezó a criar cerdos, cabros y gallinas.

Lucia del Carmen C. Aguilar hace un año y medio empezó haciendo y vendiendo atol, arroz D. leche, frescos y tacos las ganancias las fue ahorrando y junto con los  prestamos que le brindo adim comenzó a hacer nacatamales y vender ropa y zapatos. Esperanza D. Fariña distribuye gas butano y tiene una pequeña librería.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora R., Lucia del Carmen C. and Esperanza D. F. make up the Manantial en el Desierto Group. Señora R. is the coordinator of the group. She started making tortillas. She then sold them with cheese. She introduced soft drinks, fruit drinks, and basic grains until she established her sales business. She has worked with Adim for one year. She used her earnings to start raising pigs, goats, and chickens. A year and a half ago Lucia del Carmen C. Aguilar started making and selling “atoll” (a rice drink), rice pudding, fruits drinks, and tacos. She was saving her earnings. She put her savings together with the loans from Adim, and she started to make “nacatamales” (a traditional Central American dish similar to a tamale) and to sell clothes and shoes. Esperanza D. F. distributes butane gas and has a small bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.es: Las socias D. AMISTAD son todas del mismo barrio, cada una D. ellas tienen sus propios negocios con el que día a día trabajan, como ser venta D. comida, costurera, venta D. pan, tienda D. abarrotes, venta D. refrescos empanadas,  promotoras D. cosméticos, venta D. sabanas, venta D. edredones, venta D. ropa. En cuanto a la competencia  en sus negocios indican que existe pero pese a eso ellas saben sacar  adelante sus respectivos negocios. El crédito lo utilizan para hacer crecer sus negocios tener más capital, tener a futuro un negocio consolidado. Los antecedentes crediticios D. este Banco Comunal AMISTAD van por el tercer ciclo es muy bueno todas se llevan bien, son bien activas. Algunas D. las socias trabajan solo con Agrocapital y otras trabajan extra con otras entidades financieras. Amistad es un grupo organizado, ellas en cada reunión llevan a cabo una rifa para hacer crecer su caja chica y así al finalizar el ciclo puedan tener más ahorros. Para sus reuniones preparan refrigerios y D. vez en cuando comparten alguna festividad como ser el día D. la madre o día D. la amistad, es un grupo muy organizado.
texts.en:
The members of the AMISTAD (friendship) group are all from the same neighborhood, and each one of the women has her own business where she works daily, for instance, selling different kinds of food, sewing, running a grocery store, promoting cosmetics, or selling bedding supplies and clothing. There is competition for these businesses but these women know how to keep moving forward. They plan to use the loan to grow their businesses with more capital so they can make them stronger in the future. This the third loan cycle for the AMISTAD Community Bank, and the previous ones have gone very well. Some of the members work only with AgroCapital, while others work with other partner microfinance institutions. AMISTAD is an organized group. At each meeting the members conduct a raffle to increase their petty cash fund and can finish their loan cycle with more savings. For their meetings they prepare snacks and once in a while get together on holidays, like on Mother's Day or Friendship Day. It is a very organized group.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: Aurora tiene 48 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, Aurora es enfermera hace varios años brinda servicio a domicilio y también atiende en su domicilio particular, paralelamente trabaja en el cuidado a personas de la tercera edad como enfermería de cabecera, a ella le gusta bastante el trabajo que realiza.  Su esposo trabaja en una empresa constructora hace varios años es topógrafo y gracias a los prestamos de Agrocapital y la buena administración de sus ingresos lograron estabilizarse económicamente, es el tercer crédito al que accedieron en la institución el cual fue para cancelar una deuda personal de la operación de su hija, Aurora es muy responsable y honesta siempre cancelo los créditos sin problemas y siempre trabajo con la institución.
texts.en:
Aurora is 48 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and daughter. She has been a nurse for a number of years, working at patients' homes while also providing services out of her own. At the same time, she also works as a bedside nurse for seniors in the city. Aurora quite likes the work she does. Her husband has worked for a construction company for a number of years as a topographer, and thanks to the loans from Kiva partner AgroCapital and administering their income properly they have been able to reach some economic stability. This is the third loan Aurora has been granted, and she's using it to pay off debt from her daughter's operation. Aurora is very responsible and honest, and she always pays off her loans without problems and works well with this microfinance institution.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay off personal debt from her daughter's operation

loans.name: Zeneida

texts.es: Zeneida S. Z. tiene 58 anos, vive en union libre y tiene 6 hijos que son su primer prioridad. Sus hijos tienen 18, 20, 27, 29, 31, 34 años pero solamente uno vive con su familia. Los otros viven en sus casas propias acerca. Zeneida y su esposo cultivan café pero quisieran cultivar un poco mas. Ella  necesita fertilizantes para preparar la tierra por cafe y por esta razón solicitó un préstamo de Fudecosur. Es el primer préstamo con FUDECOSUR y piense que pueda crecer su campo con este préstamo. Le gusta los prestamos fudecosures por que son mas baratos. él desea brindar a sus hijos un futuro mejor y estable y que su hija menor apprender ingles y estudiar. Quiere trabajar por sus hijos y mejorar la calidad de su producto.
texts.en:
Zeneida S. Z. is 58 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 6 children who are her highest priority. Her children range in age from 18 to 34, but only one of them still lives at home with her. The others have their own families and live nearby.

Zeneida and her husband grow coffee, but they would like to increase their production. She needs fertilizers to prepare the land for coffee planting, so she has requested her first loan from FUDECOSUR. Zeneida believes she will be able to increase the yield from her field with the help of this loan.

She likes the loans from FUDECOSUR because of the lower rates. Zeneida hopes to provide her children with a better and more stable future, and that her youngest daughter learns English for her studies. She wants to continue working for the sake of her children and continue improving the quality of her product.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for her coffee crop

loans.name: Lidio Luis

texts.es: Lidio tiene 56 años de edad y su esposa tiene 49 años, ellos son casados, tienen hijos que viven con ellos, sus hijos actualmente se encuentran estudiando, la familia vive en una casa que es propia desde hace bastante tiempo, en esta casita Lidio ha hecho varias mejoras para instalar en el mismo lugar un negocio de venta de comida, su esposa tiene experiencia en el rubro de la comidas. La competencia es baja por eso tiene bastante demanda, además  que está en buena ubicación, no hay otro negocio por esta zona, por otra parte Lidio es empleado dependiente en un ingenio de la zona, Lidio trabaja en este lugar desde hace bastante tiempo atrás. El crédito será invertido en mejoras en su inmueble, este crédito es su sexta operación en nuestra institución, ha tenido un buen historial crediticio en Agrocapital, presenta una deuda en otra entidad financiera la misma que cancela con normalidad.
texts.en:
Lidio is 56 years old and his wife is 49, and their children, who are still in school, live with them in a home they have owned for a long time. Lidio has made various improvements to the home to set up a business selling food out of the place, and his wife has experience in the food industry. The business does not have much competition, so the demand is quite high, and it also has a good location because there are no others in the area. Lidio also has worked at a local refinery since a long time back. He plans to use the loan he is requesting to make improvements to his property. This is his sixth loan from the microfinance institution and he has a good credit history with Kiva partner AgroCapital. He also takes out loans from another institution that he consistently pays off.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements on his property

loans.name: Las Novatas Group

texts.es:
4000,  4000 4000
Las novatas está conformado por Lidia María C., Sandra de los Ángeles R. e  Irene del Socorro C. C.. La señora C. de 42 años hace ocho años empezó haciendo comida que distribuía en empresas aledañas a su hogar y actualmente se introdujo a la venta de ropa. Ella tiene 8 años de trabajar con Adim y su sueño es tener un comedor.

La señora Sandra de los Ángeles R. hace nueve años empezó a vender comida derivada del cerdo y actualmente tiene un pequeño comedor con variedad de comidas caseras y típicas.  Mientras la joven  C. desde los 17 años vende visuteria y así se pudo costear el bachillerato.
texts.en:
The group “Las Novatas” consists of Lidia María C., Sandra de los Ángeles R., and Irene del Socorro C. C.. Sra. Lidia is 42 years old and has been selling food for 8 years. She prepares meals out of her home and delivers them to nearby businesses. She recently started selling clothing. Lidia has been a client of ADIM for eight years and she dreams of opening a diner.

Sra. Sandra has been selling food for nine years. She has a small diner where she offers a variety of homemade traditional dishes, mostly containing pork. Young Irene is only 17 years old and sells costume jewelry so that she can pay for her education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies for their respective businesses

loans.name: Simona

texts.es: Simona tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales solamente dos dependen de ella. Su esposo tiene 44 años. Simona se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida, tiene su puesto de venta ubicado en el mercado central. Se dedica a esta actividad hace mucho tiempo atrás. Generalmente elabora platos paceños. El nivel de competencia es alto, ya que existen varias personas que se dedican a esta actividad, pero la demanda también es alta, y el lugar donde está ubicado su negocio le favorece bastante. El destino del crédito fue para compra de un horno industrial. Es el cuarto crédito al que accede Simona, presento un comportamiento bueno en los anteriores créditos. No presenta antecedentes negativos en el sistema financiero ni en nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Simona is 50 years old, married and has three children, only two of which are still dependents. Her husband is 44. Simona makes a living making and selling food. She has a sales post located in the central market and has been dedicated to this activity for a long time. Usually she makes typical regional meals. The level of competition is high because there is a number of people who make a living in this activity, but the demand is also quite high, and the location of her business helps her out a lot. She plans to use the loan to purchase an industrial oven. This is the fourth loan Simona has been granted, and she has been good with her previous loans. She has a clean credit history with this and any other microfinance instutiton.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an industrial oven

loans.name: La Union Group

texts.es: Las socias de LA UNIÓN son del mismo barrio todas, cada una de ellas tienen sus propios negocios con el que día a día trabajan, como ser venta de comida, venta de pan, tienda de abarrotes, venta de refrescos empanadas,  promotoras de cosméticos, venta de sabanas y edredones, venta de ropa. En cuanto a la competencia  en sus negocios indican que existe pero pese a eso ellas saben salir adelante. El crédito lo utilizaran para hacer crecer sus negocios tener más capital, tener a futuro un negocio consolidado. Los antecedentes crediticios de este Banco Comunal La es muy bueno ya que todas se llevan bien son bien activas tienen muchas ganas de ser el mejor grupo y trabajar. Algunas socias tienen créditos en otras entidades financieras. En las reuniones realizan refrigerios para compartir con el resto de las socias, esto lo vienen realizando desde la primera reunión.
texts.en:
The members of La Unión are all from the same neighborhood. They all have their own businesses, which they work day to day. They have businesses like selling food, selling bread, having grocery stores, selling refreshments and “empanadas” (stuffed pastry), selling cosmetics, selling sheets and quilts, and selling clothes. In spite of the competition that exists, they know how to get ahead. They will use the loan to make their businesses grow, to have more capital, and to have a solid business in the future. The previous loans with this communal bank have been very good. All of the members get along well, are very active, and have a great desire to be the best group and to work. Some of the members have loans with other financial entities. They make refreshments to share with the other members at their meetings. They have been doing this since their first meeting.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis A. G. C. tiene 58 anos, casado y tiene 5 hijos que son su primer prioridad. Sus hijos tienen 35, 34, 33, 28, 25 años pero viven afuera de la casa. Luis cria ganado pero quisiera mas vaccas. El tiene 35 hectarías de pasto y 9 vaccas pero para criar mas vaccas, tiene que mejorar el pasto y por esta razón solicitó un préstamo de FUDECOSUR. Es el primer préstamo con FUDECOSUR y piense que pueda crecer su campo con este préstamo. Le gusta los prestamos fudecosures por que hay menos requisitos y mas agiles. él desea brindar a su esposa e hijos un futuro mejor. Todos sus hijos estan trabajando y esto fue su meta, por esto se alegre. Algun dia, el quisiera comprar un trapiche para caña y preparar jugo de caña para vender.
texts.en:
Luis A. G. C. is 58 years old, married, and has 5 children that are his first priority. His children are 35, 34, 33, 28 and 25 and they live outside of the house. Luis raises livestock but would like to have more cows. He has 35 hectares of pasture and 9 cows but to raise more cows, he must improve his pasture and for this reason he is requesting a loan from FUDECOSUR. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, and he will be able to increase his fields with this loan. He likes the loans from FUDECOSUR because they are more flexible and have fewer requirements. He wishes to provide his wife and children with a better future. All of his children are working; this was his goal, and for this he is happy. Some day he would like to buy a sugar mill and prepare sugar cane juice to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to prepare his pasture

loans.name: Luz Coral Group

texts.es: El  Banco Comunal  Luz Coral a la fecha se conforma con 12 Socios que se dedican en su mayoría a la venta de mercadería de temporada en tiendas y en puestos en los mercados y otros viajan constantemente en ferias ocasionales, principalmente para poder lograr mayor volumen de ventas y por ende márgenes de ingresos mayores ya que ello les sirve de gran manera pues algunas señoras son jefes de hogar y quienes sustentan a toda su familia, referente a los antecedentes crediticios  en Agrocapital todos los socios son nuevos que viendo nuestras ventajas decidieron trabajar con nuestra institución aunque el 90% de ellos ya tiene experiencia de trabajo con créditos bajo esta modalidad, bajo estos antecedentes es que el Banco Comunal da el primer paso con nuestra institución.
texts.en:
The Luz Coral Communal Bank is currently comprised of 12 members. Most of them sell seasonal merchandise in stores and in stalls at markets. Others constantly travel to temporary fairs. They do this primarily to be able to sell more and earn more, and it serves them very well. Some of the women are heads of the household, and they support their whole family. As far as previous loans with Agrocapital go, all of the members are new. Seeing our advantages, they decided to work with our institution even though 90% of them have experience working with credit of this kind. It is with this record that the communal bank takes its first step with our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: El Anexo 3 Group

texts.es:
El grupo anexo 3 está integrado por Santa Julia R. B., Marveli del Carmen R. M. y Evangelina del los Ángeles G. H.. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora R. B. de 29 años desde hace seis año puso una pequeña  venta con la cual se ayudado para criar a sus tres pequeños hijos. El mayor sueño de ella es que su negocio crezca hasta que se convierta en una miscelánea.

La joven R. de 25 años hace tres años inicio su propio negocio ella comenzó alquilando teléfonos, luego empezó a vender  frescos, enchiladas y actualmente vende ropa. El sueño de ella es tener un comedor de día y que en la tarde funcione como una fritanga. 
La señora G. H. de 31 años es vendedora ambulante de pescado y ropa desde hace seis años.
texts.en:
The group "El Anexo 3" is comprised of Santa Julia R. B., Marveli del Carmen R. M. and Evangelina del los Ángeles G. H.. The coordinator of the group is Señora R. B., who is 20 years old. For six years she has had a small business which has helped her to raise her three small children. Her main dream is to grow her business until it becomes a variety store. Young R., who is 25 years old, started her own business three years ago renting telephones, later she began to sell soft drinks and enchiladas and currently she sells clothing. She dreams of having an eatery during the day, which would function as a fritanga (street side open-air grill) in the evening. Señora G. H. is 31 years old and has sold fish and clothing in the street for six years.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy basic grains and consumer products

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: Juan Pablo de 28 años deedad es soltero, tiene 2 hijas-un par de gemelitas de 6 meses de edad-, labora para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como policia municipal desde hace 5 años.  Esta solicitando su 2do credito para compra de productos para su pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion que tiene desde hace 3 años, la cual administra su compañera de vida. Con este pequeño negocio ha podido obtener ingresos adicionales que le permiten darle las condiciones basicas a sus pequeñitas que son su razon de ser, expresa seguir solicitando m{as creditos para la misma inversion y asi poder incrementar su negocio y las ganancias, que le permitiran darle una mejor educacion a sus hijas en el futuro.
texts.en:
Juan Pablo is 28 and single. He has two daughters, six month old twins. He has worked as a municipal policeman for the town of Juigalpa for five years. He is asking for his second loan to buy products for his small mini-market, which has been located in his home for three years. His life partner manages the store. With this small business he has been able to get additional income, which has allowed him to give his little ones the basic living conditions. They are his reason for living. He says that he will continue asking for more loans for the same investment. That way he will be able to increase his business and earnings. That will allow him to give his daughters a better education in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for his mini market

loans.name: Sandro

texts.es: Sandro es soltero, no tiene hijos, tiene 28 años y vive en la casa de su madre. Sandro se dedica a la venta de zapatos y chinelas en las ferias móviles provinciales y adicionalmente realiza trabajos de mecánica. Tiene 4 años de experiencia en el comercio de calzados. La competencia es regular ya que la comercialización que realiza en las ferias móviles en las diferentes provincias aledañas a la provincia donde vive hace que tenga bastante venta y mantenga un precio estable en sus productos. El crédito lo destino para la compra de calzados de forma que muestren estar más surtidos. Cuenta con 4 créditos en la institución con buen comportamiento de pagos y no tiene deudas en otras instituciones.
texts.en:
Sandro is single, and he does not have children. He is 28, and he lives in his mother’s house. Sandro sells shoes and slippers in the traveling provincial fairs. He also works as a mechanic. He has four years of experience in the footwear business. He has the regular amount of competition. The sales that he makes in the traveling fairs and in the different neighboring provinces give him enough sales and allow the prices on his products to remain stable. The loan is to buy footwear so that he has more stock. He has had four loans with the institution, and he has a good history of repayment. He does not have debts with other institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes

loans.name: Sonilda

texts.es: Sonilda tiene 41 años de edad, es soltera, posee un bien inmueble en el cual actualmente vive,  no tiene hijos, también posee un vehículo el mismo que le genera una renta diaria, ya que presta el servicio en el transporte trufis con chofer. Se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para ambos sexos en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad, actividad a la que se dedica hace más de 10 años atrás, por lo que cuenta con buena experiencia en el rubro. La competencia es alta, pero la antigüedad, experiencia y  calidad de sus prendas, le  ha permitido contar con clientela que demanda sus prendas. El destino del crédito es para incrementar su capital de operaciones, ya que requiere contar con más prendas para el mes de noviembre y diciembre que son meses de mayor venta. Tercer préstamo  al que accede Sonilda, con buen  comportamiento de pagos  demostrado a lo largo de sus créditos anteriores. No tiene pasivos en el sistema financiero. Tiene buenas referencias personales y morales.
texts.en:
Sonilda, 41, is single. She has a nice piece of property, where she currently lives. She does not have children. She has a vehicle, which generates daily rental fees. Her car is used as a “trufi” (a trufi is similar to a taxi service, but with a fixed route). She sells men’s and women’s underwear at different fairs in the city. She has been doing this for over ten years. Therefore, she has good experience in this field. There is a lot of competition. Her seniority, experience, and the quality of her underwear have allowed her to have a client base with a demand for her garments. The loan is to increase her operating capital. She needs more garments for the months of November and December, which are the months of greater sales. This is Sonilda’s third loan. She has a good history of repaying her previous loans. She does not have liabilities in the financial system. She has good personal and moral references.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase operating capital

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Efesios Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Efesios está integrado por Mayra F., Marveli J. y  Ángela de Jesús T.. La coordinadora del grupo es Mayra F. quien en un comienzo solamente prestaba su vehículo para traer pollo crudo del mercado pero luego con las ganancias empezó a vender ella. F. invertirá el crédito en la compra de pollo y su mayor deseo es llegar hacer una distribuidora de pollo.

Marveli J. por medio de su padre quien le regalo 5000 córdobas para que comenzara uno una pequeña venta la cual desea ver convertida en una pulpería. Ángela de Jesús T. Soza tiene una modesta venta con la cual se ayuda para criar a sus cuatro pequeños.
texts.en:
The Efesios village bank is made up of Mayra F., Marveli J. and Ángela de Jesús T.. Mayra F. is the group coordinator who first started by just loaning her vehicle to bring chicken meat from the market. With her earnings, however, she later started to sell it as well. Mayra will invest the loan to purchase chicken, and her greatest wish is to become a chicken distributor.

By means of a gift of 5000 córdobas from her father, Marveli J. started a small shop that she'd like to see become a grocery store. Ángela de Jesús T. has a modest shop which helps her to raise her four children.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chicken

loans.name: Neris Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el mercado La Terminal del departamento de León, la señora Neris del Socorro B. se dedica arduamente a su actividad de venta de verduras como chiltomas, yuca, plátanos, limones, entre otros siendo este negocio el que le genera los ingresos para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación.

Hoy en día, la señora Neris acudió a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito porque necesita comprar las verduras para continuar ofreciéndolas en el mercado. Es importante destacar que ella es muy trabajadora porque a diario inicia la venta a las cuatro de la mañana y termina hasta el atardecer y a pesar que no cuenta con un local eficiente, ella se esfuerza para vender los perecederos en un canasto.
texts.en:
At the Terminal market in the department of León, Neris del Socorro B. works hard at her business, selling vegetables such as bell peppers, yucca, plantains, and limes, among others. This business generates the income that she brings home to the house where she lives. Currently, Neris is asking Ceprodel for a loan because she needs to buy vegetables in order to continue offering them at her stall. It is important to note that she is a very hardworking person: each day she starts selling her products at four in the morning and continues until sundown.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing vegetables

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
En uno de los mercados del departamento de León, la señora María Eugenia A. se dedica a su actividad de venta de comidas y bebidas ubicándose en la terminal de buses que van de León a Managua.

Actualmente, su local no presta las condiciones para desarrollar el negocio y es por esta razón que busca la manera de mejorar en el negocio. Ha solicitado un crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos y las bebidas y así continuar en su actividad para llevar el sustento a suhogar.
texts.en:
In one of the markets of the department of León, María Eugenia A. works in her activities selling food and drinks in the terminal for buses that go from León to Managua.

Currently, her premises don't offer the conditions to develop her business and for this reason, she is looking for a way to improve her business. She has requested a loan to invest directly in buying extra products to make food and drink to thereby continue her activities and provide means of support for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of extra products to make food

loans.name: Luis Guillermo

texts.es: Juis Guillermo Godiinez N. tiene 36 anos, vive en union libre y tiene 2 hijos que son su primer prioridad. Sus hijos tienen 13 y 6 años.  William cultiva café y cria vaccas pero quisiera cultiva mas cafe. El tiene campo libre pero necesita fertilizantes para prepararlo y por esta razón solicitó un préstamo de FUDECOSUR. Es el primer préstamo con FUDECOSUR y piense que pueda crecer su campo con este préstamo. Le gusta los prestamos fudecosures por que hay menos requisitos. él desea brindar a su esposa e hijos un futuro mejor y estable y quiere producir mas cafe de un mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Luis Guillermo Godiinez N., lives with his common law wife and has two children who are his main priority. His children are 13 and 6 years old. William grows coffee and rears cows but he would like to grow more coffee. He has a field available but needs fertilizers to prepare it and for this reason has requested a loan from FUDECOSUR. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he thinks that he would be able to grow his field with this loan. He likes the FUDECOSUR loans because they have fewer requirements. William would like to be able to offer his wife and children a better and more stable future and would like to produce more coffee of a better quality.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizers

loans.name: Azucena Gioconda

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Azucena M. se ha destacado por ser una persona muy trabajadora que ha venido mejorando sus condiciones de vida puesto que inició su negocio de salón de belleza y aunque su local no presenta las condiciones necesaria, ella ha venido desarrollándose poco a poco.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de los materiales de trabajo como lo son peines, gelatinas, cremas, tintes, pinturas de uña, entre otros. Ella espera confiadamente en que su crédito le será otorgado y de esta manera mejorará su condición.
texts.en:
In the department of León, Azucena M. stands out for being a very hard-working person. She has come to improve her living conditions through starting a beauty salon business. Although the premises don't present the necessary conditions, she has come to develop the business bit by bit.

Azucena is requesting a loan to buy work materials such as combs, gels, creams, dyes and nail paints, among others. She hopes confidently that the loan will be granted and in this way she will improve her situation.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of work materials for her beauty salon

loans.name: Francela Group

texts.es:
El grupo Francela está integrado por Juana Isabel F. C., Olivia Antonia R. O. y Nora del Socorro O. Z.. La señora F. C. comenzó vendiendo dos platos de comida y ahora tiene un modesto comedor al cual quiere mejorar para prestar un mejor servicio.

 Olivia R. desde hace 30 años comenzó con una pequeño puesto de verdura al que con el tiempo fue convirtiéndolo en una pulpería y lo que ella desea es que convierta en un mini súper. Nora del Socorro O. comenzó hace siete años vendiendo 700 libras de pollo crudo y ahora además de la venta de pollo tiene una refresquería donde produce siete distintos frescos.
texts.en:
The Francela group is made up by Juana Isabel F. C., Olivia Antonia R. O. and Nora del Socorro O. Z.. F. C. began selling two plates of food and now owns a modest diner which she would like to improve to offer a better service.

Thirty years ago, Olivia R. began with a small vegetable stand that with time she has converted into a corner shop and which she would like to convert into a mini-supermarket. Nora del Socorro O. began 7 years ago selling 700 pounds of raw chicken and now, as well as selling chicken, she has a refreshment stand where she produces seven distinct fruit drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, basic grains, cutlery and vegetables etc.

loans.name: Lisette Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Lisette S. desde hace trece años se ha dedicado al negocio de venta de productos derivados del maíz para elaborar los refrescos de chicha siendo vendidos en bolsas siendo comprados por sus clientes.

Ella no posee un local en buenas condiciones pero esto no es impedimento para dejar de trabajar sino que la motiva más al trabajo y a levar el sustento  a su hogar.
texts.en:
For the past 13 years, Lisette S. has been working in the business of selling corn products to make chicha drinks sold in bags and bought by her customers. Her premises don't provide good conditions but this doesn't impede her work, rather it motivates her to work more and provide a means of support for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn, firewood and bags

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El señor Santiago A. es comerciante en el departamento de León siendo propietario de su pequeña pulpería donde vende todo tipo de productos como comestibles y productos personales. El señor Santiago es muy esforzado y al tener tres hijos en edad escolar, estos son el motivo por el cual se esfuerza día a día.

Hoy en día espera que su crédito le sea otorgado para invertir en la compra de los productos para la pulpería y satisfacer a sus clientes que le visitan.
texts.en:
Santiago A. owns his small grocery store in the department of León where he sells all kinds of products like food and personal items. He is a very hard worker and, since he is the father of three school-aged children, is motivated every day to do his best. He is asking for this loan to buy inventory for his store so that he can better meet his customers' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy inventory for his grocery store.

loans.name: Matilde Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Matilde G. se dedica a la actividad de venta de frutas y verduras ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a vender mariscos (pescado) pero esta actividad no le permitía cubrir los gastos tanto del negocio como de la familia y es por esto que decidió comenzar a vender frutas y verduras.

Como todo negocio en desarrollo, ella requiere invertir en la compra de las frutas y las verduras para continuar brindándole a sus clientes dichos perecederos y de esta manera seguir esforzándose por mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
Matilde G. is a fruit and vegetable seller although she used to sell fish; but this latter activity did not produce sufficient profits to cover business expenses nor provide for household expenses. This is why she began to sell fruits and vegetables. Like in all developing businesses, however, she needs to invest in inventory so that she can continue to offer her clients these perishable items thereby continuing to try each day to do better.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Zeidy

texts.es: Zeidy M. G. tiene 31 anos, vive en union libre y tiene 3 hijos que son su primer prioridad. Sus hijos tienen 14, 9, 4 años. Zeidy tiene dos hectarías de pasto libre y quisiera empezar criando ganado. Ella quiere comparar una vacca y por esta razón solicitó un préstamo de FUDECOSUR. Es el primer préstamo con FUDECOSUR y piense que pueda crecer su campo con este préstamo. Le gusta los prestamos de FUDECOSUR por que hay menos requisitos. él desea brindar a su familía e hijos un futuro mejor y estable. Tambien ella quiere mas vaccas algun dia.
texts.en:
Zeidy M. G. is 31 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has three children, 14, 9, and 4 years old, who are her first priority. Zeidy has two hectares of unused grazing land and would like to start raising cattle. She wants to buy a cow and asked FUDECOSUR for a loan. This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR and she believes that she can make her fields grow with it. She likes FUDECOSUR's loans because they have fewer requirements. She wishes to offer her family and children a better and more stable future. She would also like to own more cows someday.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Las Palomitas Group

texts.es:
Maritza del Carmen C. de 38 años es la coordinadora del grupo Las Palomitas. Ella hace catorce años que empezó a vender enchiladas, platanitos y yuca en la actualidad ella tiene una fritanga y realiza y distribuye en los colegios y vendedores ambulantes enchiladas, platanitos y yucas. 

Orfa Vanesa D. C. de 24 años desde los catorce años tiene una fritanga. Ella comenzó haciendo platanitos y enchiladas con los cual pudo estudiar bachillerato. Ana Verónica A. empezó ahorrar del dinero para los gasto de su hogar y los invirtió en la compra de productos lácteos en lo que le ha ido muy bien.
texts.en:
Maritza del Carmen C., 38, is the Las Palomitas (The Little Doves) group leader. For the past 14 years she has prepared enchiladas, fried bananas and yucca and currently fries up her dishes and distributes them to schools and vendors. Orfa Vanesa D. C., 24, has worked her fried food stand since she was 14 years old. When she first started out she would prepare enchiladas and fried bananas. With her profits she was able to study high school. Ana Verónica A. began to put aside a little of her household money and invested it in dairy products to sell and has done quite well.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, oil, bags and firewood.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa, es madre soltera de 2 niñas, vive en el barrio Buena Vista de Nueva Guinea, labora en centro de secundaria Rubén Darió y tambièn trabaja en la Universidad Martìn Lutero, solicita refinancimiento de su 7mo credito comprar material de construción y cumplir con su metas propuesta de finalizar su construcción de su vivienda, doña Elsa se ha caracterizado por ser responsable, honesta y buena conducta, ella siempre a luchado para salir adelante con su dos hijas menores de edad, ademas expresa que esta agradecida con AFODENIC por su créditos recibidos, los cuales le han ayudado a ir mejorando poco a poco las condiciones de vida de ella y sus hijas.
texts.en:
Elsa is a single mother with 2 daughters and lives in the Buena Vista neighborhood in Nueva Guinea. She works at Rubén Darió secondary school and also at Martìn Lutero University. She is requesting her 7th loan so that she can purchase construction materials and make arrangements to finish construction of her home. Elsa is known for her responsibility, honesty, and good conduct. She has always struggled to get ahead with her two young daughters. She says that she is grateful to Kiva partner AFODENIC for the loans she has received, which have helped her to improve her and her daughters’ standard of living gradually over time.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing construction materials

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria C. J. tiene 58 anos, vive en unión libre y tiene 5 hijos que son su primer prioridad. Sus hijos tienen  38, 34, 31, 21, y 18 años respectivamente pero solamente una vive con su familia. Los otros estan casados y viven en casas acercas. Maria tiene un pulpería pero quisiera crecer. Ella vende toda diferentes tipos de comida pero tiene que comprar mas mercancía y  por esta razón solicitó un préstamo de FUDECOSUR. Es su tercero préstamo con FUDECOSUR y piense que pueda crecer su negocio con este préstamo. Le gusta los prestamos de FUDECOSUR por que ha tenido un préstamo con Banco Nacional de Costa Rica pero hubo demasiado requisitos. También ella es parte del comité FUDECOSUR entonces tiene mas confianza en FUDECOSUR que los otros bancos formales.  Ella desea brindar a su familia e hijos un futuro mejor y estable. La gustaría que su hija mas joven estudie y sería profesional.
texts.en:
Maria C. J., 58, is in a common law relationship and has 5 children, 38, 34, 31, 21, and 18 years old, who are her first priority. All of her children, except one daughter, are married and live in their own houses nearby. Maria has a small grocery store that she would like to see grow. She sells all kinds of foodstuffs but would like to diversify so has asked for a loan from FUDECOSUR. This is her third FUDECOSUR loan and she believes it will help her business grow. She likes FUDECOSUR's loans because she has had loans with the National Bank of Costa Rica and they have too many requirements. She is also a member of the FUDECOSUR committee so she is more trustful of FUDECOSUR than of traditional banks. She hopes to provide her family with a better and more stable future. She would like to see her youngest daughter study a profession.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like beans, meat and chicken.

loans.name: El Mar Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Mar está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras una de ellas es Dina Guadalupe P. O. de 37 años quien tiene una modesta venta desde hace seis años y su sueño es mejorar su casa que se encuentra en muy malas condiciones y en un futuro tener una carro. 

Martha Lizbeth A. S. de 28 años comenzó una pequeña verdulería y con forme le dieron los créditos en adim incluyo la venta de carne y hueso. Margelia del Socorro B. N. comenzó con una venta y con las ganancias y los prestamos se dedico a lo que más  puso la costura. Ella puso su propio taller de costura y empezó a vender también productos Avon.
texts.en:
The group Mar is made up of three enterprising women. One of them is Dina Guadalupe P. O. who is 37 years old and has a sales shop since 6 years ago and her dream is to better her home because it is in very bad condition and in the future to own a car.

Martha Lizbeth A. S. is 28 years old and has a small vegetable store and got a loan through ADIM (Kiva’s field partner) and in her sales included the sale of meat and bones. Margelia del Socorro B. N. began her sales and with the profits and loans began sewing. She set up her own sewing shop and sells Avon products as well.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy key grains and products for home consumption.

loans.name: Judith Genoveva

texts.en:
Judith is a client of Asociación Arariwa, a Kiva partner. She is part of a communal bank consisting of 26 members in Cusco. The group is called El Amanecer, which means daybreak in Spanish. She is from Lima and has lived in Cusco for the last five years. She is 35 years old and is married with one child, who is studying at the University of Cusco.

She has been a culinary-education professor in Cusco for the past five years. She teaches how to cook Peruvian, Andian and international cuisines. She also has a catering business where she cooks for weddings and parties. There are usually many events at the end of the month. With this loan, she will buy items to augment her catering business.

Judith Genoveva appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.
