loans.use: To buy more materials for her catering business

loans.name: Lisseth Del Carmen

texts.es: Lisseth del Carmen, solicita su primer crédito a AFODENIC para realizar compra de productos de su negocio de venta de cosmeticos , así incrementar su inventario de los productos, ellas labora como promotora de venta de productos de la zermat, ademas vende ropa y productos de alajas de plata de los que obtiene ingresos adicionales,cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo Sr. Abel Zeledón Membreño en esta gesiton crediticia, y asume los gastos familiares;  Lisseth es una mujer trabajadora, honestas,responsable, estudia su Licenciatura en la universidad Martin Lutero, para de esta manera lograr mejorar las oportunidades de trabajo que le permitiran salir adelante con su hija.
texts.en:
Lisseth del Carmen is requesting her first loan from Kiva partner AFODENIC to be able to purchase products for her business selling cosmetics and thus increase her inventory. She works as a product promoter for the Zermat line and also sells clothing and Alajas silver products for additional income. She counts on the support of her husband, Abel Zeledón Membreño, with this loan and plans to help with household expenses. Lisseth is a hard-working, honest and responsible woman who is studying for a bachelor's degree at Martin Lutero (Martin Luther) University. In this way she plans to find better job opportunities that will help her make headway for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetic supplies to increase her inventory

loans.name: Maria Licet

texts.es: La señora Maria Licet tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera y posee 2. La señora Maria  se dedica a la venta de ropa. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 4 años. Anteriormente se dedicaba a ofrecer los servicios de domestica, por lo que sus ingresos eran muy pocos y necesita mucho más para sufragar los gastos. Su crédito será invertido en la compra principalmente de ropa ya que en este momento aprovecha a comprar porque se acerca la temporada navideña y todos estos productos suben de precio. Su sueño es llegar a instalar una distribuidora en el municipio en donde vive, ya que actualmente no hay ninguna.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Licet is 44 years old and a single mother of 2 children. She has been selling clothing for 4 years. Previously she offered housekeeping services, but her earnings were not enough to cover her expenses. Her loan will be used to purchase clothing for the holiday season before prices increase. Maria dreams of opening a distribution center where she lives since none exists at the moment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase merchandise for the holiday season

loans.name: Little Stars Group

texts.es: Es un grupo muy responsables en sus pagos, viven  en una zona muy alejada de la ciudad, se conocen bien, no cuentan con servicios basicos como ser alcantarillado, agua potable, etc. Su grupo se llama "ESTRELLITAS", donde, el Banco de Emprendimiento esta en su 3º Ciclo, la  mesa directiva esta conformada la siguiente manera,  como presidenta esta  la señora Margarita ,ella es muy responsable y lider de su grupo, tiene 2 hijos es casada ella elabora masitas y su esposo es chofer. Como tesorera esta la socia Ruth  quien es muy responsable y conocedora del manejo del efectivo tiene 2 hijos es casada, es confeccionista de ropa el credito lo utiliza para  aumento de capital. Como secretario esta el socio Ronal es soltero no tiene hijos,trabaja importando novedades de la frontera con el Peru, el credito lo utiliza para capital.
texts.en:
The Little Stars Group is a Communal Bank that is starting its third loan cycle. The members are very responsible with their payments. They live in an area that is far from the city and know each other well. They do not have many needs other than the basic necessities such as sewage services, clean drinking water, etc.

The group leaders are as follows:

Sra. Margarita is the group president and a very responsible leader. She is married and has two children. She makes pastries, while her husband works as a chauffeur.

Sra. Ruth is the group treasurer and is very responsible and knowledgeable in handling cash. She is married and has two children. She is a seamstress and will use her loan to increase her business capital.

Sr. Ronal is the group secretary. He is single and has no children. He imports novelty products from Peru. His loan will be used as business capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Jimmi Alberto

texts.en:
Jimmi Alberto is a client of Asociación Arariwa, a Kiva partner. He is part of a communal bank consisting of 26 members in Cusco. The group is called El Amanecer, which means daybreak in Spanish. He is from Quillabamba and lives in Cusco. He is 30 years old and single.

Jimmi works as a dental assistant.  He has been studying to be a dentist and will finish in December.  After that, he will do one year of internship in a hospital, then a thesis, then he can practice.  He may consider studying more in Spain so he can work abroad but it depends on his economic situation.  He will use this loan to pay for his school fees and materials. The fees are $200 every month.

Jimmi Alberto appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To pay his school fees and materials

loans.name: Virgen De Concepcion Group

texts.es: "Virgen de Concepción" es el nombre elegido por un grupo de catorce miembros, que han dedicado gran parte de su vida al comercio de todo tipo de mercadería, por ejemplo Francisca G. junto a su esposo, se dedica a la compra de conos de plástico (reciclaje de conos para hilos y cuerdas), luego de obtener estos en cantidad los revende a fabricas de hilos, Sus compañeras tienen otras actividades como ser: venta de telas, confección de chalecos y chamarras, venta de abarrotes, venta de condimentos y otros. Afirman que necesitan comprar mercadería, de este modo obtener mejores  recursos para el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
"Virgen de Concepción" ("Immaculate Conception") is the name for this group of 14 members who have dedicated a large part of their lives to selling all kinds of merchandise. For example, Francisca G. makes a living, along with her husband, buying plastic cones used to package threads and strings, and then when they have enough, they resell it to the factories to recycle. Her fellow members have other activities such as, selling fabrics, making vests and jackets, selling groceries and selling condiments and other items. The members attest they need to purchase merchandise, and in this way they will obtain more resources for their family's well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a client of Asociación Arariwa, a Kiva partner. She is part of a communal bank consisting of 26 members in Cusco. The group is called El Amanecer, which means daybreak in Spanish. She is from Sicuani and lives in Cusco.  She is 31 years old and single.

Martha has worked as an early-education teacher for the past six years. There are 20 children in her class who speak a Peruvian language called Quechua. The school is in Quispicanchis.  She studied for five years to be a teacher and is getting her masters in education currently, for which she will pay 3,000 soles in total. She will use this loan to pay off her student loan of 650 soles.

Martha appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To pay off her student loans

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.en:
Maria Soledad is a client of Asociación Arariwa, a Kiva partner. She is part of a communal bank consisting of 26 members in Cusco. The group is called El Amanecer, which means daybreak in Spanish. She is from and lives in Cusco. She is 35 years old and lives with her partner and two children, who are in primary school.

Maria Soledad has worked as a printer and graphic designer for the past nine years. She works for a company and freelances as well. She creates materials for NGOs and has, in fact, done some work for Arariwa. She can make from 1,000 - 1,500 soles per job. She will use this loan to buy more materials for her printing business such as paper, ink, etc., from wholesalers.

Maria Soledad appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy materials for her printing and graphic design business

loans.name: Eleutorio

texts.en:
Eleutorio is a client of Asociación Arariwa.  He is part of a communal bank consisting of 26 members in Cusco.  The group is called El Amanecer, which means "daybreak" in Spanish. Eleutorio is from Cusco, where he still resides.  He is 38 years old, and lives with his partner and 2 children.

Eleutorio has a store where he sells pants. He buys each pair for 20-28 soles and sells them for 30-38 soles.  He earns about 600 soles each month.  He will use this loan to buy more pants from wholesalers to sell.

Eleutorio appreciates and thanks you for the loan, and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more pants to sell

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Our client is Gabriela. She is part of a communal bank consisting of 26 members in Cusco. The group is called El Amanecer, which means "daybreak" in Spanish.  She is from Siquani, and lives in Cusco. She is 28 years old and is single.

She has been an early education teacher for the past 3 years, and was a teacher’s assistant for 5 years before that.  She also has a side business selling educational wall adornments for classrooms and children’s rooms. Since Christmas is coming up, she is also selling Christmas decorations. With this loan, she will buy more wall adornments and decorative items to sell.

Gabriela appreciates and thanks you for the loan, and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more educational wall adornments and Christmas decorations to sell

loans.name: The Project Group

texts.es:
Alexandra Yuliza L. P., María Auxiliadora L. G. y Margarita Elizabeth M. Rodríguez formaron el Grupo el Proyectos, porque eso eran sus negocios proyectos de vida.

La joven L. P. de 28 años tiene una Fritanga que es un tipo de restaurante popular en la que se vende cosas fritas como carne asada, enchiladas tajadas con queso…etc. María Auxiliadora L. G. desde hace diez años tiene una pulpería y Margarita Elizabeth M. Rodríguez hace ocho años empezó a vender cerdo.
texts.en:
Alexandra Yuliza L. P., María Auxiliadora L. G. and Margarita Elizabeth M. Rodríguez are the members of the Project Group. They are aptly named because their businesses are their “life projects”.

Alexandra is 28 years old and manages a snack bar where she sell items such as roasted meats, enchiladas, fried plantains with cheese, etc. María has been operating a grocery store for 10 years. Margarita sells pork and has been in business for 8 years.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies for their respective businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Building a room

loans.name: Renee

texts.en:
Renee splits her time between selling meals to students at Andina University and buying animals to sell on Saturdays at the market in Urubamba. At the university, she earns about 35 – 40 nuevo sol a day. Every Saturday, she earns 100 -120 nuevo sol. She will also make chicha, a Peruvian drink, for Christmas time. She will use this loan to buy more ingredients for her student meals and more animals to sell.

Renee is 47 years old and is married with six children: four of them are working and two of them are studying. She is a client of Asociación Arariwa and part of a communal bank consisting of 26 members from Cusco. The group is called "El Amanecer", which means "Daybreak" in Spanish. She is from Quillabamba and lives in Cusco.

Renee appreciates, and thanks you for, the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals and animals to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Migdonio

texts.en:
Migdonio is a policeman in Quispancanchis. He and his wife plan to start a side business renting cars. He will use this loan to buy and fix up a vehicle to rent for 150 nuevo sol per day.

Migdonio is 41 years old and is married with three children – 11, 5 and a 1-year-old baby. He is a client of Asociación Arariwa and part of a communal bank consisting of 26 members in Cusco. The group is called "El Amanecer", which means "Daybreak" in Spanish. He is from Convención and lives in Cusco.

Migdonio appreciates, and thanks you for, the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy and renovate a vehicle to rent

loans.name: Mayka

texts.en:
Mayka is a medical technician in Cusco. She and her husband plan to start a side business renting cars. She will use this loan to buy and fix up a vehicle to rent for 150 nuevo sol per day.

Mayka is 33 years old and is married with three children – 11, 5 and a 1-year-old baby. She is a client of Asociación Arariwa and part of a communal bank consisting of 26 members in Cusco. The group is called "El Amanecer", which means "Daybreak" in Spanish. She is from Cusco and lives in Cusco.

Mayka appreciates, and thanks you for, the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy and fix up a vehicle to rent

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha works at a car wash in San Sebastian, where it costs 2.50 soles for small cars, 4 soles for bigger cars and 8 soles for trucks for a wash. She washes 30 – 35 per day. She will use this loan to buy things for her house like a wardrobe, which may cost close to 300 soles.

Martha is 34 years old and lives with her partner and two children – one is in third grade and the other is in 8th grade. She is a client of Asociación Arariwa and part of a communal bank consisting of 26 members in Cusco. The group is called "El Amanecer", which means "Daybreak" in Spanish. She is from Cusco and lives in Cusco.

Martha appreciates, and thanks you for, the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy a wardrobe for her house

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.en:
Abelardo is a taxi driver. He earns about 50 – 60 soles each day. He owns his own car and will use this loan to repair his vehicle.

Abelardo is 38 years old and lives with his partner and two children. He is a client of Asociación Arariwa and part of a communal bank consisting of 26 members in Cusco. The group is called "El Amanecer", which means "Daybreak" in Spanish. He is from Cusco and lives in Cusco.

Abelardo appreciates, and thanks you for, the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To maintain and repair his car

loans.name: Fe En Dios Group

texts.en:
Our group is called Fe en Dios, which means Faith in God.  The group consists of 13 members who are natives of Cusco and surrounding areas.

Some of the members are married, some have children and others are single.

The members are engaged in various businesses – manager of a market, teacher of administration, selling baby clothes, selling photo postcards to tourists, and other commercial activities.

With this loan, they will buy more clothing and more postcards to sell, pay the monthly school expenses for their children, and other commercial activities.

For some, this is their first loan, while others have received loans in the past.

All of the members are grateful for the loans, especially since some have had problems obtaining capital in the past.  They all promise to make the monthly payments on time.

(Esmeralda is not pictured in the photo)

loans.use: business capital

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth T. is from Pagadian City. She is 37 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Lilibeth owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Lilibeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Lilibeth is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen D. is from Pagadian City. She is 37 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Helen owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Helen is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena C. is from Pagadian City. She is 56 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Elena owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Elena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Elena is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

Evelyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell
