Teresita owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Teresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.en: Raymunda A. is from Pagadian City. She is 59 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Raymunda owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Raymunda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Sima

texts.en:
Mrs. Sima K. is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Sainbu-Bhaishipati. Sainbu-Bhaishipati is located in the district of Lalitpur where most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming. Mrs. Sima lives with her husband and two children. Her husband, Mr. Madan K., works in a private office. She has one son and one daughter. Her son works in a pharmacy, and her daughter is studying in grade 10.

Mrs. Sima is engaged in agricultural farming. She grows green vegetables and seasonal vegetables on her land. She sells her vegetables in a local market in the morning and evening. Now she is applying for a loan of 15000 NPR to buy fertilizers and seeds for her agricultural work.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma H. is a small business entrepreneur and married woman. She runs a business of transporting and selling timber at Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases timber from different regions in Tanzania and transports it to Dar es Salaam. She purchases the timber wholesale and sells it wholesale and retail to her customers. The business income has enabled her to meet daily family demands and business capitalization. She is requesting a loan of 800,000 TZS to capitalize the business.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Subdra

texts.en:
Mrs. Subdra K. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Sainbu-Bhaishipati. She opened her shop to raise the living standard of her family. She sells different types of grocery goods such as rice, maize, and bitten rice. Her husband and daughters also help in her work. She is requesting a loan of 25000 NPR to buy more grocery goods for her shop.

Mrs. Subdra K. lives in a single family home with her husband and two daughters. Her husband, Mr. Ram Kumar K., works in a private office. Her older daughter is studying in grade 9, and her younger daughter is studying in grade 6. Mrs. Subdra K. uses her income to provide a better education for her daughters.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma K. is a Tanzanian business entrepreneur and married woman. She runs a business of second-hand clothes for both women and men. She purchases the business goods wholesale and retail from the city market at Karume in Dar es Salaam, and she retails the items to her customers. The business income is used to meet her daily family demand and to capitalize the business. She has been running the business for five years. She needs a loan of 600,000 TZS to buy more business goods to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more business goods to meet the demand of her customers

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Mrs. Sani K. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishipati, Lalitpur. Sainbu-Bhaishipati is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur, and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming. Mrs. Sani K. lives with her husband and two children. Her husband, Mr. Utsak K., is a farmer. She has one son and one daughter. Her son took the School Leaving Certificate Exam this year, and her daughter is studying in primary school.

Mrs. Sani is engaged in selling cow’s milk. She already owns two cows, and she sells their milk in her locality. Currently, in her region, the demand for cow’s milk is increasing constantly. To meet the demand of her customers, she needs another young milk-giving cow, and she is requesting a loan of 20000 NPR to buy one.

loans.use: To purchase another young milk-giving cow

loans.name: Nani Maiya

texts.en: Nani Maiya B. is a resident of Sainbu-Bhaishipati, Lalitpur. Sainbu-Bhaishipati is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur, and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming. Both Mr. and Mrs. B. are engaged in a poultry farm and in agricultural farming. They opened their poultry farm two years ago. They buy small chickens and food grains for chickens from the dealers. They are successfully running their poultry farm, and they earn a good profit in their business. They seek a loan of 25000 NPR to buy small chickens to expand their business. They fulfill all the needs of a family with the income of poultry farming.

loans.use: To buy small chickens to expand a poultry farm

loans.name: Bhawani

texts.en:
Mrs. Bhawani T. is a 27-year-old married woman with a daughter and son. They live in Sainbu-Bhaishipati, Lalitpur. Her son is studying in grade 12, and her daughter is studying in grade 9.

Both Mrs. T. and her husband, Mr. Dharma Bahadur T., started selling milk five years ago. They already own a cow and are selling cow's milk in their neighborhood. Since they live in a growing neighborhood, they believe that there will be an increase in demand for milk. Mrs. T. is requesting a loan of 10000 NPR to buy a young cow in order to sell more milk in her neighborhood.

loans.use: To buy a young cow

loans.name: Lazati

texts.en: Lazati K. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and married woman with three children—one in kindergarten, one in primary school, and one in secondary school. She runs a clothing store at Yombo Makangarawe ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases wholesale and retail business goods from the city market at Kariakoo and Karume. She meets her daily family demand from her business income. She has been in the business for four years, and she has managed to build a residential house. She is requesting a loan of 600,000 TZS to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods to capitalize the business

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Mrs. Parbati L. is a milk seller in the village of Sainbu-Bhaishipati. She already owns two cows, and she is selling cow's milk door-to-door in the morning and evening. Mrs. Parbati lives in a growing neighborhood. In that area, the demand for cow's milk is increasing daily, because fresh cow's milk is very good for human health. She is requesting a loan of 15000 NPR to buy a young milk-giving cow to meet the increasing demand for cow's milk.

Mrs. Parbati lives with her husband and two children. Her husband, Mr. Auchut, is a house painter. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 7, and her daughter is studying in grade 5.

loans.use: To buy a young milk-giving cow

loans.name: Susmita

texts.en:
Mrs. Susmita L. lives in the village of Dolchoki. Dolchoki is one of the least developed villages of Lalitpur. Dolchoki is located in a hilly region. Almost all the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

Mrs. Susmita L. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Dolchoki. She sells different types of grocery goods such as rice, maize and snacks. She opened her grocery store to raise the living standard of her family. She is requesting a loan of 10000 NPR to buy different types of grocery goods for her shop.

loans.use: To buy different types of grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sabita M. lives in the village of Dolchoki. Dolchoki is one of the least developed villages of Lalitpur. Dolchoki is located in a hilly region. Almost all the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

Mrs. M. is engaged in goat farming. She sells goats to dealers. She started goat farming work more than five years ago. She is satisfied with her income. She is requesting a loan of 5000 NPR to buy baby goats for her business. She started this business to become independent and to help her husband in fulfilling household expenses.

loans.use: To buy baby goats

loans.name: Jumanne

texts.en: Jumanne S. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and married man. He runs a business of selling coconuts at Kariakoo city market. He purchases the business goods direct from the producers in wholesale, and he sells them to retail customers. He has five children; four are in primary school, and one is in secondary school. He lives in a rented house. The business income meets the daily family demand and also meets the children's school fees. He needs a loan of 600,000 TZS to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods to meet customer demand

loans.name: Asmita

texts.en:
Mrs. Asmita L. lives in the village of Dolchoki. Dolchoki is one of the least developed villages of Lalitpur. Dolchoki is located in a hilly region. Almost all the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

Mrs. Asmita L. has six members in her family including herself. She lives in a joint family home with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, husband, and two children. She has one son and one daughter. Both children are studying in primary school.

Both Mrs. L. and her husband, Mr. Durga Raj, are engaged in agricultural farming. They grow seasonal vegetables on their land. Due to the hilly region, they face lots of problems in their agricultural farming. Mrs. L. is requesting, for the first time, a loan of 10000 NPR to buy fertilizer and seeds for their agricultural farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Sun Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Sun Maiya T. lives in the village of Dolchoki. Dolchoki is located in a hilly region and is one of the least developed villages of lalitpur. This makes the lives of the people living there difficult. Almost all people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

There are six members in her family, including herself. She lives in a joint family with her father-in-law, husband and three daughters. Both Mrs. T. and her husband Mr. Hat Raj T. are engaged in agricultural farming. They grow seasonal vegetables on their land. As the region is hilly, they face lots of problem in agricultural farming. Now Mrs. T. is requesting her first term loan of Rs10,000 to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema S. is a married Tanzanian entrepreneur. She runs a grocery business at Lumo Ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells a variety of drinks including coca cola, juice and drinking water. She also sells food stuffs to her customers. She has five children: one is in kindergarten, three are in primary school and one is in secondary school. She manages to pay the school fees from her business income. She is requesting a loan of TZS 600,000 to boost up the business by buying more goods to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: Expand the business by buying more goods

loans.name: Sushila

texts.en:
Mrs. Sushila T. lives in the village of Dolchoki, which is one of the least developed villages of Lalitpur. Dolchoki is located in a hilly region, thus making lives of people living there difficult. Almost all people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

There are eight members in Sushila's family, including herself. She lives in a joint family with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, husband and four children. She has one son and three daughters. All of her children are studying in a government school.

Both Mrs. T. and her husband Mr. Budd Raj T. are engaged in agricultural farming. They grow seasonal vegetables on their land. As the region is hilly, they face lots of problem in agricultural farming. Now Mrs. T. is requesting her first term loan of Rs 10,000 to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sangita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sangita T. lives in the village of Dolchoki, which is one of the least developed villages of Lalitpur. Dolchoki is located in a hilly region, which makes the lives of the people living there difficult. Almost all people living in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

There are six members in Sangita's family, including herself. She lives in a joint family with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, husband and two sons. 
Both Mrs. T. and her husband Mr. Minu Raj T. are engaged in agricultural farming. They grow seasonal vegetables on their land. As the region is hilly, they face lots of problem in agricultural farming. Now, Mrs. T. is requesting her first term loan of Rs10,000 to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Bishnu

texts.en:
Mrs. Bishnu L. lives in the village of Dolchoki, which is one of the least developed villages of Lalitpur. Dolchoki is located in a hilly region, making the lives of the people living there difficult. Almost all people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

There are six members in Bishnu's family, including herself. She lives in a nuclear family with her husband and four children. She has one son and three daughters. All of her children are studying in primary school.

Both Mrs. L. and her husband Mr. Raj Kumar L. are engaged in agricultural farming. They grow seasonal vegetables on their land. Because the region is hilly, they face many problems in farming. Now Mrs. L. is requesting her first term loan of Rs 10,000 to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Ful Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Ful Maiya S. lives in the village of Dolchoki. Dolchoki is one of the least developed villages of Lalitpur. Dolchoki is located in a hilly region so the lives in this region are miserable. Almost all the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

Mrs. Ful Maiya S. has 7 people, including herself, in her family. She lives in a single family with her husband and five children. She has one son and four daughters. Her son is studying in grade 11 and her daughters are studying in grades 10, 9 ,8 and 5 respectively.

Both Mrs. S. and her husband Mr. Dhan Bahadur S. are engaged in agricultural farming. They grow seasonal vegetables on their land. Due to the hilly region they face lots of problem in their agricultural farming. Now Mrs. S. is requesting her first term loan of Rs 10,000.00 to buy fertilizers and seeds for their agricultural farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Seti Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Seti Maiya B. lives in the village of Dolchoki. Dolchoki is one of the least developed villages of Lalitpur. Dolchoki is located in a hilly region so the lives in this region are miserable. Almost all the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

Mrs. Seti Maiya B. has 6 people, including herself, in her family. She lives with her husband and four children. She has one son and three daughters. Her son is studying in grade 4 and her daughters are studying in grades 9, 7 and 5 respectively.

Both Mrs. B. and her husband are engaged in agricultural farming. They grow seasonal vegetables on their land. Due to the hilly region, they face lots of problem in their agricultural farming. Now Mrs. B. is requesting her first term loan of Rs 10,000.00 to buy fertilizers and seeds for their agricultural farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Thuli Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuli Maiya L. lives in the village of Dolchoki. Dolchoki is one of the least developed villages of Lalitpur. Dolchoki is located in a hilly region so the lives in this region are miserable. Almost all the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

Mrs. Thuli Maiya L. has 6 people, including herself, in her family. She lives with her husband and four children. She has three sons and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 12 and her sons are studying in grades 10, 7 and 6 respectively.

Both Mrs. L. and her husband Mr. DalBir L. are engaged in agricultural farming. They grow seasonal vegetables on their land. Due to the hilly region they face lots of problems in their agricultural farming. Now Mrs. L. is requesting her first term loan of Rs 10,000.00 to buy fertilizers and seeds for their agricultural farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Minu Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Minu Maiya M. lives in the village of Dolchoki which is one of the least developed villages of Lalitpur. Dolchoki is located in a hilly region so the lives in this region are miserable. Almost all the people in this region are engaged in farming.

Mrs. M. has six members, including herself, in her family: she lives with her father-in-law, husband and three children. She has two sons and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 3 and her sons are in pre-primary school.

Both Mrs. M. and her husband, Mr. Sundar M., are engaged in farming, growing seasonal vegetables on their land. Due to it being a hilly region, they face lots of problem with their farm.

Now Mrs. M. is requesting her first loan of Rs 5000 to buy fertilizer and seeds for their farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Bindu Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Bindu Maiya B. lives in the village of Dolchoki. Dolchoki is one of the least developed villages of Lalitpur. Dolchoki is located in a hilly region. Almost all the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

Mrs. Bindu Maiya B. has four members in her family including herself. She lives in a single family home with her husband and two sons. Her older son is studying in grade 10, and her younger son is studying in grade 9.

Both Mrs. B. and her husband, Mr. Aum Bahadur B., are engaged in agricultural farming. They grow seasonal vegetables on their land. Due to the hilly region, they face lots of problems in their agricultural farming. Mrs. B. is requesting, for the first time, a loan of 10000 NPR to buy fertilizer and seeds for their agricultural farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Plaster and flooring for house

loans.name: Cajina Group

texts.es:
Blanca Azucena A. Casjina, Sofía Amplié C. y María Lidia M. Dávila conforman al grupo C.. La señora A. de 52 años vende productos esquimo, ella comenzó porque un día le toco vender en la iglesia como sobraron los llevo a su casa y observo que había una gran clientela actualmente vende diario en su casa y los fines de semana en el templo.

Eskimo un empresa nicaragüense que elabora productos lácteos diversos, tales como helados, sorbetes, leche y sus derivados. Es la mayor compañía heladera fundada en 1942 y que tiene presencia en todo el país.

Sofía Inés Amplié C. comenzó vendiendo helado y comida a empresas aledañas a su casa pero como serraron puso una panadería en las que hace donas y reposterías. María Lidia Dávila vende chocodananos, helados, tajadas con queso, enchiladas y los fines de semana vende en la iglesia.
texts.en:
Blanca Azucena A. Casjina, Sofía Amplié C., and María Lidia M. Dávila comprise the C. Group. A., 52, sells Eskimo (dairy) products. She started because one day it was her turn to sell at church. She took what was left over to her house, and she saw that there were a lot of customers. She currently sells daily from her house and in the church on the week ends. Eskimo is a Nicaraguan company that makes diverse dairy products like ice cream, sorbet, milk, and its derivatives. It was founded in 1942, and it is the largest ice cream company that has a presence in the entire country. Sofía Inés Amplié C. started selling ice cream and food to businesses near her house. They closed, so she set up a bakery. She makes doughnuts and pastries. Lidia Dávila sells chocolate bananas, ice cream, cheese slices, and enchiladas on the week ends. She sells at the church.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Eskimo products

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: Don Agustin  es casado, trabaja como guarda de seguridad desde hace 8 años, tiene 2 hijos: la mayor tiene 14 años de edad estudia su 4to año de educaciòn secundaria, el otro niño tiene  12 años de edad estudia  su 5to grado de educaciòn primaria, esta solicitando su 2do credito a AFODENIC para inventirlo en construcciòn de  una habitación para asi tener mas comodidad en el hogar, su esposa labora como conserje del Hospital Jacinto Hernàndez, y le ayuda a su marido con los gastos del hogar y los compromisos adquiridos con AFODENIC, a pesar que son una familia de escasos recursos económicos se caracterizan por ser muy responsables y humildes,  su sueño es tener salud, trabajo y una vivienda bonita.
texts.en:
Agustin is married. He has worked as a security guard for eight years. He has two children. The oldest is 14 and is in her fourth year of secondary education. The other is 12 and is in the fifth grade of elementary school. He is asking Afodenic for his second loan to build a room to make his home more comfortable. His wife works as a custodian at the Jacinto Hernández Hospital. She helps her husband with the household expenses and with the commitments with Afondenic. In spite of being a family with scant economic resources, they are characterized as being very responsible and humble. His dream is to have health, work, and a nice home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina es soltera, vive en la zona # 7 de Nueva Guinea junto a sus padres, esta solicitando su 2do crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para comprar zinc y cambiar el que tiene en mal estado y asi mejorar las condiciones del hogar, pues a pesar que no tiene hijos pero se encarga del cuido de sus ancianitos padres,   esta joven se ha caracterizado por ser una docente  muy responsable, honesto a demostrado  buena conducta y moral crediticia,   tiene una familia muy humilde que ha luchado para seguir  adelante, actualmente  esta en el ultimo año de magisterio,   Cristina  aspira tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, tener estabilidad laboral, seguir estudiando y que sus padres cuenten siempre con buena salud.
texts.en:
Cristina is single. She lives with her parents in Zone #7 in New Guinea. She is asking for her second loan from the Afodenic institution to buy zinc and change the roof, which is in very bad shape. That way she will improve the home’s condition. She does not have children, but she is in charge of the care of her elderly parents. This young woman has been characterized as being a teacher who is very responsible and honest. She has demonstrated good and honest behavior with her loan. She has a very humble family that has fought to get ahead. She is currently in her the last year of teacher training. Cristina’s wishes are to have a home that is in better condition, to have work stability, to keep studying, and that her parents are always in good health.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy zinc

loans.name: Eylin

texts.es: Eylin es casada, trabaja en la Fundaciòn Josè Nieborowski desde hace 6 años como contadora, tiene dos hijas la mayor tiene 13 años estudia su 6to de educaciòn primaria y la menor de 10 años de edad estudia su 5to grado de educaciòn primaria, su esposo trabaja como analista de crèdito de un banco y asume los gastos familiares, viven en la zona # 6 de Nueva Guinea, esta solicitando su 3er crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para repellar la habitación  en su casa  para tener condicones en el hogar.  Eylin se ha caracterizado por ser una profesional muy responsable, honesta a demostrado capacidad y voluntad de pago,  esta familia profesa la iglesia catòlica son muy unidos,  esta clienta con el crédito anterior logro satisfactoriamente construir una habitación para una mejor comodidad, ella aspira aspira tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, tener estabilidad laboral, que sus hijas estudien y salud.
texts.en:
Eylin is married and has worked for the Fundación José Nieborowski as an accountant for the past 6 years. She has two daughters; the eldest is 13 years old and is in the 6th grade and the youngest is 10 years old and is in the 5th grade. Her husband is a credit analyst at a bank and takes care of the family expenses. They live in Zone #6 of Nueva Guinea and she is requesting her third loan from AFODENIC to plaster the room in her house to improve her living conditions. Eylin is noted as a very responsible, professional person; she's honest and has demonstrated capacity and will to repay her loans in a timely fashion. This is a very close, Catholic family. With her previous loan, she managed to successfully build a room for more comfort. She aims to have a home with better living conditions, to have stable employment, and that her daughters study and are healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plaster a room.

loans.name: Isabel Damaris

texts.es: Isabel Damaris es casada, tiene 2 niños la mayor tiene 9 añitos de edad estudia su tercer grado de educaciòn primaria y el niño menor de 7 añitos de edad estudia su primer grado en el colegio catòlico, trabaja como docente en el colegio catolico de nueva guinea, esta solicitando su primer crèdito para construir una habitaciòn y asi mejorar sus condiciones de vida de su familia,  se caracteriza por ser una mujer luchadora,  pues  a pesar que el salario que devenga es muy bajo desea brindar las condiciones necesarias a su familia,  Isabel junto con su marido han luchado para que a sus hijos no les falte nada y construir su propia casa,   es una docente muy responsable con sus deberes y es muy querida por sus alumnos y padres de familia , su sueño es terminar de estudiar la licenciatura en ciencias de Educacion, estabilidad laboral y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Isabel Damaris is married and has two children, a nine-year-old, who is in third grade, and a seven-year-old, who is a first-grader in the Catholic school. She works as a teacher's aide at the Catholic Nueva Guinea school. She is requesting her first loan to add a room to her house thereby improving her family's living conditions. She is a hard-working woman who, despite the low salary she earns, wishes to provide the best for her family. Isabel, together with her husband, have struggled to insure that their children lack nothing and to build their own house. She is a very responsible teacher's aide and held in high regard by her students and their parents. Her dream is to finish her studies in Education Sciences (to become a licensed teacher), to have stable employment and help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: María Ofelia

texts.es:
La señora Ofelia María S. quiere empezar la construcción para su vivienda ya que vive porque sus hijos ya tienen su propia familia  y desea tener su propia casa.
Solicita el préstamo, porque en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para empezar la construcción de su casa  y así ella dejara de pagar renta ya que es muy alto el costo que esta pagando. 
Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos de su trabaja como enfermera de una persona ya mayor de edad.
texts.en:
Ofelia María S. wants to start building her house. Her children have their own families. She wishes to have her own house. She is asking for the loan because she does not have the money that is necessary to start construction on her house. When she has her own house she will stop paying rent, which is very high. She plans to repay the loan with her income from working as a nurse for an elderly person.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To start building her house

loans.name: Carmen Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Patricia U. tiene ya más de cinco años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada. 
Al negocio le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía y ella desea vender artículos de navidad, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para ser la inversión y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia. 
Con una parte de las  ganancias del negocio pagar el crédito. Y así sus dos hijos no les faltaran nada.
texts.en:
Carmen Patricia U. has sold second-hand clothing for the past five years. She needs a greater variety of merchandise and she wants to sell Christmas items but lacks the funds to buy them and doesn't want to decapitalize her business because this is her family's source of income. She intends to use part of her business' profits to repay the loan so that her two children won't lack anything.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Doña Maribel  trabaja como técnica del Ministerio de Educaciòn de  Nueva Guinea desde hace 3 años, tiene una hija mayor de edad  a pesar que no vive con ella siempre esta pendiente en lo que necesite, esta solicitando su 2do crédito a AFODENIC para inventirlo  en compra de zinc pues el que tiene se encuentra en mal estado y con las lluvias se le mojan algunas cosas de su casa,   Maribel  es muy querida en su centro de trabajo por ser una persona de buen vivir, responsable, trabajadora y  sociable en su comunidad, su sueño es mejorar sus condiciones de vida , salud y que su familia siempre permanezca unida y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Maribel has worked as a technician for the Nueva Guinea Ministry of Education for the past 3 years. She has an adult daughter and, even though she no longer lives with her, Maribel always keeps an eye on her and sees to her needs. She is asking for her second loan from AFODENIC to buy zinc (roofing material) because her current roof is in bad shape and when it rains some of her belongings in her house get wet. Maribel is very well-liked at work because she is well-mannered, responsible, hard-working, and sociable in her community. Her dream is to improve her living conditions, to have good health, and that her family always remains united and continue studying.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the zinc roof.

loans.name: Isaias Antonio

texts.pt:
Isaías António S., natural de Maputo, tem 34 anos de idade, casado e pai de 04 filhos de 10, 07 e 04 anos de idade, os dois primeiros vão a escola, estudou ate 7ªclasse, parou de estudar devido a guerra de desestabilização. Vive na casa própria em Boane e não sustenta mais ninguém para alem dos filhos.

Com necessidade de ter casa própria saiu da cidade de Maputo em 1999 com a sua esposa para o distrito de Boane onde adquiriu um terreno e se instalou e reside ate hoje.

É fotografo profissional desde 2000, faz em media 11horas por dia e não tem empregado, aprendeu a fazer o trabalho com o irmão, o seu rendimento mensal varia de 5.000,00mt a 6.000,00mt com o qual sustenta a família e consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária para investir na sua obra e no melhoramento de vida da sua família.

Já trabalhou com outra instituição de Credito (micro banco TCHUMA) e este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku o primeiro foi de 9.000,00mt também destinado para compra de material de construção. Conheceu a Hluvuku graças a um amigo que também e cliente da instituição, com o empréstimo de 20.000,00mt pretende comprar areia, varões de ferro, cimento e outros.

No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para a conclusão da sua obra, assim compromete se a pagar este crédito de sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos.
texts.en:
Isaías António S., a native of Maputo, is 34 years old. He is married and has 4 children ages 10, 7, and 4. The older children attend school. He attended school until 7th grade but stopped due to the Civil War. He lives in a home he owns in Boane, and does not support anyone other than his children. Due to the need to own their own home, he left Maputo in 1999 with his wife and moved to Boane. He purchased land there and moved, and still lives there today. Isaías has been a professional photographer since 2000. He works around 11 hours per day and does not have employees. He learned to take photos with his brother, and earns between 5.000,00MT and 6.000,00MT per month. With his income he supports his family and saves a bit in his bank account, to invest in his construction project and in improving his family's life. In the past he worked with another lender (micro bank TCHUMA). This is his second loan with Hluvuku. The first was for 9.000,00MT, also for the purchase of construction materials. He learned about Hluvuku thanks to a friend who also is client of the bank. With this loan for 20.000,00MT, he plans to purchase sand, iron bars, cement, etc. In the future he would like to take out more loans to finish his home. He is committed to paying off this loan without problems so that he can have access to future loans.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, coarse sand, etc. )

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
Armando F. nasceu em Massinga na província de Inhambane a sul de Moçambique, tem 48 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos de 15 e 17 anos de idade. Fez 4ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras, vive na casa própria em Boane e para alem dos filhos sustenta também a mãe e seus irmãos enviando dinheiro mensalmente.

Saiu de Massinga para Maputo quando tinha 33 anos de idade transferido pelos serviços para trabalhar em Boane onde se encontra a residir com a sua família.
Trabalhou como tractorista na Empresa Estatal em Boane e em 2005 decidiu trabalhar por conta própria e mais tarde adquiriu um camião com o qual presta serviços de carregamento de areia, cimento pedra e outros bens. Faz 08 horas diárias e não tem empregado apenas contracta algumas pessoas em cada carregamento. O seu rendimento mensal varia de 14.000,00mt a 16.000,00mt com o qual sustenta a família e poupa algum para investir na manutenção da viatura e na sua obra.

Este e o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e nunca tinha trabalhado com nenhuma outra instituição financeira. Conheceu a Hluvuku através do seu primo que também e cliente da instituição tendo aproximado e solicita o presente empréstimo no valor de 20.000,00mt para compra de material de construção (cimento, ferros, chapas de zinco e blocos) com intuito de dar continuidade a sua obra. 
Compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo sem para poder aceder a outros financiamentos para construir uma mercearia e ferragem e iniciar com actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Armando F. was born in Massinga in the province of Inhambane in the south of Mozambique. He is 48 years old, married, and has 2 children ages 15 and 17. He attended school until 4th grade, but dropped out due to a lack of financial resources. He lives in his own home in Boane, and besides his two children he also supports his mother and siblings, sending them money monthly. He left Massinga for Maputo when he was 33 years old due to a job transfer and moved to Boane, where he currently lives with his family. He worked as a tractor operator for the State in Boane, and in 2005 he decided to work for himself. He later acquired a truck that he uses to provide services hauling sand, cement block, and other goods. He works 8 hours a day and does not have any employees. He contracts people for each load. His monthly earnings vary between 14.000,00 MT and 16.000,00MT per month, which he uses to support his family, and to save for maintenance on his vehicle and his construction project. This is his first loan with Hluvuku and he has never worked with any other financial institution. He learned about Hluvuku through his cousin who is also a client of the bank. He is requesting a long for 20.000,00MT to purchase construction material (cement, iron, zinc panels, and blocks) to continue construction on his home. He is committed to paying back the loan without any problems so that he can have access to future loans to build a locale where he can open a hardware store.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, etc. )

loans.name: San Martin De Porres Group

texts.es:
SAN MARTIN DE PORRES

En este grupo participan ocho personas, los cuales a través de sus negocios han buscado la manera de de progresar con el fin de dar a su familia una mejor calida de vida, tal es el caso de:
Magali R. I. tiene 39 años de edad, actualmente ocupa el cargo de tesorera en la esta alcancía comunal “San Martín de Porres”. A pesar que su esposo es el que afronta con la mayor parte de los gastos familiares, Magali decidió vender menú hace tres años con la finalidad de apoyar a su esposo. Los platos de menús los ofrecía a los trabajadores de la municipalidad y UGEL, los ingresos de estas ventas fueron incrementando lo cual necesitó un mayor capital para la inversión de un saco de arroz, saco de azúcar y utensilios; es así que pronto participa de los créditos de EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD.
Utilizó las ganancias de su negocio en la preparación académica a su hijo mayor, quien hoy curso la carrera de diseño arquitectónico industrial en una universidad del estado, así mismo para sus materiales de estudio y pasajes. 
Magali hizo algunos trabajos de manualidades el año pasado para ello estudió en el CEO “San Juan Bautista”, tuvo que dejar de vender comida porque bajó las ventas.
Requiere del préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer muñequitos y adornos navideños: cintas decorativas, guirnaldas, adornos, cola de rata de vaR. colores, silicona, caritas de papa Noel y mama Noela, y napa que es el relleno para los muñequitos. Son muy lindos sus trabajos como se puede apreciar en la foto que trajo la atención a sus amistades y conocidos los cual le han hecho pedidos.
texts.en:
SAN MARTIN DE PORRES This group is made up of eight persons who, through their various business activities, have sought to progress in order to provide their families with a better quality of life. This is the case of: Magali R. I., 39, who is currently the treasurer of the “San Martín de Porres” communal bank. Although her husband is the main provider, Magali decided to prepare catered meals to help her husband. She offered her meals to city workers and to UGEL (local school). Profits from these meals grew and she needed to invest in supplies like a sack of rice, a sack of sugar and utensils. Thus, she began her participation in EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD's loan program. She used the profits from her business for her eldest son's educational expenses (materials and travel costs) since he is studying industrial/architectural design at a state university. Magali took some crafts workshops at CEO “San Juan Bautista” last year and created some items. She had to stop selling meals because sales declined. She requests this loan to buy supplies to make Christmas decorations and dolls. These supplies would include such things as: decorative ribbons, wreaths, decorations, "cola de rata" (rat's tail, a type of colored ribbon) in various colors, silicone, Santa and Mrs. Claus faces, and "napa" (stuffing for the dolls). Her work is very charming as can be seen by the photo and it attracts the attention of friends and family who have placed orders.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies to make Christmas dolls.

loans.name: Maura Elizabeth

texts.es: Maura es casada, trabaja como Responsable de Recursos Humanos del Ministerio de Educaciòn, esta solicitando su 2do crédito a AFODENIC, espera ser beneficiada por  segunda vez con el fondo Kiva, para continuar invirtiendo en la construcción de una habitación que necesita con urgencia,  pues de esta manera viviria mas comodamente, Maura expresa que los creditos con esta instituciòn son accesibles para las personas de escasos recursos econòmicos, es una joven trabajadora, honesta y muy apreciada en su comunidad y por los docente, su esposo trabaja como tecnico y asume los gastos familiares y le apoya con los compromisos adquiridos, el mayor sueño de esta familia es tener una vivienda digna y bonita, seguir estudiando para ser una profesional con mucha experiencia y ser cada dia una persona mejor tanto espiritual y profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Maura is married. She works as the Head of Human Resources at the Ministry of Education and is requesting for her second loan from AFODENIC. She hopes to be benefited by the Kiva fund for the second time in order to continue investing in the construction of a room that she urgently needs to live more comfortably. Maura says that the loans with this institution are accessible to people with limited economic resources. She is a young hard-worker, honest, and highly regarded in her community and by the staff. Her husband works as a technician. He assumes financial responsibility for household expenses and supports Maura with familial obligations. This family's biggest dreams are to have a dignified and comfortable home, to continue studying to be an experienced professional, and each day to be a better person both spiritually and professionally.

Translated from Spanish by Elycia Mulholland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: room construction

loans.name: Antonio Mandito

texts.pt:
António G., natural de Gôndola, província central de Manica, tem 42 anos de idade, casado e pai de 05 filhos de 14, 11, 09 e 04 anos de idade, os três primeiros vão a escola. Estudou ate 10ªclasse, parou de estudar quando ingressou no Serviço Militar Obrigatório. Vive na casa própria em Boane e não sustenta mais ninguém além dos filhos.

Em 1992 saiu de Manica em missão de serviço para o distrito da Manhiça, província de Maputo, dois anos depois juntou-se com a sua esposa. Fixou sua residência neste distrito.
É funcionário do Ministério da Defesa Nacional (militar), há 28 anos e faz 08 horas diárias, ingressou no Serviço Militar em Gôndola em 1981, o seu rendimento mensal e de 7.725,00mt com o qual sustenta a família e consegue poupar algum para investir na sua obra.

Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e nunca tinha trabalhado com nenhuma outra instituição financeira. Conheceu a Hluvuku através dos colegas do serviço que também são clientes da instituição tendo aproximado e solicita este seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 18.000,00mt para comprar cimento barrotes e outros para dar continuidade a sua obra. 
Compromete-se a pagar bem o empréstimo para poder aceder a outros financiamentos para iniciar uma actividade comercial
texts.en:
António G., a native of Gondola, in Manica, Mozambique, is 42 years old, married and the father of four children ages 14, 11, 9, and 4, all students. He finished 10th grade but had to drop school to join the army. He lives in his house with his family and supports all of them. He's been employed at the Ministry of National Defense for the past 28 years. He works 8 hours a day and makes 7.725,00MT (U$260) per month. With that money he supports his family and uses what's left to finish building his house. This is Antonio's first loan and he's asking for 18.000,00MT (U$650) to buy cement and other construction materials in order to finish his house. He hopes to pay this without a problem so he can get other loans in this future and start his own business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Supplies

loans.name: Rosa Amanda

texts.es: Rosa Amanda tiene 3 hijos: 2 ya son mayores de edad y una niña de 9 añitos que estudia su 5to grado de educaciòn primaria, ella trabaja en la colonia Rìo Plata a 6 km de Nueva Guinea como maestra de primaria, todos los dias tiene que madrugar para dejar hechos sus quehaceres  y luego salir a impartir el pan de la enseñanza a niños de esa colonia; esta solicitando su 7mo crédito a AFODENIC para inventirlo compra de materiales de construcciòn para mejorar la cocina ya que se encuentra en malas condiciones,  Rosa Amanda ha luchado para ir poco a poco mejorando su vivienda  su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda para tener mejor comodidad, trabajo, salud y llegar a ser una excelente profesional, actualmente esta estudiando una licenciatura en ciencias de la Educaciòn, pues de esta manera podra contribuir a una mejor enseñanza de la niñez Nicaraguense.
texts.en:
Rosa Amanda has three children: two who are adults and a 9-year-old daughter who is a fifth-grader. Rosa Amanda is an elementary school teacher in the Río Plata neighborhood which is 6km from Nueva Guinea. She has to rise very early every morning to complete her household chores and then leave to teach the children of that neighborhood. She is asking for her 7th AFODENIC loan to buy building materials to improve her kitchen, which is in very poor conditions. Rosa Amanda has striven to little-by-little improve her home and her dream is to finish building it for better comfort, work, and health and to become an excellent professional. She is currently studying Educational Sciences to become a licensed teacher so that she can contribute to the better education of Nicaragua's children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kitchen.

loans.name: Inacio Salvador

texts.pt:
Inácio B. nasceu em Nhagotou, distrito de Zavala, Província de Inhambane, tem 55 anos de idade, casado e pai de 7 filhos maiores de 18 anos, todos já trabalharem e não vivem nas suas casas. Fez 9ª classe, vive na casa própria, com sua esposa que é auxiliar administrativa e sustenta 2 netos.

Saiu de Zavala em 1970 para Maputo a procura de emprego, mais tarde transferiu a família. Trabalha como jardineiro contratado ha mais de 5 anos, das 7:00h as 15:00h, aufere um salário mensal de 2052.00MT. Deste valor consegue poupar algum no Banco comercial BARCLAYS no fim do mês.

Conheceu a Hluvuku através da senhora Ana Rabeca Muinga também cliente desta instituição. Nunca trabalhou com outras instituições de credito e este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00MT, com o qual pretende comprar cimento, pedra, areia e outros materiais para reabilitar sanitários, que sofreram a quando das explosões do paiol militar que victimou cerca de cem pessoas na cidade de maputo. 

Pretende ainda solicitar mais empréstimos com objectivo de recomeçar com a actividade criação de frangos de corte, actividade que vinha exercendo ha muito tempo.
texts.en:
Inácio B. is originally from Nhagotou, Zavala District, in Mozambique. He is 55 years old, married and the father of seven children, all adults who work and don't live with him anymore. He lives with his wife who works as an administrative assistant and they support two grandchildren. He's been working as a gardener for the past 5 years, from 7AM to 3PM every day, and makes 2052,00MT (U$70) per month. This is Inacio's first loan with the institution and he's asking for 15.000,00MT (U$525) in order to buy cement, sand and other materials to fix his house, that was damaged in a militar explosion that killed more than 100 people in the city of Maputo. He hopes to pay this fast so he can make other loans to start his own chicken raising business in the near future.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy flower seeds.

loans.name: Gilda Celeste

texts.pt:
Gilda M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, tem 39 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 1 filho de 20 anos de idade. Vive na casa própria com a família e 2 netos de 4 e 2 anos de idade. Fez 4ª classe e parou com os estudos quando perdeu seus pais cedo e não teve quem a pudesse sustentar.
	
Nunca saiu da Província, mudou se para o Bairro T3 em 1992 para se juntar ao seu marido. Ė negociante e Modista a mais de 10 anos, tem 2 auxiliares que ajudam nas vendas e trabalha cerca de 10 horas por dia. O produto que mais vende são lençóis que adquire a 1.800.00MT localmente e na Republica da África do Sul. Rende cerca de 3.500.00MT por mês e aplica nas despesas caseiras. O seu marido trabalha como técnico de saúde na organização, Médicos Del Mundi. Possui uma conta bancaria onde deposita suas poupanças no Banco de credito TCHUMA.
 
Já teve empréstimo numa associação cujo nome já não se lembra, e este é o seu 1º empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00MT com o qual pretende comprar fardos de roupa uni sexo (camisas, camisetes e lençóis).
Conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga vizinha que também é cliente desta instituição.
Com este empréstimo espera aumentar o seu rendimento para poder responder as necessidades primaria de casa e no futuro solicitar mais empréstimos, com o objectivo de construir um estabelecimento de vendas.
texts.en:
Gilda M. is from Maputo, Mozambique. She is 39 years old, married and the mother of a 20 year old. She lives in her own house with her son and and two grandchildren aged 4 and 2. She has a business selling clothes and other fabrics, activity that she's been performing for the past 10 years. She has two employees and works around 10 hours a day. Her best selling product are bed sheets that she buys in South Africa to resell in Maputo. She makes around 3.500,00MT (U$120) per month and uses the money to support her household. Her husband works at the Medicos Del Mundi organization as a health technician. This is Gilda's first loan and she's asking for 15.000,00MT (U$525) to buy clothes and sheets to resell.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes to resell

loans.name: San Juan De Matucana Group

texts.es:
SAN JUAN D. MATUCANA
Esta alcancía comunal participa diez personas quines trabajan con EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD más dos años y medio, los créditos que reciben lo invierten en sus negocios, sus ingresos contribuyen en los gastos D. sus hogares, así mismo mejoran su calidad D. vida. Así tenemos el caso D.:
Sarela M. E. nos cuenta que en su casa criaban animales (patos, pavos, conejos) éstos eran vendidos y también servía D. alimentos para ellos, tuvo además una llama (auquénido) que era la mascota D. la familia.
Sarela ya casada con un hijo llevó a su casa a un cuy que iba a ser sacrificado por su mamá sin saber que estaba preñada y que más adelante tendría ingresos, así compró un macho y así fueron aumentando cada vez más lo cual necesitaba D. un mayor capital para comprar el alimento (cullina, engorD. y pasto) es así que deciD. adquirir créditos para seguir trabajando, pero con el tiempo dejó D. hacerlo porque llegó a tener ciento cincuenta D. estos animalitos y ya no era lo suficiente para mantenerlos, lo cual tuvo que venderlos, juntó un capital que le serviría para la inicial D. una mototaxi que hoy en día la siguen pagando con los ingresos D. la mototaxi. Resultó más a cuenta este nuego negocio que ella y su esposo piensan comprar otra más porque actualmente su esposo no cuenta con un trabajo estable. D. esta manera Sarela seguirá siendo un apoyo en los gastos D. su familia. Necesita el préstamo porque quiere invertir en ropa (pantalones, casacas, edredones reversibles) lo cual lo venderá a sus amistades, conocidos porque es tiempo D. invierno.
texts.en:
The San Juan D. Matucana Communal Bank consists of ten people who have been working with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for more than 2½ years. The loans they have received were invested into their businesses. As a result, the income they generate help pay for their household expenses and improve their quality of life.

Take the example of Sarela M. E.. She tells us that she raises animals (ducks, turkeys, and rabbits) out of her home. Most of the animals are sold, but some are set asiD. to feed her family. She also has a llama that serves as the family pet. Sarela is married and has one child.

It all started one day when she brought home a guinea pig for her mother to prepare as a meal, but she did not know at the time she purchased it that it was pregnant. She eventually found out about it in time and was able to earn an income from the offspring. Sarela acquired a male guinea pig so that she could continue the momentum of her new business. She needed additional capital to buy food (grasses and feed for fattening) for the animals, so she applied for a loan so that she could keep her business running. At one point, she had as many as 150 guinea pigs, which was too much to handle. Sarela was able to sell all of the animals and use the capital to purchase a motorcycle taxi, from which she continues to receive rental income to this day.

Sarela and her husband are considering starting another business since he does not have a stable job at the moment. She continues to be the primary support for covering her family’s expenses. Sarela is requesting a loan to purchase trousers, jackets, and comforters. She plans to sell these items to friends and acquaintances for the winter season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase winter merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To organize his burger and fruit selling business.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Fifty-three-year-old Siham is a perfect example of dedication and effort. She works alone to support her only son and her paralyzed husband. She has a small business where she sells clothes in the streets of the city of Gaza in Palestine. She has been able to help her family pay for food expenses and medications.

At this time Siham turns to your heart to ask for a loan to buy more clothes to sell. She appreciates your kindness and generosity.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a successful father and dedicated husband. He has two children. Raed has a small grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs such as sweets, soft drinks, juices and other items. 

Today his clientele has grown greater and his grocery become more popular. He is asking for a loan so that he may expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store. Raed is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve successes in his business with this loan.

loans.use: To expand the variety of goods.

loans.name: Amera

texts.en: Amera Q. and her husband, Lorenzo, are engaged in the fishing business in their small village in Tabao, Zone 2, Valladolid, Negros Occidental, in the Philippines. They started off in this business without owning a fishing boat, even a small one, as they had no money to purchase one. Their recourse then was to hitch a ride with other fishermen in their boats, fish and sell the fish to the local community. However, with a lot of hard work and a desire to improve not only their quality of life but also the education of their three children, Amera joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 and slowly they were able to improve their business. They were able to buy their own fishing boat, purchase more nets, venture into catching crabs, and now they are able to sell these not only in the local community but also to businessmen, who sell their crabs and some fish in the big cities, getting them more margin on their catch. Now on her 13th loan cycle with NWTF-Project Dungganon, Amera earns between P6-16,000 a month from the business, which helps a lot in providing for their household expenses and sending her three children to school, and even allowing them to expand their fishing business. For her next loan, Amera needs P19,500 to purchase materials to build more nets to catch bigger crabs. At the same time she will use some of the money for additional working capital for the business, which will allow them to increase their catch and hopefully, save more money in the hopes of adding a few fishing boats to their fleet in the near future. About NWTF In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life which can be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To make more nets and provide additional working capital.

loans.name: Maktym's Group

texts.ru:
Чанчарова Мактым – лидер данной группы. Это второй её кредит на платформе Кива. Спасибо всем кредиторам Кива, которые помогли Мактым достичь желаемых целей. Мактым тридцать два года. Её муж был вынужден уехать в Россию на заработки. Сейчас Мактым живёт с четырьмя детьми и сама их обеспечивает, пока муж находится за рубежом. Старшему сыну Мактым десять, а младшей дочке всего два годика. Мактым удаётся при этом совмещать уход за детьми с работой. Сейчас, чтобы прокормить свою семью, Мактым занимается розничной торговлей детских вещей (детские пижамы, детские куртки, нижнее белье). Этим бизнесом Мактым начала заниматься, когда она с мужем переехала, из села в город. Соседка, увидев положение Мактым , тут же посоветовала заняться торговлей. Мактым быстро вошла в курс дела и за короткое время стала самостоятельным предпринимателем. Помимо того, что она обеспечивала свою семью, ей удалось приобрести кое – какую мебель, бытовую технику и контейнер.  Теперь имея свой контейнер, она намного свободнее распоряжается своими финансами и увереннее идёт на риск. Мактым очень повезло, так как в данное время ей также помогает её племянница. Ежемесячный доход Мактым составляет около 20000 сомов (USD 465). Принимая во внимание то, что она, когда только начинала торговать вложила всего пять тысяч сом (USD 116), успех Мактым очевиден. Сейчас Мактым нуждается в кредите, чтобы закупить товар на зимний сезон. Мактым очень надеется, что занятие торговлей поможет ей осуществить свою мечту: купить большой дом, приобрести автомашину и открыть свой магазин. 

У Мактым три партнёра по группе: Лира, Муктарали и Аширхан

Лире тридцать шесть. Она – мать пятерых детей. Муж Лиры занимается перевозкой пассажиров. А Лира торгует женскими вещами. Прежде Лира торговала в г. Бишкеке носками. Далее по совету сестры перешла на одежду. Ежемесячный доход Лиры – 15 000 coмов (USD 350). Сейчас Лире нужен кредит, чтобы купить товар на зимний сезон. 

Муктарали сорок три года. Муктарали торгует детскими вещами. Жена – домохозяйка. Торговля позволяет вполне удовлетворять все нужды своей семьи. У Муктарали трое детей. Старшая дочка помогает торговать, двое других детей учатся в школе. Муктарали надеется, что получив этот кредит, он сможет закупить товар на зимний сезон.
 
Аширхан шестьдесят лет. Она вырастила восемь детей. За исключением двух дочерей, все дети живут со своими семьями. Несмотря на свой возраст, Аширхан активно занимается торговлей: она продаёт халаты, национальные изделия. За счёт торговли Аширхан удалось купить три дома для сыновей. Сейчас она нуждается в кредите, чтобы закупить товар.
  
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Maktym C. is the group leader. This is her second Kiva loan, and she is thankful to all Kiva lenders who helped her reach her goals. Maktym is 32 years old. Her husband had to go to Russia for seasonal work. Now Maktym lives with four children and provides for them while her husband is abroad. Her elder son is ten years old, and her youngest daughter is just two years old. Maktym manages to combine work and childcare. In order to provide for her family, Maktym sells children's clothing (pajamas, jackets, underwear). She got involved in this business after she and her husband moved from their village to the city. A neighbor, having seen Maktym's situation, recommended her to go into sales. Maktym quickly became an independent entrepreneur. Maktym also purchased furniture, home appliances and a container. Now, having her own container, she has more freedom to manage her money and is more ready to risk. Maktym is lucky because her niece helps her around. Maktym's monthly income is 465 USD. Considering the fact that she invested only 116 USD in the beginning, her success is obvious. Now she needs another loan for buying winter clothing for sale. Maktym hopes that this business will help her realize her dreams: to buy a large house, a car, and to open a store. Maktym has three group partners: Lira, Muktarali and Ashirhan. Lira is a 36-year-old mother of six. Her husband is a driver. Lira sells women's clothing. In the past, she used to sell socks in Bishkek, but then, following the advice of her sister, she switched to clothes. Lira's monthly income is 350 USD. She is applying for a loan to buy winter clothes for sale. Muktarali is a 43-year-old father of three. He sells children's clothes, and his wife is a homemaker. Muktarali's business helps satisfy the family's needs. While their eldest daughter helps sell goods, the two other children are in school. Muktarali hopes to use the loan for the winter clothing. Ashirhan is a 60-year-old mother of eight. Apart from two daughters, all her children have left the parents' home and live with their own families. In spite of her age, Ashirhan is actively engaged in trade: she sells national clothing, etc. Thanks to her work Ashirhan bought three houses for her sons. Now she needs a loan to purchase goods for sale. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy seasonal assortment of children's clothes to meet seasonal demand for autumnal and winter clothes

loans.name: Apal's Group

texts.en:
Apal is the leader of this group. Having reached the age of 58, Apal can surely consider herself a happy woman as she has raised five children. All of them, except one son, already have their own families and live separately. Her eldest son is 40 and the youngest daughter is 24.

Nevertheless, Apal and her husband have preferred a shed and a busy daily routine of looking after cattle rather than a comfortable living room where they could sing a lullaby to their grandchildren. Always used to hard work and the smell of cattle, Apal and her husband are still working. They keep their own household. They are occupied with livestock raising and milk sales. These have been the main source of their sustenance for forty years.

Raising cattle has allowed them to successfully bring up the children not depending on government allowances or benefits. Selling milk alone provides them with a monthly income of $40. Whenever meat is needed, they always have cattle available for their needs.

Apal has applied for this loan and hopes that by means of this loan, she will be able to buy a milk cow and sell more milk. Her immediate plans are to conduct some repair work at home and see her son married. Apal has three partners: Jenishai, Tolkunai and Burulkan. Jenishai, 34, has three children. To provide for the family, her husband works as a carpenter. Jenisha, in her turn, trades in clothing. Jenishai learned to sell clothes from her sister. Now she has become an independent entrepreneur. Jenishai needs a loan to purchase goods. Tolkunai, 34, has three children. Tolkunai manufactures traditional items at her house and sells them in the capital. Her husband is a welder. Making national articles brings her $120. Tolkunai wants to sell more articles, so she has applied for the loan to purchase more fabric and threads. Burulkan, 49, has two daughters. Both of her daughters have married and live separately. Burulkan’s husband is engaged in trading in cattle, mainly sheep. Burulkan sells women's gowns. Burulkan hopes to obtain this loan to purchase goods. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow and sell more milk.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The client is a breadwinner for the family of five. This is his second loan from the microfinance institution. His first loan was $2,500 for his mini-market. With that loan he was able to increase his income and make regular and timely loan repayments. This loan is to purchase a vertical refrigerator and inventory for his store.

loans.use: To buy a vertical refrigerator and inventory for his store

loans.use: To buy drinks
